text: Can from City Beers, shared with Urbansprawl on their birthday. Jet black with a tan head. Aroma of licorice, toasted malt, coffee. Taste is coffee, burnt chocolate, vanilla, creamy malt mouth, really good!

Aroma is roasted malts, toffee, licorice and coffee. The palette is intense caramel, tossed oats, fig and espresso. The transition is to a slight earthiness and creaminess. Slight alcohol and warmth on end but not as harsh as I expected . Appearance is a jet back body with a thin beige head that retains OK.

750mL bottle. Pours black with a small light tan head. Aroma is coffee, cocoa, alcohol, sweet malt, and a little vanilla. Taste is coffee, caramel, light vanilla, roast, and a little cocoa. Good amount of booze on the tongue. Full body. Soft carbonation. Creamy, rich mouthfeel.

Just perfect. Dark and creamy without being overwhelming or too heavy. The palate hits you but also doesn't overwhelm. The coffee is delicious and pairs well with everything. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

One pint can into tulip. From Worlds End, Hobart. Super viscous black beer with thin tan head. Pours like motor oil from a can. Aroma is mild coffee, cocoa, and distant chocolate. Intense solid mouthful of flavour. Oh, wow. Overwhelming in its initial boozy richness. After Ive settled down a bit I notice toffee, raisins, cocoa, dark chocolate and late Irish coffee. Really sticky in the mouth and the glass. Its great but my dislike of coffee stops me rating it higher.

Pours out like a stream of Castrol GTX, thick creamy caramel head bubbles away on top of a beautifully dark slick of beer. It is so rich it shocks the senses, strong in coffee, intensity of a liquor. It stings the tongue a little but each sip the complexities reveal themselves, a wonderfully sticky malt, burnt toffee and luscious treacle, boy this is a head spinner, take it slow.

Czarne nieprzejrzyste, piana obfita, drobnopęcherzykowa, dość długo utrzymująca się. W aromacie głównie kawa, karmel, skórka chleba, lekkie nuty owocowe, alkohol niewyczuwalny. Smak również głównie kawowy, ale ta kawa nie przytłacza, jak czasem się zdarza w piwach z takim dodatkiem. Poza tym paloność, średnia goryczka. Idealnie ukryty alkohol, to jest niesamowite, że 12 procent może być prawie niewyczuwalne. RIS z najwyższej półki.
Aromat intensywny, czekoladowy, likierowy, trochę po ogrzaniu wychodzi sos sojowy. W smaku dosyć wysoka paloność, nuty kawowe z wytrawnym finiszem.

Tap (8.WFDP, Wrocław). Dark-brown with delicate beige head. Aroma is strong with chocolate, coffee, roasty notes and some booze. Sweet chocolate with roasty note in taste. Quite big bitterness and also a little bit booze note. Beer is full body, warming inside and in the throat, really good, sweet like liqueur with quite big dose of booze.

Creamy mouth feel. Subtle coffee tones. Nice maltiness and good depth. Hop bitterness nice offset to malt. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Drank during Hevelka bottle sharing. Aroma a little bit disappointing I was expecting more coffee and maybe some other typical imperial stout things but taste is awesome and well composed. Great beer
Drunk directly from the can. Aroma of coffee & dark chocolate. Black! Light sweet. Medium body, creamy texture & average carbonation.

Chocolatey with coffee, vanilla, raisin and dried cherry from start to finish.  Medium body with a creamy and sticky texture.  The sweetness and bitterness linger long after a sip- so pleasing.  Alcohol aroma up front briefly vanishes quickly otherwise its perfect.  Surprisingly smooth.   A bucket list stout.
Aus der Flasche (2015) 2017-05 getrunken. Ein Imperial Stout was durch seine perfekte Harmonie der Aromen (Schokolade, Mokka, Malz, leichte Süße, ganz leichter Hopfen) besticht. Traumstoff!

Zwart bier met bruine schuimkraag. Geur: koffie, noten, ietwat metaal. Smaak: koffie, geroosterde mout, alcoholisch, zwarte chocolade en wat drop. Matige koolzuurprikkel. Afdronk: geroosterde moutbitterheid.

Czarne, nieprzejrzyste. Piana brązowa, drobna, obfita, zostaje na powierzchni. W zapachu dużo kakao, czekolady, kawy, do tego paloność, troszkę karmelu. W smaku sporo kawy, paloności, do tego gorzka czekolada, trochę kakao. Alkohol pomimo 12% kompletnie niewyczuwalny. Goryczka niska, wysycenie niskie, posmak palony, gorzko-czekoladowy.

This used to be a favourite of mine back when barrel aging wasnt even a thing. Have not revisited this in years. This particular bottle was a 2014 bottle so just over 3 years old. Pours a oily dark almost black colour with a cream like head. Aroma has big big licorice which surprises me a little. Then whiffs of dark fruits, probably amplified a little by the cellaring, coffee, dark chocolate and big roast. The taste is roasty too and with lots of licorice. Getting next to no sweetness. Oily mouthfeel and a bitter, roasty aftertaste. Verdict: I prefer a fresher Speedway Stout.
UPDATED: JUN 6, 2017 Bote 50cl Tercer Tiempo (Santander) Aromas a malta, café y cacao, apariencia negra opaca, sabor con dominancia de café, muy buena cerveza, vale lo que cuesta.

Al club de tast de lOlut! 
Dels millors birrots que hi ha! petroli suprem! En llauna igual de bo que dampolla

Отличны& имперск& стаут. Лихая крепост& почти не ощущает& на удивлен& питкий.
h вкусе горький шоколад, кофе, орехи.
Shared bottle at Olut Sabadell. Pitch black with creamy head. Coffe and chocolate aromas. Creamy and buttery. You don't notice the alcohol at all.

This is my 1000th rating!
Pours black with a medium tan head that settles slowly. The boozy aroma is strong with this one, with plenty of coffee and chocolate, lesser caramel, and hints of licorice and raisin. The taste is bitter, but not overly so. Very mildly sweet as well. Alcohol and chocolate stand tall, heavy roasted malts are found, and I still get lots of coffee. Subtle undertones are licorice and vanilla. Long chocolate aftertaste. Its medium bodied, has a creamy texture, and with minimal carbonation. For as potent as this is, Im astonished by how smooth and easy this goes down. Especially by how much the alcohol presence comes through. I believe I have another contender for my favorite beer.
Can from Beers of the World. Aroma of coffee, chocolate, caramel, and dark fruits.
Pite na bieda bottle sharingu. Samo próbowało wyjść z puszki. Fajna kawa, dobry balans nic się nie wybija, ale było tam czegoś mega wybitnego. Jak na pozycję w rankingu lekki zawód.
From miguel. In Teku glass. Playing 8 Bit Adventures. Really smooth, creamy, balanced and the 12% ABV is completely hidden. Very pleasanat vanilla and milk chocolate notes. Deserves all the hype

Pitch black color, medium sized brown head. Quintessential Imperial stout aromas of roasted malt, chocolate, coffee, raisins, cocoa powder, toffee and slight vanilla. Taste of chocolate, coffee, chocolate covered coffee beans, roasted malt, caramel and cacao. Medium bitter finish from the coffee. Creamy, full bodied and well balanced - simply put: this beer is amazing.

Drunk from a Tallboy can brought at Kill the Cat, Brick Lane. Incredible beer. Fantastic aroma, roasted dark malts, chocolate and jet black appearance. Great head and overall staggering beer. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Mocno kawowe, czekoladowe, trochę kakaowe w zapachu. Smakowo bardzo zbalansowane, jest sporo kawy ale nie dominuje ona kompletnie nad wszystkim, jest dużo czekolady, są praliny, odrobina toffi. Delikatnie palone. Alko wyczuwalne bardzo delikatnie. Kremowe, długie, bardzo łatwo się to pije biorąc pod uwagę parametry. Oczekiwania były ogromne - efektu wow nie ma, ale całość jest co najmniej bardzo dobra
Puszka. Wytrawny, kawowy klasyk. A little bit overrated. Wersja podstawowa mniej atrakcyjna od swoich wariacji, za droga, ale zmierzyć z legendą się trzeba.

Ziarna kawy. Świeżo otwarta paczka z kawą. Espresso. Kremowa, dosyć treściwa konsystencja. Alkohol tak ukryty, że nawet nie grzeje w gardło. Wychodzi tylko na polikach. Spodziewałem się więcej. Kawa dominuje.

Aromat: kawa. czekolada, melasa, o dziwo mało intensywny.
Wygląd: czarne, smoliste, bardzo ładna jasnobeżowa warstwa drobnopęcherzykowej piany, chwilkę utrzymująca się.
Smak: aromat mnie nieco zmartwił, ale smak jest niezwykle dobry, pierwsze co nasuwa się na myśl to idealnie utrzymany balans miedzy kawą, czekoladą a palonością. Jest tu czekolada mleczna i gorzka, kawa najwyższej jakości, pralinki, słody palone, rodzynki. Dosyć proste ale jednocześnie niezwykle szlachetne, kremowe i wykwintne. Goryczka średnia, palona, dobrze kontrująca resztę, alkohol całkowicie ukryty, jedna z najlepszych kaw w piwie z jakimi się spotkałem. Na finiszu paloność, kawa i leciutka kwaskowatość od kawy. Niezwykle przyjemne odczucie gładkości, kremowości, likierowości pozostające w ustach, mimo dużej ilości ciała i alkoholu pije się bardzo lekko. Piwo światowej klasy, godne swej renomy.
Can. Pitch black pour with brown head. Aroma has chocolate, coffee and brown sugar. Thick texture. Full taste. Quite fresh and bitter dispite the ABV. Full body. Medium carbonation.

Aroma: roasted dark malts and coffee.
Appearance: jetblack and brown head.
Taste: coffee, bitter chocolate, roasted dark malts, smooth, warming alcohol, semi-dry.
Palate: full body and medium carbonation.
Overall: flat and bland, a huge disappointment.

Can shared at tasting. Pitch black beer with small beige head, good lacing. Aroma of strong coffee, espresso, coffee beans, roasty, with notes of dark chocolate and light raisins. Taste is medium to heavy sweet and medium bitter, dark chocolate, light caramel and raisins, lots of strong coffee, roasty, more coffee in the bitter finish. Body is close to full, texture is oily, smooth, carbonation is soft to average. Exceptionally well hidden alcohol. Excellent RIS, great balance in flavour and good coffee character. Lives up to the hype.

(On tap )
Aroma :roasted coffee,roasted malt,dark chocolate,alcohol.
Appearance:pitch black,small dense beige head with good retention.
Taste:sweet, flavour of coffee beans,smoked malt,dried fruits and millk chocolate,coffe slightly sour finish,roasty aftertaste.
Palate:medium to full body,bit thin,low carbonation.
Overall: Well made coffee-oriented with nice ( and strange) smoked component although its way too thin to be out there with the best in the game.

Can - pours jet black with a big creamy tan head. Aroma is roast malt, coffee and chocolate ovaltine malt. Taste is sweet with an immediate smooth malt hit, followed by a dry roast malt and coffee kick.would never think it is 12%!

Pours black with a small head.
Nose shows cocoa, booze, roasted malt and coffee.
Flavours include roasted malt, sweet bready notes, soft booze.
bomber pours black with cocoa head aroma is coffee chocalate and dark fruit tastes the same smooth warm finish very nice

2012 edition/Poured in snifter glass. Opaque motor oil black with huge bold coffee and dark chocolate aroma. Very complex flavor: dark fruits, Arabica beans, vanilla, brown sugar, roasted malts with a slight hop bite. 
Would love to get my hands on the bourbon barrel aged version.
Przepisane z pamięci w ramach uzupełnienia profilu. Za pierwszym razem mnie rozłożyło, no ale wtedy mało się piło jeszcze, powtórka nie zrobiła takiego łał, ale dalej szanuję.

UPDATED: APR 22, 2017 Gedronken op bierfestival 17, 5e biertje, op dit moment 11e beste bier ter wereld, ziet er goed uit, smaakt top, goed in balans, fijn mondgevoel, donkere haast zwarte kleur zoals het hoort, ruikt naar rozijnen, smaakt daar ook redelijk naar, gebrand, 100% volle smaak echt top

Bottle. It poured a black color with a tan head. The aroma was of coffee, some dark fruits, chocolate, caramel and a touch of licorice. The taste was similar to the aroma with more coffee, chocolate, licorice and dark fruits. Awesome.
A spectacular stout! Pours a perfect chocolate brown color. The aroma is coffee mixed with chocolate and fruit. A clean stout with a nice amount of bitter sweetness. Overall, an awesome beer!

Got the last bottle on the shelf at Total Wine on my most recent trip to Frisco, TX. The 750 ml black bottle pours a regal black body followed by a generous milk chocolate-colored head which laces nicely, a road map of the trip I am taking. The nose is rich with red berries,dark chocolate and burnt toast. The taste is a slam dunk, very full. It jumps out with the dark chocolate again, coffee, ripe plum, black licorice and a touch of hard candy sweetness. Superb. Distinguishes itself from other quality imperial stouts with a unusual, appealing bitterness throughout. This is what makes top end imperial stouts so fine. They are the same but they are different. They are different but they are the same. Really pleased to have the chance to consume this one.

Bottle @ deTolly baar.
Black color, creamy beige head. Aroma of toffee, caramel, cognac, coffee. Taste: bitter-sweetish with sour notes in the end, coffee, datk chocolate. ABV hodden. Well balanced. Medium carbo. Very enjoyable.
750mL; Pitch Black w prune colored tinge; slick bubbly head; Raisin, date, sweetbreads, cornmeal, crisp apple, pear, roasted bitter coffee bean. 12% no less, a real mans stout.
Bottle - I understand the 100/100 rating - yep, bloody lovely - creamy stout heaven - unflashly but perfect - so easy to slam down although Im sipping and savouring...

Draught at Alus Celle, Rīga. Darkest brown, almost black. Very little visible carbonation, so the appearance in ominously flat. Coffee dominates the aroma, but its an earthy, papery coffee. The real thing. Syrupy sweet taste, again dominated by the coffee but it never jars. Some salted caramel in the finish. Slick body with only a small amount of carbonation. An impressive and simple imperial stout.
This is absolute maximum for non-barrel aged IS. Coffee, roast and chocolate and perfectly balanced. Some plums and cherries are also present. A must-try beer.

Butelkowane 2013. Przede wszystkim dominacja słodów palonych. Piwo niezwykle złożone, fajna melasa, toffi, trochę karmelowe, czekolada, kawa. W tle trochę suszonych owoców, rodzynek. Trochę sosu sojowego Umiarkowanie do wysoce słodkiego. ALkohol bdb ukryty. Ciało racznej pełne, tekstura oleista/kremowa, niskie wysycenia. Wielkiego WOW tym piwem nie ma, jak dla mnie - po prosto bdb ukryty alkohol, palone tak jak powinno być, równowaga między palonością-słodyczą, a goryczką na wysokim poziomie. Po prostu good bre, ale nie outstanding ;)

Dark as midnight, with a nice head. This is what a stout is all sbout, dominating but smooth, creamy even. Loved the deep chocolate and coffee aroma, with flavors to match. From a bottle in my cellar, now I need to get another, cuz its just that good. Well done Alesmith.
Dit is mijn stout. Dik, creamy, pittig, plakkerig, geroosterd, koffie en chocolade in balans, alcoholisch, licht bitter, evenwicht, en vooral: geen poespas. Puur.

Butelka pite w domu. Kolor ciemny, nieprzejrzysty, piana mocna, pięknie osiada na szkle, jasnobrązowa. Aromat kawy i rodzynek i gorzkiej czekolady rozchodzi się tuż po otwarciu butelki, piękny, intensywny. W smaku łagodne, alkohol ukryty w sposób genialny. Jeden z lepszych stoutów jakie spożyłem.

Can. Pour is a motor oil thick black with a small tan head. Aroma is coffee, rich dark bitter bakers chocolate and some dark red fruit. Flavor is rich malt, not roasted malt but a thick chewy bitter malt and then I get some red berry fruit. Then comes a minor coffee and more of a dark chocolate malt that just lays on the tongue long after the swallow. Alcohol says hello after a few sips but its kind of in the back round. Such a rich dark malt with a little something different each sip.

A 750ml foiled bottle with no clear bottled on or best before date. Poured into a snifter glass. It was black in colour with a just over one finger tanned head that had good retention and left great lacing. Aromas of roasty malts, dark chocolate, coffee, caramel with hints of vanilla and dark fruit. Taste follows the aroma with roasted malts, dark chocolate, caramel, toffee, vanilla, coffee and dark fruits. It was creamy, velvety and smooth. Full bodied with light carbonation and light warming alcohol booze. Overall a very nice classic Imperial Stout. Very easy to drink with its nice coffee and chocolate flavours.
Długa data ważności. Mógłbym zostawić na później. Ale mi się nie udało. Doskonałe.
Black with an ash-brown head. Chocolate/coffee aroma and flavor. Big, bold and warming. Lots of roasted grain character with big malt flavor and a balancing hop bitterness. Super Imperial Stout.

strong roasted barley and coffee aromas, lesser notes of chocolate. pitch black in color, held up to a light zero light comes through. really nice long lasting brown head. heavy in body, silky mouthfeel. taste is strongly of coffee and roasted barley, light notes of chocolate and dark caramel. finishes smoothly, even at 12% no notes of booziness.
Black colour with brown foam. Taste of coffee, cocoa and chocolate. A really really good beer!

Wow. Very drinkable given the strength. Lots of coffee, toffee and dark chocolate in the malt. A little bit on the sweet side but thats unavoidable with this ABV. Hops give a background of pine and a slightly bitter aftertaste. Great brew.
LCI. Poured from the bottle. A beautiful black stout. Nose of roasted malts and coffee. Flavours of roasted malts and coffee. A thick body with an oily texture. Lovely in balance and flavour. Great!
Bomber. This was excellent (thanks Max)! So smooth, great chocolate and coffee bitterness. not at all cloying or treacley. Dark and inviting. Yum.

Piana niezbyt wysoka, acz drobna, zbita i bardzo trwała. Aromat mocno owocowy, chmielowy? Melon, jasne owoce, poza tym przyjemnie palony, kremowy. W smaku kremowe-palone, tudzież pewnie kawowe, ale niestety też wyraźnie kwaskowate przy finiszu. Strrrasznie psuje to odczucia. Lekko alkoholowe przy finiszu, a i alkohol wychodzi coraz bardziej w miarę ogrzewania. Pełnią to speedway nie oszłamia. Aromat dużo obiecywał, hype dużo obiecywał, a wyszła średniawka ;_;

Shared bomber. Nice black stout color, nice nose of coffee, dark chocolate, roast malt. Smooth and creamy palate. All the good characteristics of an imperial stout nicely balanced. High ABV nicely masked.

Alesmith speedway Stout 
Zapach czekolada, rodzynki, słodycz, przesłodzona czarna kawa 
Smak wkasnie ta przesłodzona kawa, troszke czekolady, słodko, alkohol niewyczuwalny, suszone owoce. 
Wychodzi lekkie żelazo, test na skórze ewidentnie potwierdził metalicznosc

240217. Bottle from Greenslopes Cellars. This is a very smooth and decadent beer that pours a dense black colour. Flavours of chocolate coated coffee beans. Big whack of alcohol in the finish. Glad I shared this bottle.
Paloność, niezła kawa, kakao, suszone owoce, żelazo. W smaku słodka czarna kawa, czerwone owoce, nuty palone, metal nadal obecny niestety. Nie ukrywam, spodziewałem się więcej.
Aromat rodzynki, czekolada, kawa lekka słodkość, paloność i niestety trochę metalu. W smaku czekolada, zero alkoholu, rodzynki. Mimo tego lekkiego metalu w aromacie piwo udane.
On tap at Crunchys. Smooth and packed with coffee. Smooth mouthfeel and pitch back.

Pours a very dark brown but not quite pitch black with a nice two finger khaki head. The aroma is dark fruits, plums, raisens, brown bread, bakers chocolate, and figs. The flavor is similar to the aroma and there is a little bit of bitterness but like from the espresso more so than hops. Good beer but I find it to be overrated but keep in mind I have a bottle from 2015. Would be curious to see if the coffee is more prevalent in a fresher bottle.

Pours deep black with nice creamy brown head. Nose is a sweet, boozy malt with coffee, vanilla, and oak. Taste is big and bready, wth dark chocolate and Expresso. Finish is very fruity with lots of fig, plum, and raisin. Medium bodied and very creamy. This is an excellent stout.

Smells like a hot brownie but the first tastes are hot fudge on a mild vanilla ice cream. Hot fudge sundae taste continues but a nice, dry bittering effect creeps up by the 3rd sip and stays with you. Nice balance. Very drinkable!
Vollmundig malziger Beginn. Erdige Noten, deutlich Kaffee, geringe Oxidation. Etwas wässrig im Mittelteil, dann alkoholisch, Noten von Heu. Holzig mit trockenem Kaffee zum Ende. 10/11/11/12/12/11

Pours silky black with some lacing. The nose on this beer is better than any beer I've whiffed. It has all the aroma of a Rochefort 10; Christmas pudding, plums, raisins, toffee, treacle; but with the unmistakeable toasty and roasty stout smells that any good imperial stout should exhibit. The let down (if you care to look for one) is that the flavour is noticeably more subdued than the aroma. It is velvety smooth though, with a real syrupy consistency. Just divine!

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Delcious beer. Had it first on a tap and it blown me away, so I had to try the one from a bottle and its also marvelous. Taste is full and rich, sweetness is well balanced by bitterness. Marks of coffee and pralines. Alcohol is well hidden.

Huge expectations after finally being able to get my hands on this one in Australia. 750ml bottle, bottle October 2016. Pours with a fantastic head for a beer of this size, sticky lacing. Many typical imperial stout flavours and aromas but the thing that struck me most was the perfection of the mouthfeel, carbonation and palate. Each of these aspects work in perfect harmony with one another. The balance of this beer is world class (ESPECIALLY for the ABV) and the flavours are delicious. Great Stuff.

Bardzo głęboki aromat czekolady i świeżo palonych ziaren kawy. Lekka pralina i kakao. W smaku degustacyjnie, czekoladowo-kawowo, gęsto likierowo i zakaskakująco pijalnie jak na parametry. Wspaniałe piwo.
Fantastic imperial stout. Big coffe aroma and Flavor. Very easy to drink. Near perfection
classic style beer very good, but for me a slight disappointment, maybe I had too big expectations

750ml bottle from 2014, bought from Brewdog.com (£15.25):
Great stuff from AleSmith again here & a beer that was every bit as good as Id hope for going in; it was definitely worth the wait in cracking this bottle open. The beer was kicked off by a lot of darker, roasted malts & coffee flavours but it was also a touch sweeter than expected thanks to the sugars & chocolate, but also the darker fruits & vanilla that featured too. The beer was quite rich & complex with good carbonation & only a little of the 12% abv. showing nearer the end of the nose & taste, something that helped the beer down very easily. The beer was very much a moreish offering with some dry touches nearer the end & some subtle darker fruits coming through to keep things interesting at times.; I really enjoyed drinking this one & it seemed to go down slightly better than the Vietnamese Coffee edition that I tried on-tap last year; an excellent beer that you definitely need to try, its one that Ill be on the hunt for again now.

Bottle, aged 1 year and a half. The bottle serves a black liquid with a quite big brown head. Aromas are coffee, brown sugar, caramel, roasted malt, chocolate. Amazing taste, the complexity of this liquid is Wow! Medium sweetness, roasted malt , chocolate, with a nice coffee presence, it is very good, the alcohol content isnt a problem at all, we barely feel it. Creamy, full body. One of the best Imperial Stout you can find out there!

One of the coolest things about drinking fine wine is the complexity of flavors that one picks up on the palate. This beer is like that! So many hidden little bursts of chocolate, coffee, caramel, roasted malt and the list goes on and on. All these tastes coming together to form one gigantic brew.

Aroma chocolate, coffee, roasty, alcohol, 
Appearance black, brown foam, 
Taste medium sweetness, lightly bitter, medium bitterness, 
Palate full body, thick feel, 
Overall a top stout that is not hard to get. Big roasted, chocolate, and coffee flavor. Nice creamy thick mouthfeel. Great beer to enjoy on a lazy cold Sunday. I would suggest this beer to a friend.

Piwo bardzo ciemno brązowe, prawie czarne, z beżową pianą. W aromacie czekolada, praliny, kawa, kakao, bardzo subtelny sos sojowy i nuty waniliowe. W smaku potężna dawka gorzkiej kawy. Oprócz tego mleczna czekolada, kakao, trochę rodzynek, delikatna ziemistość. Piwo jest bardzo gładkie i kremowe, ale nie jest jakoś totalnie gęste i wyklejające. Bardzo fajny i smaczny imperialny stout.

Quite black appearance with little head. Complex tastes of nonstop, coffee, caramel and star anise. Heavy body, great smooth carbonation and a finish of complex chocolate. Great complex heaven with surprisingly little alcohol taste
coffee, chocolate, roasty, toast, licorice, medium sweetness, medium bitterness, creamy,

Tomada en buena compañía en Vivalabirra. 
Color negro, opaco, con capa de espuma marrón de tres dedos de grosor (lenta formación, burbujas finas, compacta y de buena retención). Carbonatación imperceptible y diría que mínima. Aroma increíble a café, dulzón, también torrefacto (dark fruits también, aunque en aroma yo no las capto, pero están ahí). Sabor a dark fruits, torrefacto, mucho caramelo, con final de café algo amargo. Hay algo de alcohol pero llega como dos segundos después de haberla tragado y es muy mínimo. Muy cremosa y compleja. Imperial Stout irrepetible.

Pours a blackout curtain black, with a creamy nut-brown head that shows its thickness in thatbit supports itself. Aroma of coffee (obvious), molasses, brown sugar, maybe even a little dark leather. Mouthfeel is immediately creamy and even a bit chewy with small bubbles. Taste is exceedingly complex, with brandied cherries, sweet carmelized sugar with almost vegetal undertones. This is all on top of a powerful baseline of coffee, somewhat bitter steak char. Theres a lighter aftertaste than Id expect which is almost of banana and grass. On the eve of Donald Trumps inauguration, this thing is yuuuuge.

Almost black body with medium size light brown head. Aroma is roasted malts, chocolate, coffee with notes of alcohol. Flavour is roasted malt, coffee, chocolate, medium sweet, hops, medium bitter, little liquorice with notes of alcohol.

Pours thick with a big, billowing dark brown head; plenty of lace around the glass, and its pitch black in color of course. Complex nose of dark chocolates, buttery/creamy malts, lightly spiced, bitter honey, brown sugar, and of course a lot of bold, dark-roast coffee. The taste is just as complex as the nose. It arrives with bright, acidic coffee with a little bit of spice and hops before transitioning into a smooth, creamy malty middle. It finishes very nicely with plenty of bold coffee notes, brown sugar, and some alcohol. The warming of alcohol is present throughout the palate but is especially noticeable in the finish. Once warm, the coffee notes stand out the most and followed by some more sweetness and alcohol. Smooth, heavy body; low carbonation; finishes warm, long; dry as hell. Beautiful coffee imperial stout!! The strength is where it should be, and the complexity rewards in layers.

Bottle at fermentoren Copenhagen. Pours pitch black with a light tan head. Amazing aromas of lots of coffee, roasted malts and milk chocolate. Such a sweet and balanced aroma. Taste is more bitter, like dark chocolate and coffee. Full-bodied and kinda creamy with low carbornation.
Bardzo solidny RIS - aromat kawy, czekolady, ciemnych owoców. W smaku powtarzają się wrażenia z aromatu.

Svart och nästan trögflytande. Otroligt god och fyllig på alla sätt. Snygg och i världsklass.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bottle. Pitch black with a fading coffee brown bubbly head. Aroma is of coffee, dark fruits, chocolate, caramel, hint of liquorice. Taste is of dark chocolate, coffee, caramel, piney bitterness, dark fruits, liquorice. Chewy sticky oily mouthfeel, medium carbonation.

Pours dark brown but in the glass appears pitch black with a creamy tan head. Aroma is deep chocolate, coffee, roasted malts and a hint of licorice. The same in the mouth: coffee forward with dark chocolate, toffee, some dark fruits, hints of vanilla and licorice. Full body and creamy mouthfeel. So satisfying! So warm! So good!

Butla - Bierland Katowice


Klasyk nad klasykami!
Piana- po przelaniu piękna i gęsta
Aromat - czekolada (pralinki) kawa, palone słody, kokos, orzechy?
Smak - słodka kawa,czekolada, ciemne owoce
Faktura - gęsta

Alkohol dobrze ukryty. Piwo rewelacyjnie sesyjne. Do powolnej degustacji. Wersja podstawowa urywa tyłek, a leżaki pewnie kolejne części ciała :)
Shared bottle at oldbuttiken Copenhagen. Hard to find but great to share and low drinking, 2hours per bottle.

Personal rating #5656.  25.4oz foiled bottle, BOTTLED ON 01/27/16 (or 07/27/16, hard to tell). Nose strongly of chocolate and coffee, also tries to fill the room with the scent of alcohol. Pour is very dark brown thats not completely given over to the dark side but that collects as just sub-pitch in the glass, head is large and fluffy-rocky tan. Taste very sweet and very fruity, lots of red berry with plum, black currant, outright grape, and cherry. That fruit ester profile combined with fine mouthfeel reminds me of Belgian yeast at higher temps, sort of fresh Rochefort, but Im not sure it adds in what should otherwise be a sledgehammer of a beer. Chocolate, coffee, and licorice are the supporting base while the fruit just runs wild on top. Skips over the roastier and earthier notes though and permits only a thin, wispy bitterness. Super sticky lips and a light body (!?), warmth and fine/delicate burn in the throat, still too much alcohol showing roughly even if by intent; a dessert beer, subtle caramel and developing scorched notes behind the sugar, crème brûlée tinted dark. Its overrated for sure (seriously, Californians, this isnt any better than the boozers from Southern Tier), but still a treat. [2016.12.24: 3.7]

From the black foil wrapped 750 ml. bottle. Deep, black colored pour under a modest tan head. The head fades. The aroma is full of rich dark sweet malts, coffee-like characters, fig, prunes, dark bread, char, and a low but earthy hop profile. The 12% alcohol is almost invisible. Full, smooth body. The flavor is about as good as it gets and I gave it a "10" with all those dark sweet roasted malts, dark fruits, integrated alcohol, and slightly biting dry bitterness to finish. I can see why this gets 100 out of 100 although Im not prepared to go quite that high. But it is quite an amazing beer. It ran me about $15 for the bottle.

Purchased a bomber a couple of weeks ago. Pours black and thick with a creamy head and looks wonderful. It smells like licorice and prunes, and first taste is creamy, thick. Coffee is an aftertaste, vanilla cream, cookies. This is an awesome beer, same as Rasputin and Narwhal, but different.

Found in Houston, perhaps like all things, and no sir I really cant help the homeless. That is a complicated topic that requires an integration of policies regarding economics, labour, social mobility, and international currency hedging. Oh you just wanted cash, well fuck off then. This looks great but head is small, perhapd that is intentional, but great nonetheless. Nice licorice and sweet coffee liqueur on the nose, pumpernickel, mens musk and other pretentious stuff you can read about elsewhere. Flavour is a strong and sweet onslaught of barley and coffee, good dry finish and a perfect oily mouthfeel. Not layered so much but very drinkable, in the gallons worth. And the twelve percent is nowhere to be seen. Well done.

Poured deep, dark brown with a small, frothy beige head. Aroma of sweet caramel, roast malt, dark chocolate and coffee. Full body, flavour of the aroma, dry, bitter chocolate, a little lcoholic heat in it.

UPDATED: MAR 1, 2017 On tap at the brewery and a 750ml bottle later. Both were very similar. Aroma is that of roasted malt, coffee, with a slight hint of coconut. Appearance is ink black. The head on the draft version dissipated faster than that of the bottle, that could be due to several factors. Taste is more roasted malt, coconut, coffee, and chocolate. Full bodied with creamy mouthfeel.  Alcohol is very well hidden and sneaks up on you fast. Overall a world class non-barrel aged imperial stout.
Aus der Flasche getrunken (Suggestion from Getränkefeinkost Berlin, Dank an Kai). No words further. ..

Aromas of coffee and alcohol predominate. Also toffee, chocolate, plums, prunes and raisins. Hops provide a generalized bitterness.

Color is nearly black with a spare light-brown head.

The 12% alcohol provides a high degree of alcohol sweetness; there is a reasonable bitterness level with that generalized bitterness typical of imperial stouts.

Full bodied, prominent alcohol with its warming mouthfeel. Texture is creamy with slightly low carbonation. Finish is long with alcohol, coffee, plum.

Overall this is a very good beer. Its complex, lots of different aromas. However on the minus side I do feel the alcohol and coffee are too dominate.
On tap at Bloodhound Bar Brisbane. Pours black as night with thin tan head. Aroma of chocolate that carries thru to the palate with licorice undertones. Rich, rich, rich and delish.

Jet black with almost no head. Roma is extremely dark, rich stone fruit, coffee, huge molasses and toffee notes, caramel, good fruitcake -- very luxurious. Taste is sweet but not cloying with a velvety palate and a long, silky finish. A very good imperial stout.

750ml bottle from Caps and Taps. Pours black with good dirty tan head. Aroma is boozy fruit cake with coffee and chocolate. Taste is chocolate, coffee, molasses, boozy fruit cake. Lovely smooth mouthfeel. Doesnt drink at the ABV. A great beer.
Bottle. Black pour with a tan head with a reddish hue. Taste and aroma is dark fruit, roasted malt, chocolate and coffee. One of the best of the style.

Bottle at home. Pours thick black, foamy brown head. Aromas of coffee, caramel, toffee. Dark fruits too, though subtler than expected. Taste is initially a medium sweetness, with bitterness coming on stronger later, some alcohol but very well balanced. Body is heavy and it has a great silky soft feel. Finish is nice and lingering, with perfect balance of flavours. This one is really great.
Backlog, ocena przepisana z untappd, w ramach uzupełniania profilu na ratebeer.

750 ml bottle from Hawthorne Cellars. Pours pitch black with small to medium tan head. I let it warm for about 20 minutes before drinking. Great aroma of coffee and roasted malt. Smooth, velvety mouth flavour. Big coffee and caramel flavours up front supported by balanced hops and malt. Outstanding!

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Piana niska, beżowa, szybko opada do firanki. Za to już przy nalewaniu widać, że piwo jest gęste, oleiste i czarne jak smoła. Aromat średnio intensywny - głównie czekolada, praliny, kawa, porto, sherry, sos teriyaki...W smaku faktycznie gęste, pełne, treściwe, dość słodkie, z pokaźną dawką czekolady, karmelu, trufli, rodzynek, daktyli, kawy i porto. Całe to dobro pięknie kontruje palona goryczka i lekka pikantność od drobniutkiego CO2, które mimo że niskie, to lekko kłuje w język i sprawia przyjemne uczucie. W posmaku rum, wanilia, sos sojowy...

Bogate, pełne smaku, wyklejające, ciężkie, deserowe piwo do powolnego sączenia. Niewątpliwą zaletą jest faktura i nieźle ukryty alkohol, chociaż nie wiem jak smakuje świeże - u mnie spędziło rok na leżaku... Zawodzi nieco delikatny aromat...

Ps.

Degustacja z okazji 1000cznej oceny na ratebeer.com...
(bottle) clear, bright, very dark brown colour with a small brown head; aroma of smoked fruit, roast, hint of soy sauce; intense, balanced flavour, bit boozy, long medium bitter finish; smooth palate

Flaska från Beergium, provning med ölsällskapet. Åtminstone ett år gammal flaska. Svart med fingerhögt, gräddigt, krämbeiget skum. Doft av toffee, inlagda bär, choklad, kakao, lätt syrliga toner. Stor kropp, len och rund i munnen. Toffee, kola, torkad frukt, kaffe, lite lakrits, härligt brända toner. Relativt stor beska i avslutningen. Kaffet kanske försvunnit en aning, tyvärr. Smaken ligger kvar länge i munnen. Växer till en fin choklad- och kakaoton och lite kaffesump och toffee. Lite värmande alkoholtoner som drar åt bourbon och brännvin. Gillat den bättre när jag druckit den tidigare, men är fortfarande en väldigt bra stout, utan tvekan. Känns överlag som att den drar mer åt toffee/kola/torkad frukt och lite choklad än åt kaffe och kärvare, rostade toner. Len och rund. Gott!
This is an incredible stout. Pours about one finger of head, strong yet smooth start and finishes with light coffee notes.

Everything that it is built up to be. Speedway is absolute perfection. Decadent in the glass with black velvet color and smooth brown fudge head of foam. Loads of cocoa and coffee on the nose and pallet with lush caramel and prune supporting flavors.

Tap @ Gollem Antwerp

Everything youd expect from a good imperial stout. Not spectacular though.
Aroma of coffee, chocolate, leather, roasted malts. Tast eof chocolate, coffee, light green peppers, vanilla, dark malts and licorice. Quite thin. Solid, easy drinkable for 12%.

UPDATED: OCT 13, 2016 Dark brown color with mocha head. Aroma has sweet malt and chocolate pralines with coffee liquor. Taste is quite malty and sweet at first but the coffee bitterness and roasted malt takes quickly over. Medium body and carbonation. Quite boozy for a coffee stout, kind of overhyped.

UPDATED: FEB 9, 2017 (bottle, speedway tasting) deepest brown colour with a frothy beige head. aroma of fudge, cold coffee and vanilla icing, very juicy, with big notes of chocolate cake, cornflakes and caramelized grain. flavour is mostly yakitori and chocolate syrup, with lots of toasted malts, a very light sweetness, some ash, ethanol and a long roasted-bitter finish. heavy-bodied with average carbonation.


old rate: (bottle) black in colour with a frothy dark beige head. aroma of green apple and ethanol, with lots of roasted malts, brown sugar, earth and soy sauce. flavour is mostly roasted malts, barnacles and hazelnuts, quite boozy, with some notes of banana skins and boiled oysters in the semi-roasted-bitter finish. heavy-bodied with soft carbonation. 6/4/8/3/15 - 3.6

Bottle at home. Pours black with a medium tan head that fades fairly quickly to a small tan head. Aroma is coffee, dark chocolate, molasses. Taste is big coffee, roasty, slight plum, dark chocolate, smoothness, slight burnt caramel. Lovely.

12%ABV. Imperial stout.

Poured out oily black. I dont really comment on the head, but this one had a rich creamy cafe au lait colored head. 40ºSRM.

Nose is actually milky and sweet and reminiscent of caramel, toffee, dates. The roasty aromas are coffee, charred wood, light wood smoke, Over ripe stone fruit with honey prunes and black plums being top on my list. Dark grape juice.

Mouthfeel is full and syrupy. Palate has maple syrup, dates, date palm sugar and dark caramel and burnt sugar. Light creme brulee. Nice hit of alcohol up front and in the middle. Malt palate is broad with maltesers, malted milkshakes providing a strong almost milky base on which to taste the roasted barley and coffee flavors. The bitter takes on a fuller, more pleasing dimension because it is "lengthened" by the malt. There is a spicy component ot the tail end of the palate as well, medicinal and spicy, with anise and licorice, overall comes across like ouzo.

Finish is wood smoke and pleasingly lingering.

Overall, an impressive imperial stout that is smooth and gentle on the palate releasing the complexity of flavor in a very controlled fashion over the entire tasting experience.

Goes on Favorites List!

Pours pitch black with a small brown head. Smells strongly of coffee and dark chocolate. Taste is sweet, coffee, hints of oak and vanilla, subtle alcohol. Full-bodied with a smooth texture and soft mouth-carbonation, AleSmith Speedway Stout finishes with a lingering roasty bitterness.

(En fût à la source): Riches noisettes, arôme de cold brew, chocolat noir et petits fruits.Earlier Rating: 4/7/2016 Total Score: 4.6(En cask à lObservation Room): Tout dabord la texture est impeccable et la mousse sagrippe aux parois à la moindre occasion. Laspect chocolaté est encore plus présent quà lhabitude, le café est assez fruité et pratiquement fumé, très riche avec une moelleuse torréfaction. Superbe.Earlier Rating: 2/6/2012 Total Score: 4.5Très fumé, rôti, chocolaté, fruité avec une finale de café et de feuilles de tabac. Tapisse bien la bouche mais se boit quand même facilement pour sa grosseur.

22 ounce bottle poured to wine glass
Sight: Black, light does not go through, brown foam
Smell: fragrant, not boozy even with high alcohol content
Taste: excellent low, bitterness long follow through
Feel: long finish, creamy, good follow through and lingering aftertaste
Overall: excellent beer, repeat: yes, look for: yes
Chocolate. Malt. Soy sauce. Pours solid black with a thin dark tan head that fizzles away pretty quick. Cocoa. Nuts. Smooth with a bitter finish. A little booziness on the finish but not 12% worth.

Pitch black, Brown head
Aroma: Lots and lots of coffee, burnt malt, bitter chocolate brown sugar. 
Taste: oily, coffee, bitter chocolate, little vanilla, little boozy.

750ml bottle purchased at the Beverage Warehouse in Winooski, VT. Pours jet black with a thick frothy whipped cream head. Smells intense of sweet coffee, cocoa and vanilla. Taste of dark cocoa, roasted coffee and vanilla and a slight boozy taste. Unbelievable mouthfeel, thick smooth. Love it. Great commercial beer. Absolutely top notch.
Draft. Jack black. Stick full body. Tastes coffee and toasty. Chocolate. Licorice. Awesome.

UPDATED: MAY 9, 2017 [Tap, 4hops]. W aromacie kawa z wanilią. Pojawia się mleczna czekolada. Wyczuwalny mocniejszy alkohol, troche w storne bourbonu i paloności. Barwa czarna, nieprzejrzysta. Bardzo gęste, świetnie ułożone. W smaku kawa, czekolada na pierwszym planie. W tle wiśnie w czekoladzie. Konkretny waniliowy finisz. Alkohol dobrze przykryty, fajnie rozgrzewa w przełyku. Po kilku łykach wychodzi karmel, toffi. Bardzo pijalne jak na RISa. Nasycenie niskie, takie jak powinno być. Godne zapamiętania dzięki swojej gęstości, przez którą ślinianki caly czas pracują. Świetne piwo, klasa.

Bouteille achetée chez Erzbierschof et gardée 4 ans en cave - De couleur noir avec une fine mousse fauve qui disparaît vite - Au nez des arômes de cuire, café, malt rôti, mocca, chocolat, une pointe dalcool, un nez absolument fabuleux - En bouche encor plus de café et de chocolat, malt rôti, légèrement madere, grosse présence dalcool, légèrement terreuse - Corp puissant, amertume moyenne/forte, carbonation correcte, soyeuse, final alcool et café - Absolument incroyable, un équilibre parfait, des arones puissant, un poil trop alcoolisée mais un vrai regal

My first one had an initial aroma of coffee, dark chocolate, some fruits and alcohol was also present. Apperance of used motor oil with a thick dark tan head that settled quickly, and left plenty of lace. Flavors of roasted coffee, which was heavy all the way through. It also had hints of fruit and the dark chocolate was also quite noticeable. Together they all blended well even though the roasted coffee was dominant, still the others managed to get noticed. Overall a pretty fine brew, i am glad i finally found some. However on opening my second last night it wasnt as enjoyable because the alcohol dominated everything in both smell and flavor, it was kind of disappointing in comparison to my first sample. Guess that i will have to drink a third one to see what the truth is.Originally rated on 10/7/2008.

Big bottle from AleSmith Brewery 
chocolate, coffee, toast, roasty, herbs, alcohol, vanilla, brown-black, hazy, frothy, brown foam, light sweetness, medium bitterness, full body, thick feel, sticky, creamy, soft carbonation, long finish,

The aroma is coffee/raisin, maybe a touch of anise. Pours black with a big and creamy light brown head, mostly diminishing and excellent lacing. The taste is sweet. The body is full, the texture creamy, the carbonation lively and the finish long. Very Good!!

UPDATED: MAY 9, 2017 750ml : (in a Sam Smiths Imperial Stout snifter) I was excited to pick a couple of these up at Brewdog ... Wow , now I dont keep tabs on my subdued indifference toward craft beer and my jaded outlook, but Ive not been excited by a beer in about 47 months . The nose is really sublime .. the first thought as the aroma intertwined and melted into my mind was Sri Lankas Lion Stout , my all time favourite stout ... The notes of dark fruit like prune and rich caramel mixing like C3po at a gay robot party hosted by RichTheVillian. Roast malt and shitload of coffee . Huge beige head resembling the moon ... above a blackness thats almost as cool as Tupac . Rich and powerful to drink .... The first glass had an intensive bitterness that took away some of the otherwise delicious flavour, but the second two glasses were departed in this hindrance- way more rounded and soft . Notes are grate . Roast and deeply coffeeish . ( Im gonna open another bottle soon) and finish this rate off . Give me 20 minutes.: 750ml number 2 .  This might be a cooler beer than 20 minutes ago ... Im twenty minutes more drunk and a second 750ml is even more charming. I gave the palate a humble 3 because of the relentless fucken bitterness that burnt my palate like a Cuban if Im incoherent , but its  departed in the alchemy of the overall spirit of Speedway Stout. Maybe a superior bottle?. Who gives a shit? , this is fucken good  xsnobe bier.

One of those occasions where the hype is justified... This pours opaque black with brown head that fades to a clingy ring. Aroma is vanilla, chocolate and mild roast. No alcohol to be detected. Flavor is similar. Sweet notes of chocolate coat the tongue... Im so burned out on coffee stouts I was hesitant about this one... but the coffee flavor is mild and delicious in the background. Its so smooth and clean-finishing. Im going to stock up more bottles in the cellar.
UPDATED: AUG 31, 2016 From a bottle at Brass Tap. Pours dark brown with a light brown head. Chocolate and vanilla coffee bitterness on the finish. Heavy mouthfeel.

Yummeh! Was excited when I spotted some AleSmith bottles at a local shop a couple months ago as Id long heard of them but never had any. Certainly worth the wait! Dark and rich and complex with roasted coffee and bittersweet chocolate and lots of more subtle aromas and flavors swirling around in there. Heres hoping some of the variations on this brew start showing up around here, as well!

UPDATED: SEP 14, 2016 Puur zwart bier met mokkakleurige schuimkraag. Aroma en smaken van koffie (bonen), pure chocolade, vanille. Licht zoetig met een heerlijke cacao-afdronk. Alcohol zeer goed verstopt. Verraderlijk maar hemels bier.

Piwo leżakowane było ponad rok i jest pierwszym piwem, które kupiłem w sklepie Bierland - Kraina 1000 Piw ;-) 
 Kolor:  Czarny, nieprzejrzysty. Ciemny jak smoła. 
 Piana:  Beżowa, drobnoziarnista, średniej wysokości. Opada do grubej oponki. Przy przechylaniu sniftera pięknie spływa po ściankach otaczając całą powierzchnię szkła. Lacing b.dobry, chociaż nie perfekcyjny. 
 Zapach:  Aromat jest pierwszorzędny. 
Od pierwszego niuchu nozdrza atakuje słodycz cukru trzcinowego, odrobiny wanilli, dużo karmelu. W oddali ciemne owoce i delikatna paloność.
Czekolada deserowa miesza się z pralinkami z dodatkiem szlachetnego alkoholu w środku. Zapach bardzo wyraźny i kompleksowy. 
 Smak:  Pierwsze skojarzenia to śliwki w czekoladzie. Potem odrobina wiśni.
Potężna czekoladowa słodycz. Pralinki czekoladowe oblane karmelem. W dalszym rzucie sporo wanilii. Na końcu języka kawa Mocca ze spienionym gorącym mlekiem.
Odrobina toffi i przypalony karmel. Piwo jest słodkie, tęgie, rozpływające się w ustach. Paloności jest zaledwie odrobina. Pełne ciało, monstrualna tekstura. RIS jest gęsty, oleisty, jedwabisty. Słodycz rozchodzi się równomiernie po ustach, podniebieniu i spływa wprost do żołądka.
Goryczka średnia w kierunku niskiej. Finisz lekko kawowy.
Alkohol rozgrzewa od środka, ale jest bardzo dobrze ułożony.
Myślę, że świeższa warka mogłaby być alkoholowa. Leżakowanie ułożyło alkohol i sprawiło, że odczucie w ustach jest bardzo gładkie. Delikatnie zbyt wysokie wysycenie.
Zamiast niskiego - średnie.
Doskonały trunek! Degustacyny i szlachetny. 
 Wysycenie:  Średnie. 
 Podsumowanie:  

Perfekcyjny Russian Imperial Stout. Może nie mój Top 3, ale z całą pewnością Top 10.
Warto było przeleżakować to piwo ponad rok. Alkohol się ułożył, a aromat i smak bardziej się wyostrzył.
W smaku i aromacie złożone, wielowarstwowe z wieloma akcentami. Z najważniejszych z nich: wiśnie w czekoladzie, śliwki, kakao, wanilia, cukier trzcinowy, przypalony karmel, toffi, kawa z mlekiem i gęsta czekolada.
Zaledwie odrobina paloności.
Tęgie, jedwabiste, oleiste ciało.
Alkohol pięknie ułożony. Nie można chcieć niczego więcej.
Jest pięknie ;-)

Deep black with creamy brown head. Aroma is cherries and dark chocolate. A little coffee. Taste is fresh cherry stuff with lots of chocolate, very bittersweet a little fruity sourness as well. A little smoke on the tongue and a little spicyness while swallowing. Great. Smooth. I like it.

Bottle to tulip
Consummation: Coffee, coffee, chocolate
Adjunct: Chocolate, coffee, good stuff, caramel

Pours a dark black color with a brown head, good retention, decent lacing. Aroma is roasted coffee and chocolate. Taste is very much the same as aroma. Both which are done very nicely i may add. Medium soft body. Nice drink.

Black with foamy lasting Lacy brown head; aroma is of coffee and plastic; flava is roasty malt notes of coffee bread and alcohol; feels thick creamy very slight fizz; finishes dry roasty and malty sweet some hints of coffee and licorice

Pours a jet black with a thin tan head. Aroma is roast, chocolate, booze, dark fruit, and almost wood-like notes. Flavor is sweet chocolate, roast, dark fruits, toffee, and some booze. Has a thick, smooth body with soft carbonation. Delicious.
Bottle, several times. Dark black colour. Roasted aroma, taste of coffee and chocolate.

750ml bottle. Pours an opaque pitch black with a medium, creamy, long lasting, brown head that leaves plenty of lacing. Sweet aroma of roasted malt, dark chocolate, coffee, licorice and caramel. Sweet flavour of licorice, roasted malt, dark chocolate, dark fruit, caramel and toffee with a bitter coffee finish. Full body with a thick, creamy, smooth texture and soft carbonation. Excellent. A world class imperial stout.

Van het vat bij Beerlovers Bar te Antwerpen U: zwart met donkerbruine schuimkraag G: koffie, geroosterd mout en gedroogd fruit S: Koffiebitterheid in de aanzet, pure chocolade en cacao. Moutbittere afdronk. Lekker sticky. TOP!
This is to beers as to what ports are to wines. Excellent flavor and complexity but at the expense of being a niche beer.

On tap at brewpub. A black ale with a resilient beige head. Aroma is chocolate, coffee, roast, ash. Flavor is chocolate, coffee, hazelnut. Finish is chocolate, loads of coffee, strong bitterness. A tad bit of roasted hazelnut in there, too. Full body, velvety and oily mouthfeel, weak to average carbonation. Very solid!

0,5l bottle at home from Beergium. Pours pitch black colour, oily texture, some head that transposes with the bottom and fades after a while. Aroma of coffee and roasted malts, cocoa, licorice, chocolaty caramel sweetness, some bitterness in the back. Medium roasted coffee and malts, not too dark. Quite strong and full-bodied taste, bitterness smooths it well, but isnt too bitter. Simple while being complex in many ways, high ABV is unnoticeable. A lot of coffee in this Imperial Stout, enjoyable from bottom to top.
Very dark brown with a dense tan head. Smooth chocolate aroma with minimal coffee. Tastes like 6% even though its 12.

75cl bottle at home. Pitch black, thick, beige creamy head. Huge bodied, roasted malty dark chocolate, espresso, vanilla, butterscotch, nutty, to the finish more bitter, smoke, leather. Nicely building roasted malty, bitter finish. Velvety soft mouthfeel, medium carbonation. Very well executed, balanced and bodied but a tat too bitter to my taste.

Pours pitch black with almost no head. Lots of roast in the aroma. Notes of bitter chocolate, caramel, anise and dark fruit. Lots of dark roast in the flavor as well. Notes of caramel, anise and dark fruit. Full body. Creamy texture. Alcohol is well hidden. Lasting bitter finish. Fantastic.

Pours black with a beige head, clingy lacing. Aromas of roasted malts, espresso, chocolate. Taste is dark chocolate, coffee, sweet malts and roast. Very good.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

I probably had this for the first time around a decade ago. I bet this has come around a few tastings in life. I always thought I enjoyed this beer. Have had a few of the variants on tap as well. But I saw this beer on tap at Chucks for 6.50 for 16oz and was able to use my little growler (a gift from McBerko and maybe the best thing he has ever given me). I thought this is my chance to really check this beer out again. I am highly disappointed. It tastes like sweet chocolate syrup with a bug burst of roasted and acidic malts. You can see the sweetness covering up a lot of the acidity. It comes off as cheap Hershey syrup but thick. You know how that cheap chocolate syrup has a tartness to it, well that is present here from the acidity. Really messes with the palate. An alcohol heat is present as well. Again, the sweetness covers it up but it peaks through anyway. Again diminishing the beer. I can see why in a small burst, at a tasting, and a decade ago I could have loved this. Or maybe the beer was better a decade ago, I am sure Alesmith has gone through some changes. But at the moment, this is not the the imperial stout I am searching for.
user_location: HdG (past: NYC, KS, Rain City), Maryland, USA

text: This Imperial Stout is okay and obviously made with malt and hops. There is also maybe some coffee and some sort of alcohol in it.
Tap at beergeek. Aroma of nuts,caramel sweets. Taste of plumbs, roasted coffee,nuts, higher % of alcohol.
Pours a thick oily black with no head. Smells of dark cocoa, coffee, herbal hops. Taste is bitter, moderately sweet - all dark roast and thick.

Servida en un Spiegelau Tulip. APARIENCIA: de color totalmente negra, no pasa nada de luz a través de ella; corona de espuma color beige de buena retención, con burbujas compactas y algunas abiertas.

AROMA: es dominante el café tostado, chocolate semiamargo, algo licorosa, caramelo, toffee, melaza, ligeramente algo de frutos oscuros como dátiles y pasas.

SABOR: en boca se siente ligeramente dulce de inicio, seguido de puro café tostado y sus características torrefactas, además de chocolate semiamargo y eso lo que domina, atrás notas de caramelo, melaza, nuevamente los frutos oscuros pero sólo de manera sutil. El retrogusto un amargor medio con una larga permanencia del sabor a café y muy ligeramente dulce.

SENSACIÓN: cuerpo completo con una gran sensación untuosa, baja carbonatación. El alcohol se llega a sentir ligeramente en boca y en garganta de manera cálida, nada agresivo.

RESUMEN: Excelente imperial stout con un impecable uso de adjuntos.
Black, faint foam. Roasted, sweet, licoricy and strong aroma. Well roasted. Dry. Full body. Slightly sweet with roasted, almost burned aftertaste. Slightly boozy maybe.

Wow beer #800. Dark brown colour with beige head going to the sides of the glass. Aroma has dark roasted malts, dried fruits, dark chocolate. Taste has dark roasted coffee flavours and malts, Full body and medium carbonation. Sadly nothing special here.

Bottle a black colored beer with a beige head aroma roasted malts coffee chocolate caramel dried fruits spicy and bitter hops flavor roasted malts spicy dark fruits caramel dried fruits coffee mocha chocolate citrus spicy and hops

Tap @ WFDP 2016. Pours jet black, with almost no head. Strong aroma of chocolate, some coffee. Taste is moderately sweet, with well marked bitterness. Very oily texture, soft carbonation. Very rich taste and perfectly hidden alcohol.

Shared 25.4 oz. bottle. Pours almost black with a tan head. Aroma of roasted malt and coffee. Taste is roasted malt, coffee, caramel, and chocolate. Full-bodied, creamy texture. Dangerously drinkable; I would have never guessed it is 12% ABV. Fantastic.

Aroma: lots of chocolate malt, some coffee; Appearance: pitch black with tan head that dissipates slowly; good lacing; Taste: rich, roasty, boozy, coffee and vanilla notes; very nice; Palate: very heavy body with long, sweet finish; Overall: excellent quality stout without resorting to flavor additions or barrel aging; would definitely buy again.

Pours a dark brown to black with a half inch head of thick tan foam. Medium carbonation with plenty of lacing. Pleasant aroma of roasted sweet malts and a hint of coffee. Thick, rich, an creamy texture. Very smooth with bold malts and dark chocolate taste. Full mouth feel with lingering flavors. Finishes with a rich roasted coffee taste that isnt too overpowering. Well balanced and it hides the alcohol well. Very enjoyable.

Probably the best imperial stout Ive had.  Very nice coffee flavor and full bodied.  The high alcohol content complements the taste rather than being overly noticeable.  ---Rated via Beer Buddy for Android

Sampled from tap at Beertemple. Pitch black with a beige head. Sweetish, roasty aroma of coffee, dark chocolate, mocca and praline. Sweetish-malty, rather roasty taste of hard roasted coffee, dark chocolate, mocca, praline and some licorice, followed by a long, roasty-bitter finish. Full body, very creamy mouthfeel, soft carbonation. Lovely! Especially the balance of this beer is outstanding.
Third at cbc Covent Garden although closer to a half thanks to generous pouring. Very intense. Fantastic stuff. In the vein of old Rasputin and other premium stouts. Great.

On tap at Cerveteca Lisboa, Portugal. Pours pitch black with creamy persistent thin beige head. Aroma of dark chocolate, licorice, coffee, toasted malts, spices. Taste is bittersweet, with long bitter finish. Dark chocolate, toasted bread. Full bodied, average carbonation, alcohol warms. Excellent brew.

UPDATED: MAY 30, 2016 Jak mówi? wzorcowy, legendarny stout z Zachodniego Wybrze?a. Sprawdzam. Aromat intryguj?cy, ?wie?e ciasto dro?d?owe (panettone?), trawa, kandyzowana zielenina w typie tataraku (ktgo starszy, ten pami?ta). Piana niedu?a, be?owa, g?sta, szybko opada (12% ABV robi swoje). W smaku skoncentrowana s?odowo??, rodzynki, posmak suszono-owocowy w stylu belgijskich quadrupli. Pocz?tkowa goryczka (jakby kawowa) szybko ust?puje miejsca s?odowo?ci. Generalnie piwo jest troch? jednowymiarowe, s?odowo??, wr?cz s?odycz skutecznie przykrywaj? reszt?. Alkohol znakomicie ukryty. Dobre, ?wietnie si? pije ale nie jaki? zupe?ny RIS-wy top.

Bottle. Pours dark brown with brownish sticky head. Aroma: lot of coffee, dark chocolate, roasted. Taste: bitter with some up coming sweetness, coffee, roasted malts, bitter dark chocolate, Full body. bitter finish. Really nice.
Black liquid with tan head. Aroma of chocolate, coffee, raisins. Tastes same, medium sweet, medium bitter, light sour. Full body, oily feel, average carbonation, long finish, astringent,
750 ml bottle pours black with a brown head. Aroma of chocolate, coffee, vanilla and some fruit. Taste is coffee and chocolate.
Very very solid stout. Well worth the price. Chocolate, coffee, malt, vanilla. But nothing really stands out.

UPDATED: MAY 24, 2016 On tap at Alesmith brewpub. Jet black. Fruity deep cocoa caramel capuccino. Super bomb deep complex flavors of cocoa, milky malty stout, but the finish is heavy as fuck and hits ya. Surprised and then not. Fanfuckingtastic.

UPDATED: MAY 22, 2016 750ml bottle at Jameys. Vintage 2015. Pours like an oil, very dat, almost black color with a brown head. Aroma is bourbon, wood, candied fruits, roasted malt. Taste is sweet, dark fruits, bourbon, oak. Sweet, roasted malt aftertaste. Really well done!

CBC16, red session, tap. Black with a beige head. Aroma heavy malty (roasted, dark chocolate, coffee, dark fruit, caramel/toffee). Flavor coffee, then medium sweet and bitter, round and smooth. Full body.

UPDATED: MAY 22, 2016 Kran w Jabeerwocky
WYGLĄD: Barwa czarna, nieprzejrzyste. Piana drobna, niska. 
AROMAT: Średnio intensywny. Głównym motywem są...przejrzałe jabłka?? Może inaczej: lekko stęchły. W tle bardzo dużo kawy. 
SMAK: Ciemne słody. Posmak kawowy, długi. Świetnie ukryty alkohol, choć z czasem uderza do głowy.
OGÓLNIE: Generalnie ogromny zawód. I tu nawet nie chodzi o
 pokładane w nim nadzieje, po prostu zarówno smak i aromat pozostawiają wiele do życzenia. A mówimy tutaj o teoretycznie piwie ponad przeciętnym. Być może, a raczej na pewno jest to kwestia "świeżości" piwa, jeżeli w ogóle możemy mówić o takowej w przypadku RISa.

UPDATED: MAY 20, 2016 Totalmente negra, turva, espuma marrom de ótima formação e perfeita persistência, aspecto cremoso como café espresso (no início), perde a cremosidade com o tempo de copo, irregular. Aroma tende para o café, torrado de média torrefação, cacau, licor de chocolate, álcool muito bem inserido. Corpo licoroso, média carbonatação, cremosa, quase uma milk stout. Final tende para o torrado e café, coco, baunilha, álcool passa a ser mais perceptível com o aumento da temperatura. Maravilhosa
Black coloured. Without cap. Fully and thick. Some notes of chocolate and coffeee.

Bottle bought at the tasting room in San Diego. Black in the glass, beige creamy head. Very roasty at the nose, more coffee than malt. Little bit fruity background. Taste starts with a lot of coffee. Fruity background. Later getting little bit alcoholic. But also smooth. Sweetness in the second row, little bit sticky. Enjoyable stuff.

Aroma sweet coffee chocolate caramel, taste slightly bitter starting but becomes sweet quickly, lots of chocolate, coffee, rosted malts, liqueur.full thick body, components very well balanced, no overwhelming. aftertaste long lasting, slowly fading, also sweet on tongue, palate, throat too. slightly bitter chocolate with dominating sweetness. Alcohol content well hidden.
Bottle. Pours an opaque jet black color with khaki colored head. Coffee, roasted malt, and sweet chocolate on the nose; follows onto the palate. Full bodied. Finishes with coffee and cocoa

Coffee, some cocoa, some alcohol, pitch black with a creamy and persistant brown head, super full body, law carbonation, coffee, chocolate,caramel, smoked notes in the mouth e infinite in the aftertaste, alcohol is very well hidden...like a creature of a god.

Tap at the Republic, Minneapolis. Pours pitch black, huge tan head. Aroma is massively roasted malt, chocolate, coffee. Very robust. Flavor is chocolate, roasted malt, just so flavorful, robust and aggressive. Phenomenal.

Aroma: coffee, chocolate, prune, roast, vanilla
Taste: dark roasted coffee, chocolate, vanilla.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

OLD NOTES!
Pitch black and oily with a very nice dense brown head that lace the glass. Looks like a dessert. 
Lots of dark chocolate withsome liqeur and vanilla like sweet touch too it. Like a chocolate praline. Simple but luxurious.
Taste is also pretty straightforward with lots of cacao, sweet dark chocolate, liqueur praline and fruity notes of cherry and grapefruit. Some alcoholwarmth in the finish.
Big round oily body with soft carbonation.
Very good stout.

Beautiful. Completely black and oily, with a tiny layer of mocha coloured foam. Retains its appearance.
Aroma: quite mild; but the aroma that there is, is intense. Loads of coffee, complex and dark malts. Some hoppy aromas, herbal tones. 
Flavour: perfect imperial stout. Thick and oily mouthfeel, bitter but not too much, beautiful roast character. Loads of coffee (espresso) and some hints of chocolate. Some caramel. Dry finish, a little warming but very balanced and mild for 12% abv. 
Awesome imperial stout, definitely one of the best if not the best I have had.

Bottle (shared by rask0lnikov, thanks). Pours black with beige head. Aroma is roast, coffee, malt, dark chocolate, sweetness. Flavor is sweet and bitter, sticky, roast, coffee, dark chocolate. Finish is coffee bitter with warming alcohol. Overall: great.

Bottle. Dark brown colour. Beige head. Hints of sour coffee beans, cocoa, vanilla in the aroma. Chocolate, coffee beans at first. Hints of caramel and vanilla. Cocoa in the middle. Bready, sour finish. Caramel in the aftertaste. Smooth, silky palate. Very well balanced. Tasty beer.

Pours black brown with average brown creamy head. Aroma is heavy dark chocolate, coffee, milk chocolate, vanilla, roasted malts. Hint of smoke and toffee in mouth. Medium sweet, medium to heavy bitter, long lingering aftertaste. Medium to full body, creamy palate, soft carbonation. Super balanced, smooth and slick chocolate impy, one of the best Ive had.
A big bottle bought from Bottle Baron, Edinburgh. Pours lovely & black. Coffee & toffee richness very smooth with some vanilla. A very boozy truly wonderful beer.

Fles gekocht via firmabier.nl, gedeeld en uitgeschonken in 33 cl. Struise glazen. Zwart bier, ondoorzichtig, enigszins olieachtig met een volle lichtbruine schuimkraag. De koffie is het meest dominant in het aroma, gevolgd door tonen van chocolade, geroosterde mout, vanille en donker fruit als pruimen en rozijnen. Het smaakpallet is vrij zoet voor een Imperial Stout, veel koffie, gebalanceerd met zoetere chocolade tonen, en een lichte bitterheid van geroosterde mout en hop. De carbonatie is zacht, en de afdronk is lang en zacht bitter, alcoholisch verwarmend. Een prachtige complexe Stout, maar nog niet het maximale niveau, ik heb nog betere op, ook uit de USA, zoals de Serpents Stout van Lost Abbey. Dit bier ga ik zeker nogmaals kopen voor een verdere beoordeling.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
This beer continues to be my benchmark for imperial stouts. Simply superb in every respect

What is left to say? This authentic Imperial Stout legend has all that is required to break the record... the commercial deScription says it all. I must add that the extremelly smooth on texture (low carbonation) is a huge point in favour. Overall, a great beer.

Poured from a Big bottle into a cold pint glass, extremely dark brown with a chocolate head that fades quickly leaving some nice lacing. Aroma is of dark fruits, toffee, caramel and licorice. The body is full and the texture is creamy. Soft carbonation, good balance, roasted finish with a noticeable ABV warmth. A superb stout will highly recommend to my friends..
Tap @Szynkarnia. Complex aroma: chocolate, vanilla, coffee, caramel. Minimal head. Medium sweetness, medium bitterness. Soft carbonation. Very good.

Aroma: chocolate, vanilla, caramel, coffee, plum, light alcohol
Taste: medium sweet, medium bitter, chocolate, roasty, caramel, vanilla, alcohol

UPDATED: FEB 8, 2017

Aroma:

Medium/heavy aroma of malts, caramel, vanilla, chocolate, mocha, roasted malts and coffee.

Appearance:

Opaque black beer with a slight/medium brown/dark brown head.

Taste/Palate:

Starts medium/heavy sweet with malts, caramel, vanilla, chocolate; ends slightly bitter and dry with roasted malts and coffee.

Overall:

This beer ia intense, complex and balanced. Ultimate balance between the rather sweet start and the extreme coffee flavour at the end. Perfect flavour thanks to this. The aroma could have been stronger and the palate thicker, but it is an amazing beer nonetheless.
Aroma of chocolate, coffee, caramel, some green apple in the background. Black color, brown head. Medium sweetness, soft carbonation. Very nice.

Big bottle from Haskells and consumed during Oklahoma/Oregon game. Commonshawn also imbibing. Luxurious tan head on a deep black colored stout. Nose has subtle coffee nuttiness but leans on a dark fruit characteristic more than anticipated. First thing you notice about this one is a silky smooth initial mouthfeel that gives way to a good bite and warmth towards the end. Flavors of coffee are relatively quiet except in the aftertaste. Little bit of chocolate mixes well with a dark fruit/raisin element. Alcohol presence felt but not excessive. Maybe a little more coffee as it warms. This beer feels like a treat. Not something I would sit down and drink regularly but something I would get excited to have for many a special occasion.

Big bottle from Haskells with commonmac. Black with tan head. Looks great, but head and lacing dissipate Beautiful aroma, some tartness which is unusual. Rich, toffee coffee, high sweetness. Super smooth. Maybe a tinge of dark fruit tartness. Alcohol comes out more as it warms. Also get more sweet vanilla notes. This is a terrific stout.

Appearance: Pours extremely dark/blk with a tan head. Nose: coffee, chocolate and some roasted barley. Mouth/Feel: Thick and Creamy. Taste: Slight sweetness, roasted coffee, touch of dark chocolate. Overall nice Stout. Overall: 4 out of 5

Bottle, 75cL. @Naintré with my parents. A shining black beer with a medium creamy beige "oily" head ; average retention. Coffee, dark chocolate, toast, caramel, light prune. Medium sweet, round, light dry bitter, light warming baseline. Full body, average texture, light creamy, average carbonation, sweet coffee light bitter finish. Overall, truely delicious, nice coffee character ; maybe too much caramel character "rough around the edges" and lack of texture, to be perfect.

Poured from a 26 oz bottle, extremely dark brown with a tan head that fades quickly leaving a some nice lacing. Aroma is coffee, chocolate and some roasted malts. Flavor is heavy on the coffee with a mild chocolate finish. Very nice texture, thick and cream and its very easy to drink. Excellent beer, the first Ive hard from Alesmith, it wont be the last.

Aroma of roasted coffee, bitter dark chocolate, sweet alcohol. 
Pours pitch black, small brown head. 
Really nice medium to high coffee bitterness, light sweetness. 
The roasty coffee is really good. Full and thick mouthfeel, lasting roasted coffee in the aftertaste. Brilliant.

Poured from a 750ml bottle into a tulip: Pours dark brown with a one finger tan head. Aroma of roasted malt, chocolate, light coffee, toffee, and a little bit of vanilla. Taste initially is a little sweet, but that fades as the beer warms. Dark chocolate, light coffee notes, toffee, caramel, and roasted malt. Full body, slightly sticky, really outstanding stout.

A pitch black full-bodied stout that manages to balance rather sharp and agressive malty and hoppy flavours, as well as the prominent sweetness and bitterness. The aroma and taste are rich, complex and simply amazing, with coffee and liquorice standing out. Currently the best beer I have ever had.
Sweet, coffee flavor with a bold taste and rich mouth feel. Very tasty, definitely recommended

UPDATED: JUN 10, 2017 Puszka: Barwa ciemnobrunatna, piana brązowa, zbita, drobno i sredniopęcherzykowa. W aromacie mocna paloność przywodząca na myśl skojarzenia z piwem wędzonym. Jest gorzka czekolada, ciemne owoce i kawa. Do tego dochodzą jeszcze aromaty chmielowe. Całość bardzo ładnie zbalansowana. W smaku wytrawne, mocno palone z bardzo przyjemną sporą goryczką. Tym razem alkohol zamaskowany, brak wad w postaci aldehydu octowego. Piwo jak na swoje parametry ekstremalnie pijalne, wrecz zdradliwe. Warto zasugerować się napisem na puszce: DRINK FRESH ze wzgledu na profil chmielowy.

Butelka 750ml: Piwo czarne, nieprzejrzyste. Piana beżowa, zbudowana z bardzo drobnych pęcherzyków. Wygląda świetnie. W aromacie niestety dominuje aldehyd octowy. Pod nim majacza nuty glownie kawowe, jest palonosc i czekolada a takze alkohol. W smaku juz jest lepiej, sporo kawy, palonosc, tofi, czekolada i dosc mocno wyczuwalny alkohol. Piwo mogłoby być bardziej ułożone. Warto byloby je potrzymac jakis czas w piwnicy. Podsumowując: Piwo jest zbyt alkoholowe i calosc psuje okrutny aldehyd octowy.
Excellent balanced: coffee, roast, a little chocolate aromas and taste, caramel and malt. Medium sweet, medium bitter, between light and medium sour. Very nice, but a little boring.

Bottle
Aroma-chocolate, coffee, caramel, 
Appearance-black, hazy, brown foam, 
Taste-medium sweetness, medium bitterness, medium sourness, 
Palate-full body, thick feel, average carbonation, long finish, 
Overall-perfect

Aroma: Dark chocolate, coffee, roasted malts, dark fruits, toffee, caramel, very intense.
Appearance: Pitch-black, tan 1-finger head. 
Taste: Medium sweet, medium bitter, everything from aroma you can also notice in taste. 
Palate: Full body, creamy slick texture, soft to medium carbonation, smooth, long medium sweet finish. 
Overall: Really masterly balanced, delicious, easy to drink for abv, world class imperial stout.

Bottle 0.75l from ippopotamo36.Thanks bro.Taste at Tommie birthday party Pozarevac Serbia.11.01.2016.Pour it dark color with thick black head.Aroma dark chocolate quality one.Taste smooto chocolate milk, mocha coffee, vanilla sticks.Perfect body.Great hidden 12% alcohol. Earthy, just pinch of bitter at the end.Really awesome.
Poured from a bottle and the aroma shouts quality. Opaque black color. Strong aroma of chocolate, malts and coffee. Definitely does not taste like 12%.

Poured from 1 pt 9.4 fl oz bottle (not aged). Black with tan head. Aroma of chocolate and coffee permeates the room as soon as the bottle is opened. Taste is an excellent balance of bitter chocolate and roast malt with coffee overtones and mild licorice. Alcohol tastes quite mild, 12% is hidden. Will have to try aging one...

Bottle pour from Wallys (bottle date 12/15/15). Aroma is strong roasted coffee, chocolate, toffee, dark fruits, alcohol, mild anise. Appearance is opaque black with the faintest of brown when the glass is tipped to allow shallow amount or when viewed from below. Two finger-width light brown foamy head with mild lacing, nice crinkly sound of head. Taste is strong sweet as nose with mild bitter balance but anise is more pronounced. Palate is light-to-medium bodied with thin, yet creamy, texture and average to lively carbonation with warmth to esophagus and stomach. Overall, certainly a lot going on here. It would be interesting to have this age and see the difference versus a young version. To be perfect, slightly more lacing and slightly fuller palate would fit the bill for me, though the lighter palate contributes to its drinkability. You wont be disappointed.

75cl Bottle, straight from my brother Bob in la jolla SD. I know it sounds ridiculous but has been kept a year and a half in a fridge. Pours a cappuccino full brown dense head, shiny black petrol look with dark brown reflex. Now comes the best thing of this brew imo, the aroma, 11/10. Full cocoa, sweet roasted, caramel, with a really bourbon like warm feel and aromas, wrapping and with a milkshake, boozy chcocolate fantastic feel, boero like for italians.Taste is huge towards a mellow coffee, with cocoa and caramel hints, some vanilla, amarena/black cherry, wood; you can see it as a "corretto"(with booze/grappa addition) macchiato espresso, the milky touch seems really there. Medium plus level sweetness, incredibly well dosed, low to medium roasted coffee bitterness; overall a bit on the sweet side but incredibly balanced and so pleasant. Creamy mouthfeel, medium to full bodied. The final sweet roastiness plus the boozy bourbon finish leaves the palate with a full aftertaste. Comparable only with the top shelf barrel/aged stouts; would like to try other editions of this. Incredible stuff, smoothest imperial stout Ive ever tasted
very huge mouthfeel. but very smooth very such a strong stout. had on draft at flying saucer ft worth

Bottle tall boys beers market Leeds tasting room. Black ok tan head. Aroma is caramel coffee choc alcohol taste same nice sweetness some saltiness good roasty bitter supreme balance no sign of abv!! Great body. Very good!!

UPDATED: MAR 30, 2016 dark brown pour some dark tan head. Aroma char, licorice, blackberries and cream. Tastes caramel, coffee, licorice dense flavors on top of each other. lots of carb

rerated - one month later - this time its a lot more coffee.  Savory coffee with bbq mesquite wood notes.  sweet smoke.  coffee infused chocolate bbq sauce.  thick.

On tap at hopaholic. Black colour with a small brown longlasting head. This is how a beer should look like. Nose of roasted malts with coffee as it gets warmer. Taste is rosted coffee with dark chocolate. Holy moly this beer....
Bottle. Coffee is present, but very equilibrated. Full body and medium carbonation. Aroma: coffee, caramelo, roasted malts. Flavours: coffee, chocolate, roasted and caramel malt. Very good

Tasted from the tap on the 09/02/2016. First beer in Copenhagen trip!!! Pours pitch black with a medium brown head. Aroma of heavy roasted malts, lots of licorice, raisins, coffee, chocolate and hints of alcohol. Taste is heavy chocolate, vanilla, caramel, toffee with a lot of coffee. Low carbonation and heavy body. Next one please!

Aroma: Dark chocolate and black coffee

Appearance: Black colour and rich head

Taste: Medium bitter and umami

Palate: Full body, creamy texture, soft carbonation and the Aroma finishes smoothly. Perfect balance!

Bottle pour at home. 

Beer deserves high ratings - very good aroma, great lingering taste. 

Extremely well hidden 12% abv.
Near black inky pour with a khaki head. Aroma is dark and milk chocolate, coffee, caramel, and roast. Taste follows the nose. Layers of flavor. Full slick palate. Great stout.

Bottle. Pours pitch black with nice lasting brown head. Good lacing. Heavy Malty aroma, roasted, coffee, caramel, chocolate and liquorice. The flavours starts heavy sweet but turns heavy bitter. Longlasting bitterness and taste of coffee and liquorice with peppery notes. The body is full and the texture is creamy. Soft carbonation. Good balance. A super beer - so good.

Bottle at home. Three years old. Pours a black color with a small light brown head. Complex aroma of coffee beans, oak, caramel, hazel nuts, liquor, biscuit, dark chocolate and brown sugar. Roasted flavor with ash, coffee beans, dark chocolate, oak and cocoa. Soft and silky mouth feel, full-bodied and a medium bitterness. Well-roasted ale and incredibly tasteful.
Very good. Chocolate and sweet after a year in the basement. I didnt taste much coffee. Good but not better than many other offerings.
