Delicious complex aroma of tiramisù, balanced taste of coffee, cream, toffee, chocolate e chi più ne ha, più ne metta...
Probably the best non-barrel aged stout currently made. In an age of barrel aged stouts this one still hangs in there with the best of them.

Black. 
Very full body, dense flavor, smooth, not as hot as one should expect, avg length. 
Bittersweet, refreshing but mild acidity. 
Strong and complex flavors, prunes, cherries. 
Quite delicious. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

UPDATED: JUN 5, 2016 750 ml bottle from Systembolaget. Black coloured with a large mocha head. Aroma of roasted barley, caramel, dried fruits, coffee, dark chocolate, vanilla and alcohol. Taste reflects the aroma, but less sweetness than I thought. Medium bodied. Medium bitterness. And low to medium carbonation. "Personally I prefer a bit more thickness and oily texture from a stout of this strength. Other than that its very tasteful, perfectly balanced, with high drinkability."
Bomber - dark pour with a tan head. Nice aroma of coffee and chocolate. Dark chocolate, vanilla, mocha. Silky smooth body. Very complex. This is an excellent beer.

UPDATED: MAY 4, 2017 Bottle and can from Bottle Baron. Black body with a thick tan head. Excellent lacing. Aroma of espresso, raisin, chocolate ice-cream, nuts, green pepper, caramel and liquorice. Flavour of roasted barley, nuts, charred wood, plum, creamy chocolate and a hint of coconut and hops. Medium body with a silky smooth texture. Soft fizz. Luxurious and outrageously drinkable. Sensational.

Bottle shared with the bro. Pours a dark black with a dark brown head which fades. Aromas of coffee beans, raisins, roasted malts plums and sweet caramel. Flavour is mild bitter dark chocolate, caramel and coffee. Slight bitterness but unbelievably smooth with very little alcohol burn! Incredible beer.
Aroma av lakris, røstet malt, mørk sjokolade. Smak av lakris, mørk sjokolade, karamell, mørk frukt og røstet malt. Tykk og mørk. Fint balansert og ganske lett å drikke!

75 cl, bottiglia del 2015.
Marrone molto scura con riflessi caramello, praticamente nera, schiuma nocciola di buona persistenza.
Aroma di caffè tostato, cacao e cioccolato fondente, frutti rossi, toffee.
Al palato cioccolato fondente, caffè tostato, amarene, toffee, alcool ben percettibile che scalda la bevuta e permane nella sua coda mista a toffee, cacao e caffè tostato.
Corpo pieno, carbonazione medio-bassa, oleosa ma non pastosa.
dark, deep brown, almost black color, most intensive cacao aroma and chocolate, a bit coffe taste, after a while more alcohol was felled

Kolor: niemal ?e czarne, klarowne.,
Piana: niezbyt obfita, drobnop?cherzykowa, trwa?a, zdobi szk?o.
Zapach: intensywna czekolada, praliny,kakao, delikatna palono??, lekki alkohol.
Smak: spora pe?nia, aksamitno??,du?o gorzkiej czekolady, kakao,lekka palono??, goryczka ?rednia dobrze kontruj?ca s?odycz, do?? wyra?ny alkohol, piek?cy.
Wysycenie: ?rednoe, do niskiego.
Medium nougat colored head. Aroma; roasted malt, dark chocolate, a touch of coffee, resin and vanilla. Flavours; roasted malt, dark chocolate, vanilla, coffee, resin, and some cherrie

0,75 bottle purchased at the Hoppy Imports in Greece, consumed in Serbia. Black pour with a consistent brownish head, not much retention. Nose is a blast of dark chocolate, grounded cocoa, burnt malts, some grassy notes. Very rough! Nice. Mouth: unexpected 12 ABV, spirit soul, rough feel again of burnt malts, dark chocolate dominates the scene. Anise too. Bitter than expected. Nice!!!

Aroma: Chocolate, licorice, dried dark fruits, wood Appearance: Dark brown, black, almost no see through, fine bubble foam, beige medium think head, re glow, medium lace Taste: Dark dried fruits, chocolate, coffee, booze, light dry bitter finish

UPDATED: JAN 30, 2017 bottle: very dark, clear mahogany pour with a tall tan head thats slow to rise, and that has good retention. Notes of roasted malts, molasses, caramel, sweet brewed coffee, dark chocolate, some sweet cherries in the background. Full body, thick but not cloy. Dangerously drinkable.

Bomber sampled at home one evening (review from memory) - lots of coffee in this stout, as was expected, but other than that not many surprises. A well made stout, rich flavours of roasted malts, dark chocolate and some dark cherries. 4.1/5

UPDATED: JUL 5, 2016 Pours black with a large frothy light brown head that slowly fades to a nice thick cap. AROMA: dark rich malt, coffee, chocolate, roasty, spices, herbal hops, molasses, brown sugar, dark dry fruit, slight raisin, vanilla, smoke, herbs, earthy, boozy and slight peppercorn. TASTE: dark rich malt, coffee, chocolate, roasty, spices, hop spice, molasses, brown sugar, soy sauce, dark dry fruit, slight raisin, vanilla, smoke, herbs, earthy, boozy and slight peppercorn. AFTER TASTE: rich roasty malt, chocolate, coffee, spices and hop resin with a thick rich boozy finish.

Rewelacyjny aromat kawowo  czekoladowego likieru z dodatkiem czegoś mocniejszego. W smaku kawa i goryczka dominują nad czekoladą (kawa bardziej, goryczka trochę dyskretniej) i spychają ją na nieco dalszy plan. Piwo jest gęste i mocne. Może nie jest doskonałe ale na pewno jest bardzo, bardzo dobre.
Big, boozy, delicious Imperial Stout. The booze doesnt let all of the coffee flavor come through, but its still delicious.
Что может быть лучше, чем Спидвей на Новый Год? Конечно, я ожидал большег& но сыграл типичны& америка& подход - имперцу не хватает эмоций.
Bottle. Pours Black with thick tan head. Aroma is Chocolate and Malt. Taste is is rich chocolate with coffee notes with a sweet chocolate alcohol malt finish. Excellent

Wow! Pours into the glass a virtual black, with the deepest of mahogany-ruby fringes. The dark brown head is huge and soapy, reducing to chunky lace. The nose is of deep chocolates, lightly roasted coffee, dark fruity esters... just yummy! Flavors are sweet and bitter chocolates, roasted coffee beans, caramel, sweet dark stone fruits, lactose sugars, and finishes with luscious milk chocolate, roasted coffee and light bitters to accent. A full body, easy quaff and substantial complexity makes this a top-tier Impy Stout from AleSmith! Gorgeous!

From tap. Pours pitch black with a brown head. Aroma of heavy roasted malts, lots of licorice, light plums and raisins, coffee, light chocolate, slight hint of alcohol. Taste is heavy chocolate, super smooth, vanilla, toffee and caramel, hints of coffee, low carbonation.

Full size bottle. Have had it for 2 years. WOW. Very dark in the glass. Plenty of carbonation lends to a rich foamy head. Like the commercial deScription says...chocolate, roast malts, caramel and coffee. Plenty of intense aromas. Bitterness of the chocolate / coffee surprisingly tolerable. Not sure how this could be better.
Sehr gutes Imperial Stout, viel Kaffee, Schokolade. Würzig, süß, Lakritz, sehr sehr süß für den Alkoholgehalt. Lecker und wenig Alkohol im Geschmack.

UPDATED: MAY 15, 2016 (01/03/2016) Tap at Uiltje bar, Haarlem. Massive chocolate aroma, roasted malts. Taste is sweet, chocolate, roasted malts, hint of alcohol. Nice!...but bottle is better...8/4/8/4/16 (05/15/2016) Draft at Beertemple, Amsterdam. Black with a beige head. Aroma of chocolate, roasted malts. Taste is.moderate to heavy sweet, moderate bitter, sweet dark chocolate, roasted malts. Bitter chocolate aftertaste with some warming alcohol. Nice.

På fat Orsted. Ja jävlar va härlig krämig åh trots ölen är för kall. Jävligt god blandning mellan kaffe och choklad. Mest fint bryggkaffe i smaken . Alkoholen märks inte alls bara en smakförstärkare .

Aroma of chocolate, coffee, treacle and christmas cake. Pours oily dark brown with dense honeycomb head. Upfront coffee and alcohol gives way to christmas pudding, dried dates, chocolate and burnt caramel. Roasted malt and sweet treacle come through towards the finish then finally hints of vanilla linger with the warm glow of that alcohol returning along with those dates. Changed character from first opening to second glass and beyond, like a red wine. Nice!  ---Rated via Beer Buddy for Android

Bottle on Christmas Eve. This is close to a textbook example of a non-BA imperial stout. Roasted and coffee notes throughout, but not at all overpowering. This is just a really well made, super tasty imperial stout.

UPDATED: JAN 27, 2016 Draught. Black colour, brown head. Aroma is lots of cognac and praline, behind it some coffee and chocolate, a bit of ash. Medium bitterness. Full body, thick, smooth, very soft carbonation. So intensive that you may think you are drinking something stronger. Impressive, but I wont call it my favourite imperial stout.

Bottled in March 2015. 
L: pours very dark with a dark tan head that leaves lots of lacing. 
S: not as coffee forward as Id expected, worn off a bit due to age? Dark chocolate, roasted malts. 
T: a full rich malt flavour, notes of coffee, cocoa, anise. 
F: a flawless feel, thick and creamy that carries a bitter finish. Warmth from alcohol rather than the taste of it. 
O: one of the greats.

verjaardagsbiertje, schenkt zwart met bruine kraag. aroma van mout, zoetig, chocolade, koffie, gebrande en geroosterde mout. Smaken zijn redelijk zoet, matig bitter, sterk, matig fruitig, redelijke gebrande en geroosterde mouten, vanille, mocca, drop, chocolade. volle body, dik romig en glad van textuur, lage co2, lange afdronk. prima

Speedway stout is one of the best of examples of imperial stouts that are produced. You can smell the roasted malts and the appearance of almost black coal. The tastes chocolate, coffee, and tobacco. It hits your palate with solid thick richness of one of the better stouts on the market. We now are fortunate to get it in the Chicago market. Cheers!
Tan head on jet black pour. Coffee and toffee aroma. Wonderful taste of silky chocolate and coffee and plenty of anise floating around. Great lingering complex finish. World class.

St. Stephens treat. Bottle is at least 2.5 years old but might be more. Pours black with negligible beige head. Nose is a balanced mix of coffee, 
vanilla, chocolate and licorice. Winelike with coffee and chocolate. Sweet and bitter at the same time. Like the little brother of Dark Horizon and Black without the eccentricities.

Second Stout of Christmas and entirely excellent! Pours oily and viscous with a very small tan head. Taste wise- wow! Coffee, chocolate, leather and malty goodness combined beautifully. Drank with Christmas pudding and the stout cut through the richness and piled on flavours to the rich fruits and sherry booze of the pudding. Not sure if Stouts can get much better than this!
Shared a bomber with the wife on Christmas Eve. Big beer but smooth for 12%. Nice for a special treat. Hint of chocolate, booze, toffee.

Aroma of roasty malt, chocolate and coffee. Dark unclear liquid with a long lasting fine brown foam. Medium-high sweetness and medium bitterness - perfectly balanced and very smooth. Soft carbonation, full body, creamy texture and a long lasting mild coffee-chocolate taste. Fantastic beer!

Obvious chocolate and coffee aroma, but not very strong and dissipates quickly. The colour is deep and dark, but the head soon fades and it is not as thick pouring as you'd expect for the strength. 
That said, it is the taste and mouthfeel that make this stand out; velvety smooth and with light, frothy carbonation it slides into your mouth invitingly. The overall taste is so finely balanced it is hard to distinguish all the flavours, which is a good thing, especially given the coffee included, as that can often dominate. Instead, as it washes over your tongue in a pleasant wave of dark roasted malts and bittering hops and coffee, everything mixes in together to create a surprisingly easy drinking and mellow stout.

Big bottle from Vinmonopolet Bestillingsutvalget. Shared with Finn, Elisabeth, Jan Erik and Stefan. Inky black body with a deep rustic tint. Espresso head, dissipating. Attractive and powerful aromas of vanilla chocolate and molasses, slightly roasted. Comprehensive taste profile of dark bread, chocolate, liquorice, mild molasses and raisin. Long-lived ending of roasted coffee with warming heat from the alcohol. Velvety in the mouth. Top notch (Big bottle session, Tromsø 16.12.2015).

Aroma of dark coffee, toffee, and chocolate with some tart berry. Light brown head and dark black body with a reddish hue. Flavors of cocoa and berry with some black coffee and sweet caramel. Smooth on the palate

Flaske 750ml fra Vinmonopolet Tromsdalen. Delt med janeriks, Rune, Snegurochka og TheCellarer på Nerstranda 16 Des 12. Svart. 0 skum. Innholdsrik aroma av sjokolade, lakris og nøtter. Smaken lik. Plommer dukker opp. Oljeaktig munnfølelse. Lett syrlig etter hvert. Alkoholen kommer gjennom med sin varmende effekt. Toppøl!

sampler from a friend. poured deep black with smallish mocha head. the initital aroma was deep roasted malts, chocolate, hints of coffee, toffee and caramel. the flavor mildly bitter with dark fruit mix with the chocolate and malts and toffee. really smooth with a full bodied flavor. now I know I need to go buy this one.
Aromas of wort, roasted coffee, chocolate, dark fruits, nuts. Flavor has same with nuttiness, chocolate. Best beer this quarter.

Svart med medium høyt brunlig skum. Kaffe, lakris, lær, røstet malt og noe mørk sjokolade i den lune aromaen. Markant kaffe, lakris og noe sjokolade i smaken. Tykk konsistens. Fin bitterhet i ettersmaken, samt hint av alkohol.
Svart med fingerhøyt lys brunt skum. Lukter mineralsk, lær, salt lakris og espresso. Fyldig. Salt smak, nesten salmiakk lakris, lett bitterhet og en kraftig bærsødme mot svisker bakom. Varer lenge.

Quite fair glass of stout. It has bit of a bite to it on the end. I see the notation that this particular brew ages very well...I think Ill grab another and hold onto it for a while..check it out again in a few months!

75cl bottle, sampled @ Shrewsbury Beer Share, Dec 15. Pours pitch black, tan head. Aroma is dark malts and coffee. Taste is slick and oily, but thinner than expected. Coffee notes are smoothly integrated with some cocoa and chocolate malt. Some soft roast. Good but not bowling me over.

UPDATED: JAN 31, 2016 Pours black with a tan head. Dark chocolate, coffee, roasted malt, soy sauce, date and caramel aroma. Dark chocolate, coffee, roasted malt, black cherry, date, caramel, toffee, toast and mild alcohol like flavors. Full body and moderate carbonation. Dark chocolate, coffee and roast finish. Aged 2 years: More chocolate/coffee, less dark fruit. More mellow with almost bourbon aged characteristics.

appearance: silky near black, with a short, creamy, light tan head that shrinks to a collar; decent lacing.  aroma: 	rich bittersweet dark and milk chocolate, tapioca pudding, turkish coffee, treacle, and light molasses notes. taste: bittersweet dark chocolate, molasses, caramel, black bread, coffee, vanilla, dark fruit (plum, raisin) in syrup.  finish: smooth and slick, with small carbonation prickles that liven the palate just a bit; chocolate, vanilla, and wood linger, and maybe some toasted nuts. notes: This is a wonderful beer. Complex and rich, I tasted something new with every sip. Big and rich, but I still wanted to drink the whole bottle myself. Bottle from Sarah for Beerdvent 2015.

Pours black with a medium nougat colored head. Aroma; roasted malt, dark chocolate, a touch of coffee, resin and vanilla. Flavours; roasted malt, dark chocolate, vanilla, coffee, resin, and some cherries.
A: Pitch black, nougat 1 finger head N: Coffee, cocoa, nutty T: Coffee, caramel O: Very well balanced!

UPDATED: DEC 17, 2015 Kraambezoek voor Roza tasting. Daar gaatie dan! Ter ere van de nieuwe boreling! Chocomel, koffie, blueberry muffins, witte chocolade, marsepein. Beheerste balans! Backlog from 2015/02/09.

Tap. Amazing, rich beer, one of the best Ive ever had. Aroma: chocolate, cereal, roasty, nuts, coffee, resin, floral, dried plums, earthy, alcohol, vanilla, woody, raisin. Black, frothy Brown head. light sweetness, medium bitterness, full body, thin feel, soft carbonation, bitter, long finish.

750mL bottle. Dark stouty brownish-black pour, medium espresso colored head with very nice retention. Nose is loaded with cocoa, dark roast, vanilla, toffee, candy sugar, dates, figs. Mouth is oily and medium sweet, some balancing bitterness, cocoa, candy, vanilla... yeah, basically everything in the nose is present here, roasty finish with a noticeable ABV warmth. Fucking awesome!

Puuuha, for et hurtigt stykke øl! Svært skuffet over hvor god en stout det er, ville gerne kunne svine genren til som jeg plejer. Smager fortrinligt, smoar en masse! Cremet og legende let på tungen trods et bombardement af choko.12% sprit, men gemt så godt som rommen i mormors æblekage! Ville klæde den med en korkprop.

From bottle - Thanks a lot Tomek! Pours pitch black with a brown head. Aroma of heavy roasted malts, lots of licorice, light plums and raisins, coffee, light chocolate, slight hint of alcohol. Taste is heavy chocolate, super smooth, vanilla, toffee and caramel, hints of coffee, low carbonation. Silky smooth, high drinkability. Lovely.

First beer to rate and my favorite. Big bottle silver foil top. Poured jet black tan head. Great coffee aroma. Taste like coffe and malt. Heat from abv was great. Light fizz, wonderful coffee aftertaste.
Tap. Black color, brown head. Aroma is strong chocolate, cherries, light roasty malt. Taste is very sweet, moderate bitter. Flavor of chocolate, cherries, coffee, roast. Great beer.

W aromacie potężna czekolada, pełno, gęsto, ale i owocowo, z czasem coraz bardziej truskawkowo, no niezbyt... W smaku ta sama historia, czuć pełnię, gorzką czekoladę, kawę, ale też niezbyt szlachetne utlenienie, estry czerwonych owoców. Smaczne, rozgrzewające, ale... najsłabszym piwem z tego zacnego browaru okazuje się być to najbardziej legendarne. Przykrość.

Piwo z kranu w Absurdalnej
Ciemne i nieprzejrzyste jak tylko piwo może być, jedna z najlepszch pian jeski widziałem - wysoka, beżowa, drobno/średnio pęcherzykowa, 1-2mm zostały praktycznie do końca, pięknie koronkowała. Aromat głównie czekolada z kawą, może toszeczkę słodkich nut chlebowych i owocowych (śliwka) także alkohol. Rewelacyjnie złożony. W smaku czuć alkohol, który jednak w ogóle nie przeszkadza, jest dobrze wkomponowany, wytrawny; dalej głównie kara i czekolada, leszcze przebija się też karmel i ciemne owoce (śliwki, wiśnie, wigilijny kompot :)). Piwo gładkie, oleiste, z długim wytrawnym finiszem. Kawał dobrego stouta.

Baclog. Mi2 at Cardinal 08.04.13. Dark brown, almost black, but with a little red shine when held up towards the light. Aroma of alcohol, some hop and roasted malt. Chocolate and sweetness in taste. Aftertaste of dark chocolate and warming alcohol. Fine and round mouthfeel. High drinkability, considering the ABV.

Bomber poured into snifter. A tad alcohol taste upon the first few sips but that fell away as beer warmed up. Great aroma of toffee and smoke. Wonderful mouthfeel and aftertaste. A treat on a cold night.
Full marks from me. Chocolate and vanilla aromas, very long taste. Ticks all the boxes.

Aroma: alcohol, roasty, coffee, caramel, chocolate
Appearance: black with a brown head
Taste: medium sweetness, medium bitterness, 
Palate: full body, creamy, soft carbonation, long finish, 

Excellent coffee stout
