Aroma can taste is roasted malty, with big bold chocolate and coffee notes, caramel, liquorice, brown sugar, some dark dried fruity notes. some nice burnt malty notes, smooth mouthfeel, lovely stuff.

UPDATED: JUN 17, 2017 kran w jabeerwocky. czarny, oleisty, z niewielka piana. W aromacie bogato, czekoladowo, kawowo, palenie, alkoholowo, ciemne owoce (bardziej wisnie niz sliwki), nieco karmelu, troche pumpernikla... ladnie to wszystko komponuje sie. w ustach analogicznie, alkohol ewidentny, ale w ten pozytywny sposob. w slodka strone w smaku, odczuwalna choc niewysoka goryczka. Zaskakujaco lekki, latwo pijalny - byc moze to zasluga nieduzej ilosci ciala, choc jak dla mnie wolalbym go wiecej. klasa piwo. Panel #13Rami Rami is drinking a Speedway Stout by AleSmith Brewing Company at Chmielarnia MarszałkowskaNie czuc alko. A tak pozatym taki bardzo dobry FES jakby.Ocena potraktowana skryptem do przeliczania ocen (uzgodnienie UT/RB).
750 ml bomber. Deep black, nice creamy head. Initial blast of coffee and vanilla. So deep, rich, delicious. Perfect winter stout.

Pretty good stuff. Strong. Roasted Coffee flavor. ---Rated via BeerBuddy for iPhone.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Coffee, caramel and floral aromas. Hint of fruit and chocolate on palate, long espresso finish. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Nera, densa, oleosa. Note di caffè, cioccolato dolce, cacao, malto abbrustolito; gusto rotondo e perfettamente equilibrato, di facile beva. Me laspettavo più intensa ma è molto ben bilanciata.

Bottle, 750ml. A pitch black beer with a medium size brown head. Aroma is of dark chocolate, black coffee, mint chocolate, dried fruits and alcohol. Taste is bitter with a strong roasted coffee character. Double aftertaste of dark chocolate, nuts and black coffee. Robust bodied with carbonation and astringency and a slightly milky finish. A one of a kind Stout

Bottle, 75cl. Opaque dark brown with a frotrhy brown head and intricate lacing. Deep, complex aromas of roasted malt, dark chocolate, coffee, dried fruits, nuts, toffee. Medium to robust bodied with moderate carbonation. Rich and creamy, with unbelievable malt character and a heavy coffee and alcohol bitter finish. Utterly magnificent.
Sample from bottle at Porterfestivalen Göteborg, 2015. Black with tanned head. Coffee, chocolate and roasted malt. Good imperial stout, but nothing exceptional.

So now I got 999 unique beers at Untappd. Just GOT to try something beatiful for 1000! 
Whith the upcoming Swedish Porterfestival in Gothenburg tomorrow I thougt a dark beer should be appropriate. 

I chose AleSmith Speedway Stout from my beercellar. 100/100 at ratebeer is not bad... 

The beer pours dark brown to black with a two finger high beige head. 

Nose: Halleluja! Toffee, dark chocolate, coffee, fudge, caramel malt, brown sugar, vanilla, cookies and licorice. 
Taste: Roasted malt, coffee, milk chocolate, vanilla, sweet caramel, smoke, licorice and tobacco. 
Body: Medium to full body. Light carbonated. Complex, smooth texture. Dry ending. 

This is beatiful! 

Im glad this was my 1000 unique beer!

Obfita beżowa piana ujawnia się zaraz po nalaniu, utrzymuje się dość długo pozostawiając piękny lacing. W zapachu ujawniają się nuty kawowo-czekoladowe z lekkim aromatem rodzynek, alkohol wspaniale ukryty prawie niewyczuwalny. Piwo jest oleiste w smaku gładkie pozostawia przyjemne słodkie odczucie przechodzące w silny posmak kawy/paloności.

Bardzo dobry RIS godny polecenia

Butelka 0,75
On tap at Alus celle in Riga. Very thick and long lasting cap. Very dark and non transparent. Smoky, coffee bitter taste. Stouts not my favourites, but this is a good one anyway

On tap at Carpool in Herndon, VA. 

Opaque, brown-black with a small tan head and very good lacing. 

Aroma of roasted coffee, chocolate, toffee, dark fruit, nuts and licorice. 

Taste of cocoa, dark roasted coffee, charcoal, toffee, licorice, alcohol,dark fruit and nuts. 

Full/medium body and medium carbonation. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Butelka 0.75L.
Wygląd: Carne z beżową, obfitą pianą. Opada w średnim tempie ale pięknie znaczy szkło.
Aromat: Czekolada gorzka, melasa, kawa czarna, po zamieszaniu wychodzą estry owocowe, głównie wiśnia, lekka śliwka.
Odczucie: Pełne, wysycenie średnie-, faktura oleista.
Smak: Bardzo słodkie w pierwszym wrażeniu, po czym pojawia się dużo kawy i paloności, kończy się bardziej wytrawnie, lekko pikantnie i alkoholowo.
Całość: Bardzo dobry RIS ale nie sprostał oczekiwaniom. Piłem kilka tańszych i lepszych RISów.

Bottle from Saveur Bière. Big creamy head with black body. Smells of roasted coffee beans, chocolate, nuts, tar. Tastes chocolate, coffee, raisins. Very intense, sweet and bitter. Not amazingly complex but incredibly full and balanced in its taste. A great beer.

Fresh bottle month old. Poured a nice dark color with a very nice brown head. Smells of coffee cocoa and a little booze. Thick on the mouthfeel. Taste of deep complex malts, little bit of coffee and cocoa flavors. Boozy on the finish.

750 ml bottle poured into tulip glasses at home. Rich brown persistent head and nice lacing. Great aroma of dark chocolate and roasted coffee beans. Heavy mouthfeel, rich roasted character on the palette.
Noticeably high octane abv meshes in well with a complex inky black stout. Very enjoyable cocoa flavor adds to a nice silky mouthfeel. Gotta be hungry for this one.

2/19/2009 7:27:39 AM Bottle in Northfield, MA. Very black with the faintest head. Nose of malts and coffee. Fuel-powered taste of strong coffee and darkest chocolates. Very nice. A smooth mouthfeel and very creamy and crisp. Warming and delicious.

Happy to have found this bottle on a recent trip. Poors like a bottle of ink with a beautiful caramel colored head. Initial taste of chocolate and roasted malts. Perfect stout texture. Feels great on the palate, like a good stout should.

UPDATED: NOV 15, 2015 Bottle shared in LA, again on tap. Rich black pour, tan head. Huge chocolate flavour, roastiness, just right mild sweetness up front but finishes clean and not cloying. Warming alcohol finish. Alcohol richness from its 12% - you know drinking this that it isnt an 8-9% RIS. On tap seems not quite as good as in the bottle. Superb imperial stout.

Nieprzejrzyście czarny, z ładną beżową pianą. Aromat to intensywna kawa i mocna paloność, nuty deserowej czekolady i lekki powiew alkoholu w tle. W smaku bardzo pełne, ponownie popiół i kawa, alkohol jest bardziej nachalny niż w aromacie.

Copenhagen 14/10-2015. 50 cl from draft at Søernes Ølbar. Pours dark brown - almost black with small light beige head. Aroma is of chocolate and coffee. Soft carbonation and creamy palate. Taste is very well balanced between sweetness which is not too sugary and rich coffee bitterness. You can sense the quite prominent intensity from the alcohol. A very nice imperial stout you are forced to enjoy at a thoughtful pace.

Where: A gift enjoyed at a tasting event, thanks Maxbier and dlovell2. 
Appearance: Pours black with a nice creamy head, good coloring. 
Aroma: Heavy on the coffee and boozy notes, some chocolate and fruits. 
Taste: Dark malt, cocoas and caramel and creamy with decent hops. 
Palate: Heavy and smooth and creamy. Awesome. 
Overall: Much thanks to dlovell2 again, might not drink many better beers than this!
Tried at BrewDog Nottingham. Black colour with very thin head. Aroma is dark rich and fruity with caramel. Taste has caramel sweetness and a touch of coffee.
Dark brown. Tasted sample at Total Wine. Smooth, rich toffe, chocolate notes. Worth trying again under better conditions.
Armas of dark chocolate, roasted coffee, some licorice. Brown black with a lasting, small tan head. Pretty dry, strong, roasty, dark fruit flavors. Full bodied, warming.

UPDATED: SEP 29, 2015 Bottle. Tried this numerous time, but never got to rate it due to intoxication. Black with a medium sized dark brown head with good retention and lace. Nose has chalk, mushrooms, chocolate, grain. Flavour has the same things, not very rich, white sugar, grain, chocolate, dust, chalk, vanilla, slightly thin and sugary texture, balanced bitterness, soft carbonation, warming alcohol. Not as harsh as I remember it but overall unremarkable.

Bottle. Pours pitch black with small but stable white head. Aroma of dark chocolate and coffee, licorice and dried fruits. In taste fine dark chocolate, some roastiness and dried fruits plus low alcohol harshness. The beer is full bodied, oily and smooth on the palate. Sweet with medium bitter (partially from alcohol) finish. Classic RIS, very good.

Bottle, courtesy of Sinh4. Thanks! Ah, and what an impressive imperial stout this is. The foam and color are both as manifold as they are beautiful. Throught aroma, nose and palate there is this beautiful balance of coffee, chocolate and sweetness, nothing is overpowered in any way, yet there is more to discover. Smooth and easy to drink. 
I only read the commercial description while rating, and I rarely saw one that was matching my thoughts so well. This is heaven.

Tap into 12 oz plastic cup ::shrug:: hard to tell in a dark room, but looks black, no head. Cigarette smoke is fucking up the nose, but I get raisins, maybe almonds, and a hint of chocolate. In the mouth, heavy, almost oily. Lot of chocolate, some prunes. Holding it in my mouth releases carbonation giving it a creamier feel. Finishes with a whisper of hops pounded down by the alcohol sweetness. The 12% shows to the beer?s detriment, although I?ve never cared for that sticky sweetness that comes with high gravity brews. Frankly disappointed after reading the other reviews, as I usually like stouts.

Butelka. Barwa czarna jak smoła, nieprzejrzysta. Konsystencja bardzo gęsta. Bardzo ładna wysoka lecz nietrwała beżowa piany. Bogaty i złożony aromat ciemnych palonych słodów, czekolady, espresso, żurawina, wanilii. Smak bardzo intensywny, czekolada, kawa, wanilia. Odczucie w ustach bardzo wysokie. Oleiste ale nie obelepiające. Nagazowanie niskie do średniego, alkohol delikatnie rozgrzewa. W odczuciu duża pełnia. Alkohol bardzo dobrze ukryty.

On tap at Lunar Brewing Co., and snifter served generously filled almost to the brim, displaying a deepest brown color, and only enough room for a modest but persistent layer of brownish tan head foam, with wavy ribbons & spots of lacing as the precious liquid dissipated. The nose was smooth, roasted malt with an expressive blend of cocoa, caramel, and toffee, a touch of espresso, and a hint of smoke. Medium to full bodied, the taste was similar, with an added touch of syrupy sweetness, soft carbonation, and bitterness that was roasted & earthy. Exceedingly smooth & hearty, but 12%?

Bottle from Beer Gonzo, Coventry. Pitch black, tan head. Strong aromas of milk chocolate, cocoa, coffee. Taste is strong chocolate, espresso notes, roasted coffee, alcoholic burn. The mouthfeel is so full and satisfying. Cant believe this is 12%! This is unbelievable stuff. Amazing.

75cl bottle shared in a snifter. Pours black with a voluminous tan head which last very well throughout. Aroma is coffee, dark fruits and malts. Taste is upfront coffee with a slight dryness almost like bakers cocoa with a quite pronounced sweetness and then a slight bitterness but still on the sweet side for an Imperial Stout. Not as good as the hype surrounding this but a solid IS nonetheless.

Pours an opqaue jet black color with khaki colored head. Coffee, roasted malt, and sweet chocolate on the nose; follows onto the palate. Full bodied. Finishes with coffee and cocoa, like a chocolate espresso.

Bomber to snifter room temp. Opaque pour boasting a proud, fairly clingy sand head. Nose is complex and full. Chocolate, toffee, tobacco, dark cherry, wood, nuts, gristly coffee texture, alcohol present on a deep sniff. Flavor is milk-chocolately, ripe, sweet cherry, coffee toastiness on the swallow. Alcohol hidden well but still very much warming. Mouthfeel is creamy and soft, oily and cheek-coating in a coffee and noble hop bitterness. Definitely saving one for Christmas morning.

So youve had some great imperial stouts, and wonder whether this one, rated number 11 or 12 in the world, and costing a few quid, is really any better. Well, it doesnt do anything particularly differently to the other great stouts. But it does do what it does extremely well. Black as pitch, covering of coffee coloured head. On the surface - body is thick and creamy, aroma is coffee and chocolate, flavour has nice toasty malts, and its very drinkable given the big big alcohol content. But give it time and explore a bit and there is a lot more to come. Leave it rolling in the mouth, and the carbonation (and possibly the alcohol) starts to tingle a bit, leaving a frothy feel. Get your nose nice and close for a few seconds, and you get nuts, dried fruit, soy, wood and whisky notes. Hold it in the mouth for a while, and fruit flavours push themselves over the cocoa powder - dark fruits, berries and a touch of cherry. So, if you dont want to analyse too much, its a ridiculously tasty beer given that its powered by 12% of the bad stuff. Dig a bit deeper, and there are plenty of subtexts to enjoy.
wierze, że kiedyś przydarzy mi się coś lepszego i dlatego nie daję maxymalnych not.

Big bottle to myself. Pours black, brown head, slinky lacing. Aroma is chocolate, roasted malt, coffee, tobacco. Flavor is all that, plus prevalent booze, and some caramel and dark fruits (not much). Light hop bitterness on the finish. My favorite thing about this beer is the oily, heavy body, and the way the low carbonation slowly transforms the beer in your mouth from liquid to what feels like bubbles. The alcohol is not well hidden, but at 12%, is that possible? Excellent beer, but probably not superior to Stone RIS, 10-Fidy, or Yeti in my opinion, especially considering the difference in price. Still, world class.

No comment. Disappointed in aroma. Extremely palate. You can feel the beer after two hours in your mouth. Best with dessert + choko. Not so dark as other stouts, for example Struise Black Albert. Anyway one of the best stouts, extremely balanced and smooth. You cant feel the alcohol at all.
One of the best imperial stouts i have ever tried...tons of berries and chocolate ...so smooth...alcohol presents is minimal...solid ass beer....yummy!

UPDATED: OCT 24, 2015 04.04.2014. Aroma: green apple, alcohol- not good. Appearance : color is deep deep black, liguid is clear, head is rocky, brown, with small boubles. Taste: On start is full of coffee and choccolate, alcohol, Sweet is light, bitter is heavy. Body is full, texture is oily, CO2 is medium to soft,  finish is loooong with bitter. Not bad

Svart fin färg, mörkare krona, sötstark, lite små spritig doft fylld med mörk choklad, visa kakao, stor krämighet av vanilj & Milkyway i smaken, söt av alkohol & mörk malt,
Stark mörk choklad & sedan kakao ton med kaffe bitter i eftersmaken, fan va gött!

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Super strong. Not as smooth as the description says it is. Im almost drunk after the first sip.

BOD 3/23/15. Pours as dark as pitch black on a starless night. World class head volume, lacing and retention.

Almost world class nose of dark chocolate, molasses, hints of dark fruit (plum, raisin), vanilla, caramel and coffee.

Full bodied with a rich creamy texture. Below normal carbonation with no effervescence in the middle and a nice burst in the somewhat prickly finish.

The flavor profile is outstanding. It is intense, complex and reasonably balanced. However, the alcohol is not well hidden and produces an astringent alcohol flavor that prevents this exceptional stout from being world class. It begins with slightly bitter dark bakers chocolate, cocoa, that hints at sweetness. This flows into a rich sweet molasses with strong caramel notes. The middle is slightly bitter with roast and hop characteristics. Underneath are subtle notes of dark fruit, although not as pronounced as suggested by the nose. They are subdued by the arrival of the grain alcohol astringent flavor, which stays and lingers after the finish. The finish is a slow fade of rich chocolate and molasses that competes with grain alcohol astringency and finally succumbs to it. This is a world class stout that failed to make the grade due to the 12% alcohol content.

UPDATED: MAY 1, 2017 RELEASE 2014: Pours black opaque with brown stable creamy head.
Aroma: alcohol is mild noticable, prevails notes of coffee, mocha, cocoa powder, oak, vanilla, chocolate, with hints of caramel.
Flavor: taste with mild noticable alcohol, strong notes of chocolade, vanilla, cocoa, coffee, with hints of dried fruits, well balanced with fruity esters (pine, plums and even hints of grape).
Malt sweetness is medium to high, hop bitterness also. Body is sticky soft, carbonation is low, finish is long lasting. 
Very good imperial stout, but overall I expected a little more complex beer RATE FOR 2014: 7-4-8-5-17=4.1
RELEASE 2015: ~after three bottles: 
Pours black color, clear, with foamy brown head. Aroma and flavor are rich and intense of roasted, dark malts, coffee, vanilla, molasses, cinnamon, dark fruits...body is full, very smooth silky texture, low carbonation. Absolutely perfect!!! RATE FOR 2015: 8-5-10-5-18=4.6
RELEASE 2016: bottled on 26th februar, drunk it on 5th march: pours black, clear, with stable brown head.
Aroma of roadted malts, coffe, bitter sweet dark chocolate, cocoa beans, vanilla, lots of coffee, dark fruits, port wine...
Very similar are flavors...
Body is full, texture is velvety smooth, carbonation is low. Super fresh!!! RATE FOR 2016: 9-5-10-5-18=4,7
RATE DOR RELEASE 2017: bottle on 2. 3.2017, so very fresh, maybe more sweet than usual, great, intense chocolate, molasses, coffee notes: RATE FOR 2017: 8-5-10-5-18=4.6.
CAN 0.475l, bottled on 2nd march, 2017: similar. Charackter as 0.75l bottle; overall: 4.5.

750 ml bottled 01/07/15 from Saveur Bière.
Black body, with a medium, dense, creamy, coffee colored head.
Delicious, smooth aroma of melting dark chocolate, espresso, toffee, some vanilla, some dark fruits, slight alcohol.
Taste is also wonderful, smooth, with dark chocolate, coffee beans, wood, toffee, dark and dried fruits, some liquorice, some booze.
Perfect, full, creamy, velvety mouthfeel, with a soft carbonation.
Finishes smooth, with a pleasant moderate alcohol warmth, quite dry, wooden, with coffee, cocoa powder, dark chocolate, slight liquorice.

Amazing! The balance is really outstanding, drinks so smooth, with all flavours in perfect harmony and an incredible, velvety mouthfeel. Alcohol is noticeable, but well integrated and even adding another comfortable layer. One of the very best Imperial Stouts Ive had so far, completely worth the hype.

22 bomber to cervoise. Pours black, brown frothy head. Aroma of dark malts, both baking and semi-sweet choc, toffee, sherry, caramel. Taste of same. Lots of chocolate and some dark roast espresso. No booze present. Two thumbs up!
Alesmith brews the poster child of an Imperial Stout. Black, full bodied with roasted and chocolate malts, coffee, and alcohol undertones. Total package for my taste buds.

Bottle from Whole Foods Market in Redwood City, CA. Aroma is chocolate cake, brownies, coffee, tiramisu, kahlua. Taste is tang from dark, dark chocolate, acidity coffee, thick liqueur. Very potent, rich and bougie.

Bottled Feb. 2014. Black colour, large beautiful head. Coffee in the aroma feels a bit faded, probably more pronounced when fresh. Zero detectable alcohol, but warms you from inside quite nicely. Viscous, oily body. Taste is somewhat sweet, but the finish is intensely bitter - basically, it tastes like 90% cocoa dark chocolate, except *much* more intense. Finish is what elevates this one above competitors. A very competently executed imperial stout, though I expected a bit more. I think that if it had more coffee left in it, itd be a solid 4.5.

Pitch black, big shortlived beige head. Aroma of COFFEE, bitter and sweet chocolate and roasted malt. Tastewise loads of bitter coffee, but it is nicely ballanced with sweet notes of chocolate and dried fruit and sharp roasted malt.

750 bottle, Black pour with tan ring and lacing. Aromas are a good mix of coffee followed by chocolate and sweet malts with alcohol. Rich full bodied smooth, well blended flavors of coffee, bitter sweet chocolates. The mellow sweetness is countered by bitterness, this has depth. Big burn in the finish. Best non barrel Imp Stout.
Jet black tan head tan lacing, aroma chocolate and light caramel and some black licorice. Flavore equally as nice. Awesome brew perfect.
Pours heavy with a big dark head. Aromas of dark sugar, coffee, cocoa. Tastes rich w/dark chocolates & a aftertaste of coffee. Slightly sweeter then I remember on tap, but legendary all the same.

This is an outstanding, satisfying beer. It pours jet black from the bottle, the head is average. The aroma is strong coffee, anise, some bakers chocolate, and very dark, roasted malt, figs, raisins. The flavor is very strong, very rich. Not overly sweet. Creamy and rich without being a sugar overload. Just a hair shy of burnt tasting. Wonderful.
pour pitch Black with a fine White head. lots of coffee and chocolate aromas. taste medium bitter medium sweet. very well balanced. full bodied, oily. great carbonation.

Originally reviewed 12/26/2012. 750 mL bottle poured into a snifter. Ive had this bottle a good while. At least a year. Jet black with an ample mocha head. Laces beautifully and retains some surface wisps. Coffee with a slightly metallic aroma. Chocolate malts come through just slightly, but coffee is the most dominant aroma. Coffee is extremely well blended. Blends with a deep burnt chocolate flavor. Enough sweetness to keep it balanced and not too bitter. Definite alcohol presence. Gives it a bright almost fruity finish with the bite.

Sharp alcohol, but otherwise thick, chewy, and delicious. Medium carbonation.
Solid, easy to get, delicious stout. Better fresh, it should be said.
28 July 2015, tap at AleSmith. Black. Nose is black coffee and brown sugar. Full body and mildly fizzy. Lots of dark coffee, burnt notes, brown sugar, faintly acidic. Nice.

Bottle, dated 4 months ago. Dark, virtually black pour with a brown head. Aroma is rich chocolate and roasted malts, toffee, some raisin as it warms and a boozy edge. Taste is thick, creamy chocolate and roasted malts, coffee, toffee, hints of dark fruits. A bit boozy, unsurprisingly as the bottle was fairly fresh. A bit sweet and not quite as balanced as some of the other top-level imperial stouts, but very tasty. This will improve beautifully with age, Im sure.

Pours dark with a defined and thick foam head that sticks to my glass. The aroma is rich of dark malts, booze, hints of buttery toffee, and it has a smoked presence. There is also a medium intensity of coffee and chocolate. Tasting, I noticed a creamy texture with pleasant notes of bitter coffee, dark chocolate, loads of malted grains, and sugary caramel. The finish is very good. I enjoyed the fading booze taste that is replaced by the blended chocolate, malts, and bitter coffee flavor. Overall a solid beverage.
Pours jet black with a dense mocha head. Aroma is coffee, cocoa, chocolate brownies, raisins and slight caramel. Taste is coffee, cocoa, hint of oak and leather, slight raisins. Thick body.

Bottled 04.04.2014. Aroma of coffee with soy sauce. Pours pitch black with tan head. Taste is very boozy, solvent-green apple like, there is not much something else. I think the cap was not airtight and beer has oxidized but it was not my fault. I have expected a great Imperial Stout and I wasted my money.

UPDATED: JAN 18, 2016 Bottle; black pour with a thin mocha colored head; aroma of roast malt, coffee, chocolate, and hints of dark fruits and vanilla; taste is coffee, chocolate, roasted malt, and vanilla; finish is bitter coffee; excellent beer (updating rate after an early mis-rating)
Drank this while at RAF Fairford -- This beer was hella good. Great stout, would love to have more of this. Dark mysterious and comforting.

Pours dark almost Black. Head is Brown, thick and almost never vanishing. Nose is dark Dryed fruits raisin and liqurice. Rosted malt very dominant. Taste is rich some metal and very sweet. Creamy mouthfeel warming finish. Silght taste of alcohol and long residual stickyness in the mouth. Awesome but holy god 12% alc. That bottle is gonna kill me...

Smells like booze, chocolate, and soy sauce. Very low carbonation. Mouthfeel is semi-creamy and semi-foamy. Taste is alcohol, coffee with cream, some caramel, and dark chocolate. In that order. Aftertaste is long length. Starts off with alcohol taste and warmth. The alcohol taste goes away before the warmth does. After about ten seconds, the taste transitions from alcohol to coffee and dark chocolate.

Strong....very very strong. It's 12%. It's chocolatey and continues on into a soft, dark caramel finish.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Poured from a year and a half old bottle. Looks great in a glass. Nice tanned head.

Smell - not that strong smelling. I am picking up a little bit of alcohol, some dark fruit, subtle coffee, not much to be honest.

Taste - its a huge stout. The coffee has faded a bit, Im actually a bit dissapointed in this. The alcohol does come through a lot. Not the smoothest to drink, and honestly not one of my favourite stouts.
Bottle. Pours black with a beige head. Aromas of roasted malts and rich chocolate, some alcohol. Tastes like it smells. Lightly bitter. Medium+ bodied; a touch creamy; bitter finish.
Pretty good. Tastes good and chocolatey. Slightly aromatic. About the same class as KBS Id say

Jet black pour with an espresso colored, single finger head. Aroma is sweet and chocolate like. Aroma is unfortunately pretty faint. Creamy mouth. Lots of chocolate. Slight alcohol burn. Lots of bitter coffee on the finish. For 12% this is highly drinkable. Pretty unassuming, but this is a very tasty stout. Lace present.
Bought this in copenhagen. One of the best beers i have ever tasted. Great long lasting taste

pitch black color, dark beige head, aroma of coffee, dark chocolate, roasted malts, toffee, a little bit of alcohol, biscuits and vanilla. Taste is light to medium sweet, light bitter, medium to full body, creamy texture, soft carbonation.

Pours Jet black as it should. Aroma is rich of dark roasted malts and dark fruits, not as much coffee as i would want though!

Taste improves over the aroma with rich coffee bringing up the rear of the taste, some slight notes of chocolate. Very thick and creamy mouth feel.

Very nice Imperial stout!
just another overrated beer a good beer not top tier on any level. Sure I would drink it again but would not seek it out.
From tap at CBC 2015. Black with a beige head. Aroma and flavour of roasted malt, coffee, chocolate, bitterness, caramel and vanilla.

Black body, light brown head. Aroma has sweet coffee, some roasted malt, red port wine. Flavour is smooth roasted caramel, coffee and chocolate. Bit tobacco in aftertaste. Huge oily softness in mouthfeel. Alcohol warmth. Best in this is the balance, not the complexity.

Alesmith Speedway Stout - 750 ml a year or so old - holy cow what a powerful, delicous beer! Certainly loads up the rich tasty malts, creating a body that seems unique. The coffee is top notch and blends well with the roasty malts. Ive wanted to try this for about ten years, and the muchness of Alesmiths beer-crafting makes their products extremely rewarding. I could envisage the barrel-aged version being even more mouth-coating, if thats even possible. Id buy this version again.

Pours into a teku showing pitch black with very sparse latte colored foam. 

The nose shows a lot of espresso and roasted coffee beans. 

The palate is full bodied and evenly carbonated. From the start, there is a big mix of roasted coffee, espresso, cacao and dark chocolate with some hints of cappucino. A lot of dark flavors but still well balanced and a perfect pitch black coffee bitterness on the finish.

Near perfect stout. Black pour with tan lacing head. Aroma is fig, vanilla, mocha and licorice. Flavor is complex with vanilla and hops. Alcohol very evident on the palate. Some nice bitterness. Finish lasts for minutes!

Draught sample at CBC 2015. Pitch black with a small, tanned head. Roasted aroma with dark malts, chocolate, toffee, coconut, a hearty amount of coffee, vanilla and dark, dried fruits. Taste is sweet-roasted. Full bodied, oily texture, soft carbonation. Perfect. Lasting roasted finish with rich dark malts. World class Stout.

Pours dark black with a dark tan head. Nose is coffee, plum, dark chocolate, a little cough syrup. Flavor is lots of roast, plum, dark chocolate, a little cherry. Finish is a little sweet, a bit of burnt toast, lots of roasted coffee. Heavyz syrupy mithfeel. Mouth coating. Love it.

Bomber bottle poured a black hue w/ huge foamy lasting brown head and sticky lacing. Moderate sweet roasty aromas. Initial flavor is bold sweet w/ a moderate bitter finish. Tastes are coffee, dark toast, brown sugar and a non-descript boozy finish. Full bodied, creamy mouthfeel and warm finish.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Aromat: lekkie utlenienie, alkohol - to niebyt dobrze. Na szczęście zaraz po tym czekolada kawa, bardzo przyjemne. Do tego śliwki, wiśnie suszone. Paloność ograniczona.

Brawa: czarna, nieprzejrzysta, nawet pod światło. Piana jasno brązowa, drobno pęcherzykowa, średniej wielkości i umiarkowanie trwała. Ładnie oblepia szkło.

Smak: spora słodycz, niestety z akcentami miodowymi i wyraźnym alkoholem. Ziarna kakaowca, lekka kawa i paloność. Pod koniec także wyraźne melaoidyny, wręcz pumpernikiel. Goryczka powyżej średniej do wysokiej, wzmacniana przez ciemne słody. Pełnia krągła plus, umiarkowane wysycenie oraz wytrawny, kwaskowy i wyraźnie alkoholowy finisz, rozgrzewający przełyk. Gęsta i oleista konsystencja. 

Piwo kultowe, które leżało u mnie przynajmniej 1,5 roku. Z tego względu jest nieco utlenione, ale z drugiej strony miałem też nadzieję, że będzie bardziej ułożone. Niestety alkohol jest dość wysoki zarówno w aromacie, jak i smaku. Do tego mega zardzewiały kapsel i szyjka butelki nie wyglądają zachęcająco, zwłaszcza przy tak wysokiej cenie (>50 płn).
Tap. Pitch black pour with a tanned head. Coffee, caramel, toffee, raisin, oak. Very complex but smooth. Thick and creamy. Excellent
Awesome stout that you can get all year long. Good blend of coffee with caramel overtones. Nice head on the pour.

Draft, Martys Hops & Vines. APPEARANCE - perfectly black. Light head, dissipates pretty quickly.NOSE - coffee, even when its cold, and stays promenint as it warms. FLAVOR - thick and delicious. Rich flavors and mouthfeel, which is where this beer excels. Coffee and slightly bitter throughout. It tastes like it was aged when its actually not.NOTES - excellent beer.
Tap @CBC15. Nearly Black with small light tan head. Aroma has coffee and choc. Medium thick mouthfeel. Dark licorice and coffee flavour, solid bitterness. Goooood.
650 ml bottle from systembolaget bs. Pours black with nice brown head. Cocoa and coffee aroma with loads of Chocolate taste. Very nice beer!

Sample at CBC Pours black with small brown head. Deep Coffee and chocolate aroma, taste of roasted malts, coffee, chocolate, heavy cloying sweetness, full body, oily feel, soft carbonation, long finish.
sample at cbc. pours black, tan head. Aroma is roasty, chocolate. Taste is complex, starting with chocolate, ends in a coffee taste that is just a little too strong for me. (not a coffee drinker)

Its unbelievably hard not to make motor oil puns to describe Speedway Stouts appearance, but Ill do my best. Alesmiths Imperial Stout pours black and viscous (and bears absolutely no resemblance to a certain automotive product). Whats impressive is that this brew manages to be both effervescent and thick. This beer is heavy yet heady. Rich and full-bodied yet smooth and balanced. Floral coffee aroma is beautiful. Flavor has roasted malt and fresh coffee in equal measure. For a Stout with this much booze, Speedway Stout is even-tempered and extremely drinkable. This classic coffee brew deserves its fame and adoration.

Bottle.

A- Coffee, chocolate, roasty.

A- Black color, dark liquid, light brown head.

T- Bitter coffee, chocolate, roasty, creamy.

P- Full body, average texture, average carbonation, roasty bitter finish.

O- Pretty high expectations for this one and while it didnt disappoint it wasnt a mind blower either. Lots of coffee in here but its more of a mellow slightly bitter black coffee taste. Other than that I didnt get a whole lot of other notes in here. The bottle was pretty fresh so maybe some aging on it would bring things out a bit more.

Schwarz, beiger Schaum, kleinporig. In der Nase viele dunkle Früchte, Kaffee, Kakao, leicht röstig. Am Gaumen dunkle Früchte, Kakao, KAffe, gegen Ende Zartbitterschokolade, leicht bitter. Körper medium, cremig, rund. Sehr gutes Imperial Stout, sehr rund.

Pours black with small brown head. Coffee and chocolate aroma and taste. Slightly sweet, a bit harsh.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Draught @ Warpigs. Pours pitch black with a tiny tan head, some lacing. Aroma is sweet, roasted malt, chocolate, coconut, coffee, vanilla and dried fruits. Flavour is medium sweet and light bitterness. Full bodied, creamy texture, soft carbonation. Finish is bittersweet and warming.

Yields a slick viscous black color, with a unique, very bubbly mohagony head.

Smells big times of cocoa, fudge and coffee, wrapped up by syrup and toffeeish malts. Has a whiff of alcohol underneath, providing a caramel burn. The aromas exhibit an interesting interplay between milk chocolate and coffee, leaning even more on chocolate.

Has a fitting, lower carbonation, complimenting the beers medium body.

Tastes of bakers chocolate and smooth coffee, accompanied by bready malts, also revealing glazed caramel. Drinks throughout smooth, coffee comes along with lots of cream, adding a dry bitterness, which gets countered by alcoholic, biting molasses. Finishes with a well pronounced boiled coffee bitterness, while chocolate adds depth, including a subtle sourness.

The beers convinces by its smooth coffee mouthfeel, which gets a lot of depth, due to the luscious chocolate, commuting between sweet and dry. The beers finish is unusually long and complex, revealing crushed coffee beans, toffee, mousse au chocolate among a coffee milk sourness.
Jet black and opaque pour with one half inch tan brown head. Smells of chocolate French roast and some anise. Flavor is exactly what is expected from aroma. Finishes with dark roast lingering on.
Bottle (750ml). Black with big tan head. Probably about 1 year old. Sweet chocolate aroma. Taste is bitter sweet chocolate with lots of coffee. Finishes with some bitterness and warming.

Bottle: (2015)
Pours black....with a thick, dark tan head.
Coffee, chocolate, licorice aroma.
Flavour is sweet...roasty coffee, dark chocolate malt, vanilla cream....
Huge, sticky, chocolate malt....thick, creamy.
Very light, well balanced espresso bittering....
Unbelievably easy to drink despite the ABV....one of the most silky smooth Imperial Stouts Ive had the pleasure to drink....
Excellent.

Pours deep dark with medium tan head. Nose is molasse and. Aromas are roasted malts, caramel, coffee, chocolate and cream. Thick texture and low carbonation. Long bitter and roasty finish. Excellent an perfectly balanced coffee stout.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bottle to glass at M.o.M.s. 
2013
Appearance: Dark black,thick look,creamy tan head. A beautiful thing.

Aroma: coffee, toast, some plum, raisin. 

Taste is toased barley, coffee, all the dark fruits. Alcohol 12%, is blended in well. Aftertaste is charred steak. Some cocoa.

Really nice texture. Smooth drinking.

Overall, a very nice beer. Near the top of my list.

Deep brown to black color, beige head. Licorice nose, coffee, chocolate, roasted malt, toffee. Chocolate taste, roasted malt, licorice, coffee, brown sugar. Full body, soft carbonation, oily texture, warming. Well blended and rich taste, nearly unnoticeable presence of alcohol. Very close to perfection. Personal stats: Rating #600.

Pours jet black with a nominal head, aroma of coffee and booze. Taste is Coffee, chocolate, sweet, malt and booze as it warms. This beer for is amazing. Right up there with Brooklyn chocolate stout as one of my favorites of this style. Mouth feel is creamy and full. Nothing bad to day about this brew. A must try for anyone who likes this style.

750ml bottle shared with Jo and Seb. Aroma: coffee, roasted malt, vanilla a bit. App: pitch dark, small brown frothy head, some lacing. Taste and palate : smooth.. Really smooth full body, medium sweetness, soft carbonation, light bitterness and sweet finish. Overall: this is the definitely the best coffee stout Ive had so far. So smooth. Not too sure what I can say wrong about this beer.
Bottle 750 ml. Great aroma: very strong, wine and cognac, excellent coffee and dark chocolate. Taste: very wine, brandy, chocolate, burning, great! Highest score!

Beer tasting @ fillepolo 29/3-15. Bottle from Mikkeller & Friends Bottle Shop. Roasted malty with chocolate, cacao and coffee, also licorice and vanilla. Body is full, the finish is dry, bitter and roasted with chocolate and coffee. Also some warming alcohol.

Beer tasting @ Fillepolo 150329. Bottle (750 ml) from Mikkeller Bottle Shop. Roasted malty with chocolate, coffee and liquorice, vanilla, sweet, full body with an oily texture. The finish is long, dry, bitter and roasted with chocolate and light notes of alcohol.
Beer tasting @ Fillepolo. Roasted coffee chocolate very nice, taste like a alcoholic roasted chocolate/coffee cake from the nearby bakery
Bottle from Tacoma Food Co-op. Pours black. Tan head. Scent is boozy and chocolaty. Taste is less boozy. Coffee and chocolate. Nice and roasty. Very smooth beer.

Bottle from Robby, thanks slim. Seriously remarkable aroma. Chocolate without being sweet, coffee without being acidic. Beautiful caramel colored head, which sticks around. On first sip, wonderful balance. The chocolate is ALMOST too sweet, but the coffee takes it down appropriately. The malt is perfect. Hard to come up with issues, this is a nearly perfect coffee stout.

Probably best brew in SD if this is your style. Jet black with nitrogen type head. Rich French roast coffee with a licorice undertone. Mouthfeel of big stout flavors, finish of toffee caramel coffee anise. Nothing much better!

UPDATED: MAR 12, 2016 29.8.2014. Almost black with brown head. Oily texture. Fantastic aroma with roasted coffee, sweetness, liquorice. Ahh. Taste has coffee, roasted malts, liquorice, just as aroma. Fantastic full bodied warming stout.

750ml bottle, bottled on 04/14/13, deep black color, with a thick creamy tan-colored head, with a mild mocha, cappuccino, brown chocolate, chocolate cake, brownie nose, with some toffee, chocolate chip cookie dough, chocolate pie crust, dark bitter chocolate, toffee, chocolate bran muffin accents, with some molases, sweet burnt fruitcake, cafe late, mild roasted ground coffee bean, burnt toast, milk chocolate, chocolate cup filled with chocolate liquor, light sweet roasted, chocolate, black, caramel, toasted malty notes in the aroma follows through on a medium-bodied palate with a warmth mild sweet roasted, chocolate, black, toasted, caramel malty, molasses, burnt brownie,dark bitter chocolate, sweet roasted ground coffee bean character, with some spicy anise, licorice, boozy chocolate liquor, semi-sweet chocolate baking bar, ice coffee, subtle burnt dark dried fruit, burnt toast, toffee, caramel bran muffin, sweet fruity black coffee flavours, leading towards a warming sweet black bitter chocolate, chocolate liquor, molasses, mild sweet roasted, chocolate, black, toasted, caramel maltiness, coffee liquor, burnt dark dried fruit fruitiness, chocolate bran muffin, lingering soft roasted ground coffee bean bitterness finish.
Tap. Pour is black with a caramel head, aroma is strong toffee, caramel, booze. Taste is caramel, sweet, alcohol, beautiful full body. Great

Ive been saving this beer for the right occasion and I needed something big for my 1000th beer rating so I finally decided to crack this bad boy open. Pours pitch black with a thick creamy bubbly tan head. This beer is so dark if you hold it up to the light you cant see through it. The aroma is big dark roasted coffee with vanilla and dark chocolate. A little alcohol aroma. Silky, velvety mouth feel. Flavor is sweet milk chocolate up front followed with big roasted espresso coffee flavor. The middle has some dark dried fruits and dark chocolate notes. Finishes with dark cocoa and big roasted coffee bitterness. No alcohol flavors which is crazy for a12% beer but in the finish you can feel the alcohol vapors. The flavors of this brew really meld nicely together with the coffee and chocolate flavors. I had high expectations for this beer and its even better than I imagined. Truly an amazing brew.

duft: vanilje. kaffe ristet malt. kakao. kiks ristet malt.
smag sirup mørkt malt. kaffe chokolade. dunfarin smag af karamel. en del kaffe smag. hade håbet på noget bedre smag i denne øl

Bière partagée avec Marco et Mademoiselle Irina par un samedi soir de grand froid. Marco avait envie dune stout costaude... Il a été servi! Lorsque la Grande Dame à la robe noire et ténébreuse fait son apparition, chacun se tait en guise de respect. On assiste à la procession, admiratifs. Par où commencer? Dabord le col. Celui-ci est tissé très serré, dun brun riche et onctueux, couleur mocha. En remuant le verre, le liquide offre une rondeur absolument remarquable tant celui-ci sagrippe au verre et y adhère laissant sur son passage un léger film huileux. Mon coup de coeur va à la sous-mousse qui brouille le verre et peine à remonter lorsquon agite le verre un tant soi peu. Un look denfer! Ce stout présente un nez discret mais évolutif au fil de la température. On perçois du café, des grains rôtis, du chocolat noir. Cest plutôt léger. Les brasseurs ont visiblement opté pour un produit délicat qui ne verse pas dans les classiques sucrés, lourds et bruyants. Encore une fois, on garde silence pour ne rien manquer de la finesse de cette bière que nous nous apprêtons à déguster. (Note: nous navons pas quobservé silence pendant la soirée - nous avons aussi beaucoup discuté!). La bouche est la suite logique du nez. Les complices flaveurs de café, chocolat noir et de malts rôtis se partagent lavant-scène et offrent un spectacle grandiose dans une mise en scène sous le thème de la délicatesse et du raffinement.Léquilibre est simplement parfait. Ce stout est mémorable. Ce classique des tablettes américaines nest pas une référence pour rien!

Bottle: very dense, light to medium head and moderate head. The aromas are intense. Coffee, roast and hops. There is a slight floral, herbal or hoppy edge. Dried fruit and a little sluggish ferment like. Off dry without sourness and moderate to moderately high bitterness. The flavors are very intense. Malt, coffee, espresso, dark chocolate, roast and a creamy mid palate. 
Lots of flavor but a little coarse. 
Hot but lacks Saturation. Theres also an oxidized Apple edge.

Black pour, medium brown head. Great aroma of chocolate, whiskey, oak, cocoa and alcohol, rich chocolatey flavor with notes of truffle, mocha and booze. Rich full body with a long sticky sweet finish. Fantastic.

Bottled 2/11/15 and enjoyed 3/14/15. Poured an extremely dark brown, almost black, color with mocha cap and spotty lacing. Aroma was full of coffee, some chocolate and slight toffee. Taste is of bittersweet chocolate, caramel, and strong coffee. Very nice velvet texture, creamy feel and warmth from the alcohol. In summary, this was the first AleSmith brew Ive had and probably in my top ten favorite stouts to date. Highly recommended!
See previous rating- super coffee chocolate dried fruits and hops. Not for drinking all night but for a strong imperial stout american superstyled

UPDATED: FEB 20, 2016 Pitch black with brown foam. The smell has chocolate, coffee and liqueur. The taste is a nice mixture between mild viscosity, hot spiciness and a calm carbonation. Quite sweet and the typical range of taste: coffee caramel chocolate vanilla etc. The beer is awesome no question, but I find that a lot of the great beers in this style are not that different, even though this one is a bit spicier.

UPDATED: FEB 9, 2017 Black color with big tan head. Aroma of coffee, liquorice, vanilla. Taste of rich chocolate, coffee, vanilla, and spices towards the end. Nutty-earthy as well. So much in there. Hardly any booze. Just the right amount of sweetness. Feels dry and full at the same time. Extremely well-balanced and soothing. Wow.Very old bottle courtesy of Koelschtrinker (no Alesmith logo on cap). Aged gracefully, still lots of coffee, and quite dry!

Shared bottle at Cardinal (mandag i annen). Pours black. Aroma of alcohol, coffee, glue. Taste sweet and bitter, chocolate, milk, coffee, brown bread. Big body. Long lasting sweet and bitter aftertaste.

Bomber into snifter glass, opaque deep dark brown color with dark tan head. Aroma notes of heavy roasted malt, smoke, dark coffee beans, dark chocolate, light peppery spice, dark fruit, licorice, light vanilla and some earthiness. Taste adds notes of milk chocolate, espresso, more plum/fig fruitiness, molasses, wood ash, some nuttiness and bitter earthy hops. Heavy body, low carbonation, creamy with long lingering coffee roast finish. All around excellent coffee RIS.
pretty good stout. i wouldnt say that it is my favorite but it is up there. if you are in ohio, pick some up.

Pours opaque sable with a light tan head. Rich, sweet aroma has notes of molasses, roast malt, caramel and licorice. Flavor presents roast malt, molasses, caramel, and subtle chocolate and pepper notes. Drivin me wild! Viscous texture has some good fizz. One more beer off me bucket list.
UPDATED: APR 5, 2015 Deep black color. Heavy rich chocolate bitters slight bourbon tones but not actually bourbon. Burnt but coffee burnt. Had on tap and bottle. Both were equally good.

Draft at 2014 Yokohama Beer Fest. Inky black with a dark chocolate colored head. Aromas of roasted coffee, chocolate, malts, star anise and dark fruit as it progresses. Same tastes are present with the coffee and chocolate playing the star however as it comes to room temperature, fig, prunes, currant and dried apricot sneak in show themselves. Really complex and entertaining imperial stout.

UPDATED: FEB 2, 2016 Enjoyed this beer last fall. Need to get it again. Pours black with a dark brown head. Aromas of chocolate, coffee, licorice, dark fruits like Fig or plum, and more coffee. Very complex flavor layer after layer of coffee, chocolate, Fig, plum, licorice and more coffee. Very nice beer. One of the best I have ever had definitely in my top four. Is as thick as nyquil definitely have to sip this beer. Bottled at 12 percent ABV. And then condition so its probably closer to 14 percent. Little to no alcohol taste at all. Very nice beer, one of the best.

Intense aromas of black coffee, black licorice and black plum. Dark and rich, with an ultrasoft mouthfeel that opens with dark chocolate and mocha notes before evolving into black fruit notes of licorice, fig and plum, lingering on a well-balanced hop note. Finish lingers for minutes with all in balance. I cannot believe how smooth this is for the abv. A tremendous beer.

Bottle, 750 ml from New Beer Distributors, New York. Pours black with lasting brown head. Nice lacing. Malts, dark chocolate, coffee, hint of vanilla. Moderate sweet and bitter. Full bodied, alcohol well hidden.

Pours black with large light brown head. Nose is roasted barley, coffee chocolate. Full bodied, creamy oily body with smooth carbonation. Deep delicious dark chocolate on the finish, lingering for a long time. Medium sweetness, light bitterness in the finish. Body is amazing, flavors a great, although very enjoyable beer.

Bottled 01/27/14. Pours a near black with a half finger, bubbly tan head that lasts forever. Aroma has big, smooth notes of coffee, dark chocolate, roasted malts, and a slight bit of nuttyness. Taste is a strong bitter with smooth notes of dark chocolate, coffee, roasted malts, milk chocolate, and an espresso bitter finish. Full body with a low carbonation. Soft carbonation with a semi dry finish. Overall a great coffee stout. Big, smooth flavours of dark chocolate, roasted malts, and coffee. Would love a BA version.

Bottled 12 May 14. Pours pitch black with small coffee head. Strong roasted aromas with loads of dark chocolate and espresso, vanilla, a little leather and booze. The taste is great - heaps of dark chocolate and high quality espresso, with molasses, plums and dates, some vanilla and alcohol, light bitter finish. Full bodied. Very big imperial stout and quite impressive. I imagine this would benefit from some aging to round out some of the rough edges in the finish.

Bottle to stout glass. Jet black pour with a huge coffee aroma. So, so coffee. Tastes like coffee and chocolate and roasty goodness. This beer is so dope. Get it now. Trade for it. You need it. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Pours black with tall, long lasting, creamy, brown head, nice lacing and lovely carbonation. Aroma is of roasted malt, toast, dark fruit herbal hops. Body is full, creamy and slightly crisp. Taste is of nutty, toasted malt, coffee, chocolate, brown sugar, dark fruit and herbal hops. Finish is long and bitter.

botella. @Cimmeria, Oviedo 14/02/2015. Bottle on: 02/04/2014.
Color negro opaco, espuma beige. Sabor torrefacto, buen cuerpo

Bottle, cellared for just over two years. Appearance is jet black and completely opaque. A 1-2 finger frothy, foamy tan/light brown head which hangs around impressively. Aroma- rich, dense chocolate, espresso coffee, dark chocolate, treacle toffee, leather, some pipe smoke and tobacco, big, roast malt, vanilla hints even though its non-BA, maybe due to the age. Only the vaguest hint of alcohol is detectable. Smells luscious. Taste- just incredible. Loads and loads of dark chocolate and a huge coffee/espresso hit at the start. Despite the massive dark chocolatey bitterness, theres also a sweetness- treacle toffee/vanilla undertones, a hint of boozy dark fruits, rich chocolate cake, and more coffee than you know what to do with. More chocolate emerges as it warms up. The mouthfeel is perfect- not quite as syrupy as the other big imperial stouts. It clings to the mouth in the most satisfying way possible, is oily and slick but has a hint of carbonation to help things along. Long, lingering finish which goes on forever, like drinking a sweet, syrupy espresso. Hardly any alcohol in there, but it gives you a nice warmth. Utterly amazing.

2015/02/14 - Pours an opaque, jet black colour with a thin, frothy, khaki colour head that leaves moderate lacing. Aroma is coffee, chocolate, vanilla, smoke, wood and hints of cherries. Taste follows nose; lots of coffee, dark chocolate, vanilla and wood. Mouthfeel is medium and oily with smooth carbonation and a mildly warming finish. Awesome imperial stout.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

On tap @ City Beer, San Francisco - CA. Color: dark opaque black beer with no carbonation and small brown head. Smell: coffee domination with chocolate presence. Roasted malt and some alcohol notes. Taste: high oily sensation great taste and with a ice coffee notes and licorice. Really nice taste. Aftertaste: ice coffee and alcohol notes.
Bottle, pours black with espresso creme head. Lightish but smooth body, very drinkable.

Bottle for Rozas birth. Black with big creamy beige head that disappears fast and leaves medium lacing. Blueberry muffins, milk chocolate, espresso, marzipan, roasted nuts, bourbon, toast, smoke, big roasted grains. Medium sweet with medium bitter espresso and roasted grains going into a dry cocoa bitter finish. Full bodied with light creamy feel. Massive stuff, but still balanced and drinkable.

750ml bottle at the Hoppy Pub, Thessaloniki. Black with nice beige brown head. Roasted malty aroma, coffee, chocolate, cocoa, dark fruits. Sweet and bitter taste, coffee, dark chocolate, milk chocolate. Full body, oily to creamy with soft carbonation and bitter coffee aftertaste.
Big coffee aroma, wonderful big coffee and hop taste..this is a very big beer and it lives up to the hype!

pours a large frothy light brown head that mostly diminishes. body is coffee black.
aroma contains moderate malts (dark bread, hay, straw, toasted and raosted malts, some burnt malts, nuts, caramel, milk chocolate, strong coffee), moderate hops (flowers, spruce, orange and lemon), light yeasts (dough, leather) aqnd banana, grape, raisin, prune, apple, some tawny port, toffee, honey, licorice, cola, forest fruits and spices.
Flavor is light acidic, then light acidic and sweet, followed by sweet, sweet and light bitter going to sweet and bitter and finishing in bitter. 
Body is medium to full with creamy texture and soft carbonation.
very subtle, highly complex and perfectly balanced. One of the best in its kind I have tasted so far.
Good stout. Big stout, coffeee vanilla, chocolate, High alcohol content, warms-up. Good head and good retendtion.
Это пиво вкусное. я, конечно, рекомен& его всем, что любит хорошую Craft пива!

Boom. Big Bottle from giant eagle gahanna. Worth going back to get another. Solid black with head that rises with a good pour. Head is thinner than a Guinness. Coffee notes in the nose and harsh coffee balances by toffee and cocoa in first taste. Smooth and packs a surprising wallop at 12%. Would go out of my way to get. Wow. Well played.

Lg bottle - pours jet black with small fluffy tan head. Luxurious aroma full of mocha, espresso, dark chocolate, licorice and burnt marshmallow. This XL nearly perfect stout is coffee riffic....and full of cocoa, huge roasted malts, amazing chocolate, toffee, dried dark cherry and wonderful burnt flavor.
A fantastic imperial stout! Very complex. Has coffee, chocolates, cognac, vanilla, all very neatly tied together. Loads of taste, but well-hidden alchohol.

Year aged. Pours black with minimal tan head. Nose is chocolate, dark fruits, bit if coffee, booze. Taste largely matches nose, dark chocolate, umami, dark fruits, coffee on the finish but not very bitter. Creamy, solid mouthfeel. Overall very good stout.

Bottled on 01.03.14.
Poured into a tulip from a 25 oz bottle on 08.12.14.

A: Chocolate. It also has a tiny bit of coffee.

A: 1 finger tan head. Midnight black body with some red in the glass.

T: Chocolate and cherry dominate. Plum, woodiness, coffee, and vanilla are subtle.

P: Creamy smooth. Chewy enough. It goes down smooth for such a high ABV.

O: The alcohol heat is definitely there. The coffee adds some nice roastiness without becoming overwhelming. In the end, the flavors were too subtle, which made drinking it somewhat boring.
Tap at Brewdog Glasgow. Lots of alcohol, roast, smoke, liquorice. Taste is good, smooth, dark maltiness, more alcohol, cocoa, coffee. Nice.

Pours pitch black with a thin dark brown head. Aroma is coffee, roasted malt, caramel, dried cherry. Flavor is an excellent balance of sweet, bitter, roasty and coffee. Really big with hidden alcohol. As always excellent!
Chocola, koffie, zwaar maar drinkbaar. Heerlijk. Marks favoriet op zn vrijgezellen feest. Pitch black.

750 pours a dark black with a tan brown head that does not dissipate. Smells strongly of a velvet like chocolate flavor with heavy alcohol. Has a velvet bodied with some surprisingly sharp carbonation still mostly hid by the heaviness. Has an alcohol heavy fudge/ chocolate flavor, coffee doesnt show so much. Can tell its heavy abv but doesnt taste like that so much, my bottle is 5 or 6 m old. Good but not especially standout to me.

Pours pitch black with brown head. Tastes intense, a bit salty with roasted notes, a bit alco in the throath. After barley wine feels super smooth. Great ethalon imperial stout. Third time I drink this and still love this.

Going from notes, pours thick and dark with little head. Aroma was ok, not overwhelming. tasted little of coffee or chocolate. Have heard such great things about this, but perhaps my expectations allowed me to expect more. Very good beer, however, and worth the price.
Pours very dark with a brown head. Good rich aroma. Lovely coffee taste and mouth feel.

wow que dire de plus acheter a nyc lors d un voyage je surement y retourner m en acheter mais que j y retoune. une tres noir on on ressent tout le cafe expresseo avec un gout bourbon c est tres bon dans yeule le gout est trresd present et terriblement gouteux tout est la pour que cette imperal stout soit magnifique bravo

2k rating! A black body with a tan head that faded away to a thin coating. Aroma had a strong coffee malt presence. Some leather and alcohol. Flavor had a heavy roasted malt flavor, complemented by coffee. Mild chocolate and alcoholin the finish. Moderate mouth feel.

Bottle split two ways. Accompanied by a Cohiba. Pitch black pour with a small tan head. Nose has loads of freshly ground coffee, vanilla and chocolate. Taste is super smooth with the coffee bitterness, vanilla and chocolate sweetness. Really good stuff!

Keg at brewdog bar, Sheffield. pitch black with a lacy tan head. Aroma is all coffee with milk/cream on the nose and a bit of liquorice in the mouth. Taste is sticky sweet and espresso bitter. Some alcohol warmth, but not much considering the abv, medium body with oil and medium carb. Very nice.

Bottle, black body, big, creamy, walnut colored head fades slowly, leaving decent lacing. Aroma is raisin, cherry, bourbon and vanilla, coffee. Taste is vanilla, chocolate, sweet coffee, citrus rind. Palate is smooth, rich, carbonation very subdued and soft. This is on the sweet side for me, but the palate and flavors are excellent.

Bomber to a pint. New Year's Day 2015. Thick black pour with thin tan head and lacing. Wow, huge rich coffee nose. Roasted malty toffee notes. Warm boozy finish. Lived up to the hype ... One of the best !!!

Dark opaque brown-black, ample tan head, quite foamy. Tobacco, coffee, dark chocolate. Fairly bitter, some underlying sweetness. Heavy, chewy body. Alcohol is somewhat present. Long finish. Very good.

Stepbrother got me a bottle of this for his wedding. Knew I had been wanting to try it for a while and brought to my monthly beer club meeting. Poured jet black with medium tan head. Aroma is strong boozy coffee. Flavor likewise a reflection. Very thick strong bitter coffee with lots of booze on backend. Overall an enjoyable sipper but probably couldnt drink more than one. Made me super thirsty.

Aroma is booze, coffee, booze and more booze. (My bottle was 8months old, maybe there might be some hop hints that already left the building). A very thick imperial stout. A lovely coffee taste and nice roastness. Ace stout

Wow, had read about this many times, delighted when brewdog online got hold of some. The aroma is coffee , chocolate, malt, but also a hint of hops. This was always going to have a mouthfeel of thick cream, the abv has to give sweetness, but the coffee gives a clean finish at the end. Trying to be restrained with my sipping, but it is gorgeous. And a big bottle. World class!

UPDATED: JUN 1, 2015 Extremely pitch black color, no light coming through it whatsoever. Fluffy brown head with medium retention. Aroma is powerful, full of coffee beans and bitterweet chocolate, of course, tones of roasted malts and, on the background, molasses, caramel and dark fruits. Incredible mouthfeel, full-creamy-viscous-bodied. Mind blowing! Extreme coffee bean flavour, dark chocolate, cocoa, toffee, dark malts... anything you can imagine in an Imperial Stout but powered to the limit. Extremely balanced, alcohol is so well hidden. Aftertaste is bitterweet and ridiculosly persistent. Amazing journey!
The perfect stout, smooth and chocolaty as it should be. Extremely drinkable compared to the strength
Currently I am updating my ratebeer with al the beers I drank but was too lazy to rate at the time. I give the scores I gave back than. If I drink the beers again I might re-rate them.

Beautiful pour with nice thick tan/brown head. Mostly coffee aroma. Taste of a nearly perfect imperial stout heavy on the coffee. So delicious, and warmth of alcohol going down. Not sure I need to drink this huge bottle in one sitting, but what the heck. Why not?

Cervesa molt ben estructurada en tots els sentits, tant en aroma com en gust, predomina el cafè, però les maltes també li aporten dolçor.
Cerveza muy bien estructurada en todos los sentidos, tanto en aroma como en sabor, predomina el café, pero las maltas también le aportan dulzor.
This one is just perfect. Great aroma, brilliant taste. Smooth and rich. One of my favourites.

bottle from ammersin. bottled on 02/04/2014. (very) black color, light coffee colored head. smells of milk coffee, liqueur, light coconut, tiramisu, rum. full body, starts sweet, creamy texture, tastes of (milk) coffee / cacao, alcohol very (too) apparent, bitter malty aftertaste. should be interesting to compare this to a bottle that has aged a bit.

Bottle pour. Incredible aroma. Beans, smoke, malt, caramel, bread, roasty, coffee, goes on and on. very complex and intense. pours a pitch black oil. very smooth, light to medium body with medium bitterness. really good.

On tap at Saraveza in Portland OR. Poured into a Belgium sniffer. Pours black with a thin mocha head. Could smell chocolate and light smell of coffee. Very smooth...tastes of dark chocolate and slightly of coffee.

Bomber, poured into a snifter at room temperature.

A: Pours a viscous black, forming a thick ecru head that leaves lacing even as it dies to a cap and thick ring. The iPhone flashlight test reveal no light at all getting through, save at the very top edge of the beer, where the color turns a murky dark brown at the very edge of the liquid. No complaints about lacing during consumption - theres plenty, and its sticky.

S: Medium roast coffee strikes out of the glass straightaway, as fragrant as if it were freshly brewed. Beneath it, notes of a deep, dark roasted malt swirl about, alongside some hints of bitter dark chocolate and a vague nuttiness.

T: Coffee stout indeed, as those notes are again at the forefront, a medium roasted blend. The black-burned malts are there as well, a charred bitterness to them, with notes of scorched toffee and seared caramel alongside. Vague, ephemeral suggestions of dark cocoa and figgy fruit waft through the flavor profile here and there, and it finishes with a dark, deeply bitter, tongue-biting earth and ash bitterness that lingers long after the swallow.

M: As if drinking heavy whipping cream straight from the carton, this is a full, silky stout.

O: Not a bad coffee imperial stout at all. Definitely one of the better balanced versions Ive had, if still a bit heavy-handed on the hop side for my personal taste. In a style-neutral comparison, Id take the AleSmith Wee Heavy over this any day of the week and twice on any day ending with a Y, but this is far from a bad beer.
On tap at BrewDog Dundee. Bloody lovely. Pours black with a thin mocha head. Smelly of coffee. Tastes of dark chocolate and slightly coffee.
garrafa de 660ml trazida pelo amigo Bruno de Sao Paulo. bela cerveja. mas esperava mais. a even more jesus é melhor

On tap at the tipsy cow in madison. Dark brown with minimal tan head. Aroma of coffee and chocolate. This beer is big and roasted. Flavor full of coffee, roasted malt, chocolate and more roast. Smooth and slightly warming. Finished with a roasted dryness and a long lingering roasted coffee flavor that never falls into cold weak coffee territory. I think the alcohol and bakers chocolate flavors keep from just being the all to common stout with weak coffee aftertaste beer. I really enjoyed this.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Efficace. Goût prononcé de torréfaction et café. Le houblon cherche à sortir en finale. À boire au complet en 2h pour apprécier les saveurs.
Amazing beer. Slightly smokey and chocolate taste that leaves a pleasantly bitter aftertaste. Aroma of roasted coffee.
Bottle share at Mermaid Juice! Big beautiful black bomber. Great beer, but it didnt quite reach the Hunahpu they cracked afterwards.

Bottle - 750ml. Pour an opaque black body with very low carbonation and a thick, lasting brown foamy/creamy head. Wonderful, rich, complex malty/hoppy aroma with chocolate, vanilla, and coffeeish hints. Alcohol is perfectly hidden. Its fantastic, perfectly balanced taste carries roasted coffee, cocoa, licorice, and oaky notes. Texture is soft. Ends with a long, robust, warming bitter/roasty finish. First class!
