Brödig och lite sötsyrlig röda bär-smak. Fyllig munkänsla med hög eldighet.

Black licorice, blackcurrant and coffee. Alcohol is dominant but serves as basis to flavors. Excellent IS. 
Café, chocolat noir, réglisse noire et alcool sont les dominantes du premier nez. Se développent ensuite des accents de figues, de fruits noirs (mures) avec un léger soupçon de caramel. Le visuel est noir, opaque, mousse brune, crémeuse, avec un mélange de grosses bulles. Son maintient est cependant court. Quelques traces demeurent sur le verre. Son attaque est réchauffante avec son alcool prononcé. Le café domine tout au long de son processus gustatif, laissant une profonde amertume de torréfaction. On sent bien les petits fruits et la réglisse noire se développer, mais le café reste dominant. En bouche, sa texture est crémeuse et elle présente un bon équilibre entre alcool fruits et café. Excellente impérial stout. Bonne amertume de torréfaction.

750 ml bottle. Pours black with tall, long lasting, creamy, brown head, nice lacing and lovely carbonation. Aroma is of roasted malt, toast, dark fruit herbal hops. Body is full, creamy and slightly crisp. Taste is of nutty, toasted malt, coffee, chocolate, brown sugar, dark fruit and herbal hops. Finish is long and bitter. Great Imperial Stout.
Aroma of coffee and roasted malt, pours a clear dark black without much head. Tastes of coffee and malt with a creamy feel and a bitter coffee finish.

Bue en bouteille de 75cl à la brasserie, couleur noire, peu de mousse, effervescence quasi inexistante, une bière que je voulais boire depuis très longtemps, une attaque sur le café assez forte et sur le chocolat puis continuité énorme sur le moca et le cappucinno, fin de bouche sur lalcool vraiment trop forte le fin de bouche. Pas assez équilibré à mon goût.

Bue en bouteille de 75cl. Incroyable stout d'un noire profond, mousse moka. Arômes de café au nez puis explosion au palais. Grosse corpulence, longueur en bouche sans fin. Superbe complexité, équilibre parfait. Huge !
Poured from a bottle. Part of a blind taste test. Dark caramel color. Rich mocha taste, kind of thick.

poured from a bottle. Medium brown color, small off white head. Not much of an aroma. Medium body with a thick bourbon malt flavor and a medium finish. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

750ml Bottle - Black with a tan head. Cocoa, coffee, roasted malt and vanilla in the aroma. Roasted and fairly smooth taste with coffee, vanilla, cocoa and liquorice. Undoubtedly a great beer, but I was expecting a bit more from this.

Speedway Stout is a HUGE Imperial Stout, with pounds and pounds of coffee added during conditioning for a little extra kick! This is a limited-edition Formula and itll definitely get you racing! It is available in 750 ml. champagne bottles.

750ml bottle from Vinmonopolet Vika. Tiny brown head. Black opaque body. Aroma is coffee, dark fruits, dark chocolate, leather , alcohol and caramel. Taste is more bitter than expected. Quite sweet and salty as well. Feels thick on the palate. Dry finish.
Great beer. Not really anything I can say even remotely wrong with this beer. Amazing!!!
on tap caffe cioccolato amaro cacao buona secchezza amaro medio torrefatto buona beva per i gradi

Smooth carmel with a great coffee taste
  

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Smells a little acidic at first, but that soon gives way to dark fruit and malt sweetness. The coffee and dark chocolate make an appearance in the aroma, but are not nearly as strong as I would have thought. Smells more like a Belgian beer than a stout. It doesnt pour out thick like some big Imperial Stouts, but it is completely black with a light brown ring of foam. Tastes slightly bitter with good coffee undertones and some booze heat in the aftertaste. The plum/raisin flavor is also present throughout each sip. Palate is a little watery. Overall a very solid stout; it would be good aged.

On tap at their tasting room. Pours a very dark brown with a thin brown head. Aroma is coffee and slight roast. Lots of coffee on the flavor. Bitter. Fairly dry. Raisins and plums. Really nice and smooth. Great beer. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

The aroma is an excellent combination of chocolate, maple syrup, vanilla, bourbon, and light coffee (lighter than you would expect). It pours a dark brown, virtually black, with no transparency and a small brown head that diminishes to virtually nothing over time. The flavor starts with chocolate, vanilla, and maple syrup.

Sweet, caramelly, and peat notes are also present. I also get a little coffee aroma, too. Mostly opaque dark mahogany cola color with a dark brown head that is small with nice lacing. Roasted, choco/coffee maltiness to start. Rather warming. Light bourbon notes are present in the start and in the finish.
Great beer. Near black pour with tan head. Aroma is light roast coffee. Taste is cocoa and coffee. Love this.
Bottle. Pours coca cola black with a beige head. Aroma is dark chocolate, coffee. Flavor follows nose, toasty coffee on dark chocolate. Mild raisin too. not too hot for a 13% beer.

From San Diego! Pitch black with a tan head that's not thick but has huge bubbles. Sticky legs. Smells of very dark roasted malt, lots of coffee, raisin/soy sauce, heavy booze, very bitter. Big aroma that's nicely balanced. Tastes of roasted malt, coffee, medium bitterness,. Clean finish. Body is silky smooth, thin but incredibly creamy, really nice. Has the same fineness as the other Alesmith beers I've tried but vastly bigger, more complex, more tasty. A truly great stout, probably within the top 10 beers I've had.

Bottle from SD (via G&M) at home. Solid black pour with bubbly creamy tan head - big round tapioca-like bubbles embedded in the head too. Aroma is rich coffee - like fresh roasted beans more than actual liquid coffee - very caramel-y with booziness too. Great so far. Taste is BIG - boozy, roasted coffee bitterness, caramel again. Palate is rich and creamy with fine carbonation, but not too slick. Great imperial stout, lives up to the hype. And not raisiny!

UPDATED: NOV 11, 2014 Bottle. Beermoth, Manchester. Just about black. Thin, lasting, bubbly, light brown head. Roast malts. Light, roast coffee bean. Some greenery. Taste is dry, and light bitter. A little tartness. Palate is airy, and smooth. Not as full as I expected. Finishes fairly dry, and long, roasty bitter. 
Finished this a day later. The tartness has subsided somewhat. The palate, as a result, seems fuller. Re-rated from 3.6 to 3.8.

750 mL bottle. The pour is beautiful. Jet black and thick. With a gorgeous dark khaki brown head and some unbelieveable lacing. The aroma is huge on coffee. There is a beautiful malt profile and some great licorice. There is a little booze and a subtle bitterness that's a little surprising. It's just really good. The flavor is just great. There is a beautiful roast and strong licorice presence that dominates coffee a little that isn't apparent on the aroma. The mouth feel is ridiculous. So thick and creamy. Velvety carbonation for days. Just like nitrogen infused molasses. The aftertaste is great. Light coffee but heavy roast and beautiful dark fruits. I love this beer

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

#250. Shared with koleminer20. You da man. Aroma is coffee, licorice, chocolate, roasted malt, some booze. Appearance is black, brown head, ridiculous lacing. Taste is coffee, roasted malt, licorice, booze. Mouthfeel is ridiculously thick, oily, great carbonation, although hot, that doesnt hinder things. Overall, wow. I wouldve preferred a lot more coffee in the flavor, but it still does the job.
Shared big bottle at Brewdog bar Stockholm. Dark, powerful, malty with chocolate and coffee. Very good.

Pours black with a whitish/tan head. Nothing to write home about on looks or aroma. Upfront flavours are great coffee/Chocolate but this bitch brings its game on the after palate. Loads of lingering dark fruits that really show the quality of this beer. I think a bit overrated but still a ripping beer!

On draft at Chucks.  Thin film of firm, tan head.  Sticks together - not much lace.  Dark coffee and cloudy.  Aroma is cocoa, coffee, winy alcohol notes, licorice, molasses, roasted barley.  Primarily sweet taste, with some umami (wow), and a hint of sourness and bitterness on the finish.  Full bodied, heat from the alcohol, creamy, lightly carbonated, surprisingly dry finish.  This is a top notch imperial stout!

Coffee and beer, whats not to like. A lot of breweries F this up. Alesmith got it right. Doesnt taste like 12%, the nose is coffee and booze, looks like asphalt in a glass, but tastes a lot better. Had to go back and buy bottles to try later.
Errghh not this fucking Alesmith noise again. Fucking lawnmower beer at best.

Bottle. Pours thick all black with huge tan creamy head, settles to one finger. Aroma is coffee and chocolate, mocca like. Dark fruits and some coffee berries, caramel and tons of malt and roasty. Subtle soya. Taste is super rich and balanced. Sweet mellow malts, loads of coffee, dark chocolate with roasty bitter dark chocolatey finish. Has the espresso citricy. Full bodied. So rich and balanced, with no absence of the 12 abv.

(Bottle @ VilleValla Pub, Linköping, Oct 31 2014) Pours jet black with a smallish tan head with slight lace. Aroma is extremely powerful, a huge hit of freshly roasted coffee underpinned by some bittersweet chocolate and hints of slightly sweet dark malt, but really just in service of backing up all that awesome coffee. On the palate, theres a little hint of sweet dark/toffee malt at first with a bit of chocolate, but loads of coffee and roast pile in quickly and start to dry that out, powerfully espresso-driven in the middle with chocolate in support. The drying out continues into the finish, with roast coffee, roasted malt and a light grassy hop bitterness along with just a hint of alcohol helping the process. The finish and aftertaste is wonderfully complex, with notes of espresso, bittersweet chocolate, grassy hops, a bit of dark fruit all making themselves known as it lingers for ages on the tongue. Medium bodied with fairly light carbonation, not syrupy but still mouth-filling. Just a gorgeous stout, the concentration of coffee is super and backed up with a big, flavourful but dry, roasty and never cloying stout. Super easy to drink for 12% but really a sipping brew.
Dark black appearance w/ small tan head. Ultra smooth for 12%.  Excellent balanced aroma. Just a odd hint of dark fruit, but otherwise great dark coffee stout flavor.

UPDATED: JUN 19, 2015 Bottle. Pours pitch black with a thick brown head. Aromas of sweet dark fruits, slight malt, roasted coffee and some dark chocolate. Taste is sweet fruits up front, some roasted coffee beans, molasses, fudge, bitter dry chocolate.

Pours jet black with a beautiful brown head that lasts long time. 
Aroma is coffee, chocolate, espresso. Taste is roasty, caramel, coffee, dark chocolate. Little bit bitterness added to the mix, that make this HUGE stout a definte winner. Brilliantly balanced, cannot wait to try the Barrel Aged version of this.

This one lives up to the hype 100%. Big is not an understatement. I feel like I am drinking coffee that turns into beer as you leave it in your mouth. Everything is done well. Begins with the most roast Ive had in a stout. I dont know if its Oakes or not but has those elements. Hops are present and a bit spicy but the beer is not bitter. dark chocolate as well.
Wonderful. Jet black with little head and strong coffee aroma and flavors. Roasted malts with caramel, molasses and chocolate. Really good sipping beer!

Aroma: toasted malts, coffee, maybe some dark chocolate. Appearance: black, small, creamy, beige head. Taste: medium sweet and light bitter. Palate: toasted malts, coffee, initial sweets make space for light bitter, long finish. Overall: fantastic Imperial Stout, excellent palate and aroma. Pint at AleSmith Brewing Company, San Diego.

A present from Harrisoni because he knew I was desperate to try it. Black. Lots of plum and chocolate flavours. Very smooth which I wasnt expecting. Not as intense as something like De Molens Hell and Damnation but very very drinkable.

UPDATED: DEC 16, 2014 750ml bottle served in a snifter glass.
A: Pours a deep black oil like color forming a medium brown head which is bubbled but quite aired, with big bubbles. Retention is low, however, a small layer lasts forever and some lacings are left in the glass. Kind of small bubbles around. Just beautiful 
S: Smell is quite sweet and dark chocolate like with strong notes of moka coffee, roasted malts and a bit of alcohol in the end
T: Perfect taste. Sweet upfront followed by intense dark chocolate, coffee and roasted malts. End is roasted malts bitterness mixed with a delicious grassy hops bitterness and taste. Perfect
M: Such a powerful and, at same time, delicate beer. Extremely pleasant in the mouth you do not fell the 12% ABV, impressive. Body is medium and carbonation is low. Mouthfeel is a bit molasses. Upfront in sweet and the end is bitter as it just should be
O: Absolutely drinkable. Impressive quality. Perfect American Stout
[ BA Review @ 7/28/2012 ]

Lovely coffee, sweet bourbon (almost rum) nose. Pours almost jet black with a lacy tan head. This is a beautifully balanced imperial stout -- roasted coffee, slightly bitter chocolate, a solid hint of booziness, well roasted malt, a hint of cherry and a touch of cream. There are enough hops underneath to help support the classic stout elements. Great balances and a long but clean finish

Cappucino immediately springs to mind when popping the cap. Lots of nasal-burning blasts of alcohol, tar, and fresh coffee beans. The aroma is spectacular, but all other characteristics seem concealed within. The appearance is a sheer delight that includes plentiful carbonation and a velvety mouthfeel. Mild roast lies beneath the stacks of bittersweet chocolate, Ryan Bros. coffee, and burnt malts. Long finish of dark chocolate-coated espresso beans. Awesome stuff. 2003 What happened? Nowhere near the same brew. The aroma and flavors no longer boast the elegant coffee flavors. Moreover, the mouthfeel is far less than velvety and much thinner. A huge disappointment from Skip Vs version. Interesting, since this is supposedly the same recipe.

Bottle. Pours a black color with tan head. Coffee, chocolate, burnt, roasty aromas. Thick, syrupy mouthfeel. Coffee, cocoa flavors dominate, with a bit of alcohol. A very tasty beer, but based on this experience, I wouldnt considered it 100/100th Percentile. Pretty good, but not quite that good.

10/10/14. Draft at Criterion. Yes, big and bad. Just had an Old Raspitun a couple of nights ago and this goes further on all fronts than that benchmark. Big complex palate with the ABV to balance the overload of roasted malts and hops. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Shared 75 cl bottle with TurtleBrain for his birthday. 
Aroma of coffee, alcohol, black malt, amazing. 
Pours pitch black with big tan head. A small head last the whole time. Moderate bitterness, alcohol, moderate sweetness, bitter chocolate. 
Great body, finish is long lasting, thick oily texture, light+ carbonation

First beer rating.
Shared a 75 cl bottle with DroolYeast for my birthday. It was his present to me.

Aroma of coffee. Pitch black apperance with a longlasting brown head.
Heavy bitterness with light sweet- and sourness.
Full body with at thick texture. Soft carbonation on the tongue with a long bitter finish of coffee and alcohol.

Ovarall a very good stout that went well with the fillets.

Year and a half old bottle. Dark brown pour, black in the glass, with a medium sized, light brown head. The aroma has a lot of dark chocolate upfront, with some strong coffee, dark stone fruit, burnt notes, and both medium and dark roast. A slight touch of alcohol as it warms. The flavor stars out big and sweet, with a strong chocolate and coffee. The sweetness is toned down a bit by some mellow astringency and bitterness from the coffee. A lot of caramel and coffee in the finish. Huge body balances everything and also hides the alcohol well. Fantastic.

Black with no head or lacing. Chocolate, dark coffee, raisins and leather. Chocolate sweetness with a raisiny bitterness. Heavy body with a perfect balance. Long lingering aftertaste that just makes you wanna have one more sip of it.
UPDATED: JUL 15, 2016 Draft. Pours black. Aroma and taste are roasted malts, dark chocolate, and coffee.

Bottle. This beer is just way too much, so upfront in all manners. Aroma roasted malts and coffee. Taste roasted malts and coffee, thick as engineoil, long lingering taste that goes on for ever. There´s such a lack of finesse in this beer. As I´m not a fan of the too much of everything approach, this beer leaves med cold, but sure a beer I´ll remember, but I don´t think I´ll try it again.

Pours as dark as your missus gets when you come home from the pub a couple hours later than expected (OK...6 hours). Yields a moderate tan head that dissipates quickly but laces well. Malty Roasty and earthy aromas alongside a sneak peek of the coffee. Covers the tongue with a luxurious lathering of awesome. Big Coffee, toast, burnt sugar/toffee and aniseed tasting notes with a hint of some stone fruit in the background and a generous whack of booziness which isnt unwelcome. Roasty toasty lingers along with an espresso bitterness.

bottle @ Chief Market / Lima OH --- Opaque black color, full tan head, bands and streaks of lace. Taste is clean strong toasted malt that grows adding coffee and dark chocolate in the palate, moving smoothly from there to an already balanced finish. A huge delicious Imperial Stout. Perfect for sipping with friends.
Shared bottle at Borris House, Co Carlow. No notes, rated from memory. Shared bottle at Borris House, Co Carlow. No notes, rated from memory.
Shared bottle. 750ml. Black pour with wispy tan head. Big coffee, lactose, chocolate notes. Taste follows nose with a luxurious velvet mouthfeel. Really good.
Pours motor oil black with small tan head. Smooth and roasty. Chocolate and coffee with notes of vanilla. Bitter finish. Alcohol is masked well but hits you right away.

Bottle in the hop garden. 
Sweet nose, vanilla, coffee, alcohol. 
Black color with brown notes, light brown head. 
Full body, sweet, coffee, alcohol, round mouthfeel, warming by the alcohol. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Huge yes huge...aroma of roast and cocoa and slight anis. Black, great tan head almost nitro like tight bubbles. Excellent flavor of richness all blended perfectly together. Unbelievable.!!!!!

Growler pour jet black. Nose mostly coffee and some bitter chocolate. Taste big roast, coffee, chocolate, and some dark fruit. Moderate mid palate bitter with lots of roast. Long finish. Coating mouth feel.

75cl. Bottle. Bottled on 2013-07-30. 
Poors black with light brown head. 
Aroma alcohol, coffee, chocolate, liquorice, caramel, vanilla, anis, molasses, raisin, roasted malts, dark fruits. 
Taste all kinds of sweets from the aroma, nice roasted coffee bitter, warming alcohol. 
Mouthfeel silky, oily, little dry. 
Amazing imp. stout!

UPDATED: JAN 31, 2015 Famous West-Coast imperial stout with actually added coffee powder (so a true coffee stout as well). Pretty thick, dense, creamy, pinkish beige head, colour black with a ruby hue only visible under bright light, clear. Very tempting, elegant and complex aroma of coffee beans, citrussy hops, toffee, sweet tobacco, soy sauce, cinnamon, liquorice, sage, vanilla, meat broth, elderberries... Soft and smooth palate with loads of candied fruits, very oily and mouth-filling, silky, clear coffee powder but beautifully blended into a very rich and profound, complex dark maltiness, roasted bitterness in the end with leafy and citrussy hop bitterness, very long, rich, dry and enormously satisfying. I can easily see why this scores so high on this site, this is easily one of the best imperials I ever tasted. Thanks to Lieven from the Velootje pub in Ghent for sharing this with me, this will remain stuck in my beer memory forever.

Pours black, like old motor oil, with a thick, beige head. Aromas are dark chocolate, gypsum, coffee and licorice. Flavors are dark chocolate, vanilla, molasses, raisin. and coffee. Finishes with a lingering licorice-molasses bite and big booziness. Creamy-syrupy mouthfeel. This is a huge, huge beer. Lots of complexities. Very decadent.

Bottle. Black body with brown smooth head. Wonderful Aroma of roasted malts with vanilla, chocolate, coffee, with hints of dried fruits and hints of caramel. Taste is nearly the same as the Aroma with an very rich and oily mouthfeel. Aftertaste is perfect balanced between sweetness and bitterness. Perfect.

Pours a deep, oily, brown-black, with minimal, cream-colored head. Aroma of dark fruit (plums, raisins, and such), coffee, chocolate. Flavor is marked by fruit, licorice/anise, some chocolate, some coffee, even a touch of leather. Very sweet, almost cloying, but not quite. This is a really good imperial stout.

Another overrated US hype? Let me tear it to pieces... It pours a viscous-looking, black body with a long-lived, medium brown head, ok lacing. The aroma is strong and simply amazing: it has the perfect balance between dark roasted malt with accompanying coffee notes and sweeter and more gentle notes of sweet caramel and chocolate. Also bark and ash in the back. Very strong flavour of coffee that dries up the finish. Dark roasted notes and chocolate, vanilla in the back and hints of leather. The alcohol is very well integrated. The taste is a bit less sweet than most imperial stouts, the long-lasting finish is heavy bitter. Full body, oily to dry texture, soft carbonation. This is definitely on my top 3 ever! 
[75 cl bottle shared at home with Svensenga Smak & Behag, enjoyed 15 months after bottling, from Vinmonopolet Vika, Oslo]

This is probably the best beer Ive ever had. A: is, chocolate, coffee , toffee. Ap.: pitch black with small tan head. T: chocolate, coffee, malt, toffee. P: sticky and just stays with, chocolate, roasty goodness. O: I would say this is the single best beer Ive ever had.

Bottle (old rating). Black beer, brown head. No idea whether its hazy or clear. Heavy aroma of black coffee, with hint of sweet/sour soy-sauce and some (dutch) vetkrijt. Initially sweet and bitter are in balance, but the bitterness increases quickly and ends in a roasty aftertaste with coffee, licorice and that soysauce-like umami taste. And alcohol, of course.

UPDATED: APR 30, 2017 From a 750ml bottle on 25/8/2014. Pours close to black with a medium tan head. Has a strong, quite sharp aroma of caramel, coffee, dark fruit and a touch of booze. While pleasant, the nose doesnt scream necessarily scream world beater. Thankfully, the flavour does. This is a sweet luscious beast where chocolate, both milk and dark, ultimately hold sway. But there is so much more going on in the background, with the coffee very noticeable, along with caramel, vanilla, a hint of toffee, and dates, raisins and plums. While a real sweet, dessert like experience overall, the bitterness is also present in spades, with both roasty and hoppy notes in the mix. The palate is sensational - creamy, velvety and lovely with soft carbonation. Ridiculously easy to drink for 12%, this is just a magnificent drop. Behind only Peche Mortel in terms of impys for mine, and only just. You know youve had something really special when you pay $35 for a bottle of beer and feel like its terrific value. Rating: 4.5.

Re-rate on 30/4/2017 (from a 473ml can). I loved it when I first had it, but it is even better than I remember. I have never had a beer with better mouthfeel. It has everything - depth, complexity, length. Fucking magnificent. The new champ.

Bottle from a friend. Deep vanilla and coffee aroma, smells very good. Pours black with a medium brown head. Taste has coffee, vanilla and chocolates together wit some roasted malts. The palate is deep and oily. Overall a really nice beer which definitely lives up to the hype.
Legit good amazing holy cow this is good. So great as it warms up. Drink this at about 50 degrees F.
kolsvart med mellanstort ljusbrunt skum. Doftar kaffe och choklad! Väldigt rund och massor med kaffe och choklad! ! Lite alkohol. Från 2011 och riktigt bra!
Champagne bottle. Wonderful aroma of coffee & malt. Hey black color with a tan head that fades quickly. Flavor is lots of coffee, malt, & roast. Very full bodied. Wonderful beer!

750ml bottle. Black or very dark brown with a foamy light brown head. Aroma seems pretty shy when awoken from slumber, but some coffee notes start to come forth, with dark malts and caramel behind. Taste is chocolate, vanilla, distinct but by no means overpowering coffee accent, and a minor hint of fruit. High marks for integrating the coffee so seamlessly. Superbly poised mouthfeel, thick but not cloying, and extremely drinkable for the strength. Great stuff.

(Draft at Brookland Pint in DC) Black body with a small, creamy brown head, good lacing. Full bodied, thick and creamy; feels "delicious". Aroma sweet, caramel, chocolate, coffee, vanilla, and alcohol. Strongly sweet but not cloying, balanced with strong but not biting bitterness; coffee and chocolate; vanilla; hint of sourness; strong alcohol but not harsh; long finish. Stout is not my favorite style, but a great stout is a great thing.
Nice sweet roasted aroma. Dark brown with small light brown cap. Taste sweet with roated coffee bitterness, some crarbonistion bitternes on the tongue tip.

Pitch dark (a bit brownish) with brown head. Strong alcohol aroma at the beginning, but after a while, everything gets softer, including own head :D. Aroma - clear, strong chocolate, coffee, alcohol, same as taste - great ballanced and awesome brew. Best when cooled a bit.

Bouteille. Saveur bière. Robe noir profond surmontée d'une onctueuse mousse beige. Nez robuste partagé par la fève de chocolat et les notes grillérs de malt et de café. Notes boisées et fruitées sur l'alcool de prune. Corps puissant et voluptueux où l'on retrouve les notes puissantes cacaotées et torréfiées du nez. La finale est longue, sèche et amère , explosive sur l'orangette, le réglisse, le fondant au chocolat et le café serré. Pointe d'alcool en arrière goût. Un dessert et un digestif combiné dans une bouteille. Une tuerie.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Good heavy imperial stout with nutty aroma and taste of coffee and forrest berries. Unfortunately I got a metally aftertaste I didnt care for too much.

Aromas extraordinarios desde un principio. Es difícil distinguir aromas precisos en una bebida con notas muy diferentes. Sin embargo destacan en primera instancia el café, maltas tostadas, chocolate, vainilla, algo de frutas, quizá berrys y algo de licor al final.

En cuanto a su apariencia, completamente negra, corona de espuma abundante de media retención, cuerpo redondo y nula carbonatacion.

En boca es suave, cremosa y con un extraordinario equilibrio, ligeramente amarga en un principio y ligeramente dulce al final.

Al paladar es sumamente compleja y exquisita a la vez. Suave y cremosa, chocolate amargo en un principio, café posteriormente, notas dulces y malteses al final, destellos frutales, quizá zarzamora y notas a vainilla. Simplemente genial. Quizá al final, después del trago se perciben notas alcohólicas, quizá un licor o notas a brandy que te recuerdan sus 12 grados AVB.

En resumen una extraordinaria cerveza, muy rica, bien balanceada, compleja y la cual se disfruta a cada trago.

Noire et crémeuse, avec une mousse très foncée, brune cacao, qui disparait peu à peu. Le nez est très chocolaté, velouté et intense. Avec un soupçon de vanille en arrière-plan. Bouche très ronde, complexe, qui se termine sur une amertume torréfiée à lextrême, elle dévoile toute son épaisseur. On ressent un peu lalcool sur la fin. Seul défaut donc : manque de subtilité, de finesse. Sinon, cest un colosse tout de noir enrobé, avec des saveurs explosives et percutantes.

Az első és utolsó meglepetés a fólia alatt lapuló kupak - nem pedig pezsgős dugó - megpillantása volt, lényegében (kissé előrehozva a talán nem túl kétes végkifejletet) ez volt az egyetlen dolog, amivel kapcsolatban másra számítottam az elfogyasztása során... Remekbe szabott illatát a kávé, kiváló minőségű étcsokoládé, pörkölt maláta és szivárványszínű édesség csodálatos harmóniája alkotja, mely egyébként meglehetősen ismerősen hat nem kevésbé illusztris típusok által hátrahagyott emlékképek által. Tejszínes, eszpresszós aromák ezek, melyek különleges pontossággal (de a legkevésbé sem egysíkúságuk miatt) képesek kialakítani az ízekkel kapcsolatos megérzéseket. Krémes, kávés, enyhén földes, összességében azonban a legmagasabb fokú bársonyosság hatását közvetítő, barátságos zamatok kelnek életre szánkban, melyeket a vártnál is intenzívebb mértékben csipkéz ki egy tűhegyes éllel szőtt alkoholfátyol, valamint markánsan karcosít egy férfias, komlós utóíz. Az a 12% alkohol a legkevésbé sem szándékozik a háttérben maradni, ebből a szempontból tehát semmi esetre sem foghatjuk az alattomosságra az üveg tartalmának elfogyasztása során előálló fiziológiai törvényszerűségeket. Az idő múlásával és a hőfok óvatos emelkedésével sem esik csorba ízének makulátlanságán, épp ellenkezőleg: leginkább kissé levegőztetve lép elő a kávészemek valódi természete, gömbölyded és sima, összetett aromája, a sör felsőbbrendűségének érzete, mely által a leghalványabb kétségünk sem marad afelől, hogy hősünk megérdemelten tetszeleg jelenlegi státuszában.
Had this at a fantastic tasting and had such a great time with great people and great beers!

Look: pours a dark black. Let's no light through it. Dark brown head, very thick. Thick lacing in the sides.
Smell: very malty. Dark Chocolate, coffee. Very sweet. Slight bitterness.
Taste: heavy chocolate. Very sweet. Like a milk shake. Slight coffee flavor.
Feel: slight bitterness thick film on the mouth.
Overall: great beer. Love the sweetness. Like the easy coffee flavor. 
First drank: lake of the ozarks 8/5/14
Great imperial stout, not just strong round and complex. Very delicious aftertaste, toasted and slightly discrete coffee ...

750 ml bottle. Pours a very dark black, with a small dark reddish brown hue when backlit. Head was minimal, possibly due to a non aggressive pour. Aroma is massive: bakers chocolate, coffee, and chocolate malt. Flavor is same with a rich creamy mouthfeel with a slight bitter lactic tang. A certain charred oak presence providing a pleasant smoky bitterness. From notes 1/22/11 (Geist BCBS Tasting).
Bottle at home, 1000th beer on untappd. Pours black, huge chocolate, coffee, dry and bitter, sweet.

Bottled 02/04/14. OK, been looking forward to this. Pours a very dark brown/black with a red edge. Aroma has booze, grass, tree bark, light cough medicine... Medium body, medium carbonation. Theres booze, light treacle, grass, nettle, wood, light coffee, dark choc... Its a little harsh - Id be curious to try an older bottle. That said, its really nice.

The beer was from the tap at Triangle Wine in Southern Pines. It pours black with a dark brown head. It has a strong coffee smell with a bit of chocolate. The taste is dominate by a rich, creamy taste of coffee with hints of chocolate.
Delicious. Bold but smooth. When you see 12% for a beer you may be turned off but the alcohol does not show to much. Toasted chocolate coffee make this a memorable beer. Very good.
Bottled. Deep black color with dark tan head. Very well balanced imperial that all stout fans must try.
(version 2011 ?) très puissant, très concentré en café, mais aussi beaucoup de fruits rouges et noirs dans le fond, très long.

750 ml bottle from The Local Pub, Athens Greece. Pitch black color with a nice thin brown head. Aromas of coffee, wood, chocolate, oak, liquorice, berries. Phenomenal taste, sweet from the malts and bitter from the coffee and roasted. Bitter aftertaste, long. Full body with low carbonation.

Pours very dark black with a thick foamy head that dissipates fairly quickly. Very tiny bubbles almost like a nitro beer. When cold not much aroma and creamy vanilla up front followed by bittersweet chocolate. As it warms you get more milk chocolate aroma and flavor, with a very mild coffee background. Light on palate and warming due to alcohol content. Very smooth and balanced. Quite a nice Imperial Stout. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Jet black with foamy brown head. Syrupy and smooth. The coffee shows up later in the sip and is well balanced. Chocolate aftertaste. Palate coating. Warming. Full bodied but goes down nicely.

Black pour, khaki head, deep rich aroma of roasted coffee and caramel. Thick and creamy, this brew flows over my tongue like a massive booze train, coming around the curves with a wallop of warm like nobodies business! There is no crisp to this, but a hot, comforting hug filled with coffee and nutty goodness. Velvety and black made me think to braise my dinner for this evening with it. Pork chops are to die for and the imperial stout to go with it made for the best meal of the month!
Im most definitely a fan!

Bottle shared in London - thanks to Dave! Pours black-brown with a frothy tan head. Well roasted malts in the nose, baking cocoa, burnt wood, soft cocoa. Medium to big sweet flavor with well rounded dark malt character, some torched earth bitterness, bittersweet cocoa. Full bodied with fine carbonation. Warming finish with bittersweet chocolate, burnt wood, coffee grounds. Solid, rich, well rounded.
Very good Stout. Smells and tastes fantastic. This one is my number one when it comes to stouts

This dark black beer has a creamy head. Strong espresso aromas with a boozy punch. It has a bold coffee flavor but is easier drinking than you would expect. We took small glasses and layered crumbled chocolate chip cookies with vanilla ice cream and poured this beer over the top. Amazing. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

A nice stout. Pours a very thick black sub a brown head. Huge coffee smell, with some cocoa. Taste is more coffee then most, with a bit of vanilla. Paired with a ice cream cookie beer Sunday, cuts out a bit of the coffee. Had in the bottle.

bottleshare thanks to Beechner224. Aroma is roasty and not much else. Pour is pitch black with a small light brown head. Taste is a light coffee with some chocolate. Never would have guessed there was coffee if it wasnt on the label.

Bottle share thanks to beechner224. Pours a deep dark nearly black with large light brown head. Big roasty aroma, chocolate malt, semisweet, light boozy note. Lots of roast in the flavor as well, chocolatey, semisweet, malty.

Small sample from bottle @ Zeebra II. Pours pitch black with a small tan head. Aroma has chocolate, roasted malts, some mocha and coffee. Taste also has chocolate, roasted malts, some coffee and a roasty medium bitter finish. Medium body and carbo. Nice stuff.

UPDATED: SEP 3, 2014 kindly shared by Jaghana! 
Couleur noire, légère mousse brune. Fort nez de café et chocolat, alcool et vieille prune. Gout de café doux amer, avec note houblonée, cholocolatée, réglisse, alcool et malt grillée, complexe mais légère en bouche, et super "buvable". Super!

Bottle 75cl kindly given by Julien thanks and shared with Dominique and Calisky ! A dark beer with good copper creamy head. Nose is intense on dark chocolate, coffee and peated notes. Aroma is rich on dark chocolate, very creamy and smooth, less sweet as the chocolate notes can be properly tasted, extremely drinkable, coffee notes, licorice notes at the finish. On aftertaste it gives a long bitter dark chocolate notes, technically an excellent brew.

Bottle that had been aging for around six years. Moderate malt aroma worth a strong alcohol wood aroma. Black color with a small brown head. Light sweet beginning with a moderate bitter malt finish. Not much coffee bean taste left but it does meld nicely with the strong malts. Palette is thick and rim of glass gets very sticky.

750mL bottle with a bottled on date of 2/28/2014. 


AP: motor oil black, with a nice and fluffy tan head; completely opaque. 


AR: dark chocolate, milk chocolate, black coffee, roasted malts,toffee and caramel.


TA: bitter dark chocolate, sweet milk chocolate, coffee, slightly raisiny, molasses and caramel.


MO: mouthfeel is thick and creamy with light carbonation; the coffee in the taste never goes away.


This sets the bar for coffee/imperial stouts.

Tap. Pours opaque black, medium creamy brown head, nice lacing. Aroma is rich espresso, roasted malts, Ashes, chocolate. Flavor is coffee rich, mocha, roasty. Light sweet, medium bitter. Fullish body, creamy mouthfeel. Hella good stuff.Earlier Rating: 5/29/2012 Total Score: 4.7Bottle. Pours clear black with a small brown head. Aroma is medium sweet roasted malt, chocolate, coffee with alcohol notes present. Taste is wonderful, dominated by chocolate, coffee and a warming finish from the alcohol.Thick and rich in the mouth. This is a big beer that deserves the hype around it.

Pours dark dark brown (OK, black) with a massive foamy mocha head. Nice lacing. A really fantastic head. Bountiful aroma of coffee, chocolate malt, brown sugar. Taste is a sharp and spicy malt coffee rolling over a warming bed of alcohol. Not too sweet, not too bitter. Some caramel and a touch of roast. Smooth and velvety. Outstanding.
Tap at Casanova. Black with no head or lacing. Chocolate, dark coffee, raisins and leather. Chocolate sweetness with a raisiny bitterness. Heavy body with a sticky feel.
On tap at Taps in Petaluma. Pours a dark black color with some brown head. Mild well balanced coffee flavor. Nothing too bitter. Balanced without the sweetness. Fantastic.

Awesome beer. Bottle poured to snifter. Pour was jet black, thick khaki head. Aroma of coffee and chocolate with hints of vanilla. Taste was the same, but I also got cinnamon notes as well. Very filling but I couldntstop myself from drinking the entire bottle. One of the better stouts Ive tried.

Bouteille 750ml. Couleur noire opaque, mousse moka crémeuse et tenace laissant une dentelle épaisse. Arôme de malt torréfié, caramel foncé, café noir, chocolat noir, fruits foncés. Goût de café noir, chocolat noir, malt torréfié, alcool indétectable, caramel salé en fin de bouche. Carbonatation faible, corps dense. Excellente.
UPDATED: JUN 9, 2014 From a 750ml bottle to a glass. Pour is absolute black. Roasted coffee. Chocolate. Nice aroma. Very nice beer. Very enjoyable.

Bottle (gift from my sister). Nice to try this big beer again, last time I had it was on tap in San Diego in 2006. A black coloured pour with a small beige head on top. Rich, roasty, coffee, chocolate aroma. Tastes similar, rich, roasty, coffee, chocolate, some dark fruit and soy. Rich and warming. A classic imperial stout for sure.
About as thick and as rich as a stout can be. Black and slick with a big body and almost no head. Tons of chocolate and coffee.

Bottle 75cl. at the Hoppy Pub, Thessaloniki. Pours black with a dark brown head. Appearance is lovely. Strong aromas of coffee, dark chocolate and some roasted malts. Taste is wonderful coffee flavor, chocolate and some hints of caramel at the end. Velvet mouth feel, with full body, low carbonation. Long lasting dry aftertaste of coffee and dark chocolate. This is a great imperial stout !

This beer definitely has a great coffee taste to it. The higher alcohol content is surprisingly hidden. Has a very nice toasty brown colored head that seems to stay all the way through the drink. Not disappointed one bit!

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
This beer is amazing, smells like chocolate milk with coffee, really sweet and the taste is wonderful, loads of chocolate and caramel upfront followed by some coffee notes and then some alcohol buzz

Pre-DLD bottle share at Hampton Inn. Pour is viscous black with a thin coffe colored head. Aroma and flavor is of ground coffee, cocoa power, booze, dark chocolate, and dark molasses. Finish is sweet and boozy with a bitter coffee aftertaste.
Bottle. Great aroma, roasted coffee flavor with a bit of caramel. Big smooth flavor and mouthfeel, a extremely pleasant beer. Not as bitter as a mikkellers, but it great for a chilly evening.

Bottle at The Winston with Ben and Pat. A beautiful looking beer, pitch black with a brown head. The aroma is all chocolate and coffee initially, but also some malt and a little alcohol, really nice. The flavour is coffee, roasted malts, sweet chocolate. There is a sugary impression. Really soft and balanced, but with a thick feel as well. Coffee long into the aftertaste. Such a nice beer.

750 ml bottle from HyVee Springfield, IL. Strong coffee smell with some chocolate. Beautiful black color with a lovely lingering mocha head. Tastes of coffee, chocolate, toffee, slight sweet malt, and cherry cordial. Complex and delicious. Fluffy on the palate with some creamy texture followed by the nice rounded hops. An amazing imperial stout!

Dark black in color... Aroma of rich, sweet coffee... Intensely rich espresso flavor, huge coffee notes, sweet roasted malty flavor... Coffee bitterness on palate... AmazingEarlier Rating: 10/12/2013 Total Score: 4Black in color with thin tannish head... Aroma of roasted malts, dark chocolate and roasted coffee beans... Velvety mouth feel, rich bold coffee taste and notes of bitterness from coffee, hints of booze... Hint of licorice, smoke, peated malts... Really nice complex brew

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bottle from Mikkeller & Friends Bottle Shop.
Great aroma, pours beautiful with a small tan head.
The taste is rich coffee, chocolate, roasted. Perfect!
Have had it before in Singapore, but that bottle tasted like it have had a rough life.
This one tasted perfect!

Yup, pretty much jet black, perhaps the slighted tinge of brown in the light. Not a lot of carbonation, very thick. The aroma is coffee, espresso, dark roast, French press, pretty much everything strong coffee. The taste is more assertive coffee, roasted and burnt malts. This is a serious imperial stout, impeccably crafted, but I wish the coffee was dialed back just a bit to allow more complexity to surface. Awesome stuff though.

750ml bottle - pours black with thick dark brown head . Aromas if dark cocoa , heavily roasted coffee and hints of dark fruit . Silky smooth palate . Hints of alcohol . Taste is dark cocoa and smooth espresso . This is about as good as it gets . Outstanding beer ! 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bottle. Black with a big dense mocha head. Aroma is sweet cocoa, and roasted malt. The taste adds rich dark roast coffee, dark chocolate, molasses, and notes of raisin and toffee. For so many big rich flavors speedway is surprisingly drinkable and smooth. Its perfectly balanced with a warm alcohol presence on the back end and soft light carbonation. Creamy mouthfeel. Overall, the epitome of a coffee stout. ---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

This brew says coffee and its in there bUt not overpowering. Pours jet black with a thin khaki head. Aroma is lightly roasted coffee. Coffee and chocolate fill your mouth with a touch of roasted malt.
750ml bottle. Black with a frothy tan head. Flavors are fresh coffee, molasses, caramel, dark/milk chocolate, roasted malts, licorice, vanilla. Full body, soft carbonation, creamy texture.
Apr. 26, 2014. Bottle from citybeer in SF. Pitch black. Small light brown head. Coffee and sweet chocolate in nose. Hints of cherries in flavour. Touch of sharpness. Quite a lovely imperial stout.

UPDATED: MAY 6, 2016 Aroma of roasted malts, dark chocolate and lots of coffee. Flavour is roasty, dark chocolate, more and more black coffee. Surprised at how well-masked the alcohol is, you can sense this is a strong brew but theres not a lot of alcohol in the flavour. Being a coffee drinker I enjoyed the hell out of this stout. Greatness in beer.

On tap at BtlRev (Raleigh). Pours a very dark brown with a suitably brown head. Coffee and malt dominate the aroma. The coffee this has been conditioned with blasts through the taste - this is a coffee stout, not a "regular" stout...and that's not a bad thing. ---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

This was a very surprising beer in my opinion. The aroma is very strong but the body and mouth is almost too smooth. With stouts I expected more of a kick, not so much with this one. Regardless it was a thick beer and there was bitterness throughout. Im interested in buying another one just to age it and see how much more flavor shows up.
On tap at Ruckus Morrisville. To heck with my usual morning g Starbucks. Ill be tempted to enjoy one of these.

UPDATED: JAN 13, 2017 How does $11 for a 750ml sound (pretty good for an Australian!). Justifiably one of the worlds great beers. Massive layers of chocolate, roast, sweet aniseed, choc orange. Never gets loose. Just plain freakin awesome.
UPDATED: MAY 12, 2014 Deep dark body. Poured with a one inch head. Very sweet cocoa smell. Very sweet chocolate coffee taste. Very good. Would love to try the ba version.

Pours oil black with a dark reddish tan head. Aroma is chocolate, bready and roast coffee. Taste is big. Very sweet up front highlighted by chocolate and cocoa. Alcohol warmth followed by a roasted bitter finish that dries out the sweetness. Mouthfeel is thick and creamy. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Big bottle. Nice presentation. Having while at Evol Grill. Poured a huge frothy head. Lacing on glass. Nice aroma of chocolate and coffee, vanilla. Wow, texture is amazing. Just melts in your mouth yummy. Nice warming alcohol. Dry finish. Taste same as aroma. Bitter finish. Super smooth roasted malt milkshake. Well done. Yum yum yum. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Bottled 3/12/13. Wonderful aroma- anise, roasted coffee, and chocolate. A little bitterness on the finish. Good beer.

UPDATED: APR 14, 2017 Rerate: Coffee  taste is stronger.  Can feel the alcohol 4.0. @zebf 2014 - Aroma is dry and slightly woody. Smooth, oily texture. Lots of dry, roasted malts and booze with some coffee notes trying to get through too 3.7.

What can be said that hasnt been said already? Its a complex and strong drink. Very strong. I found the coffee notes to be struggling for prominence against the alcohol, with the alcohol clearly winning in the finish. I understand that this is considered a very well made brew, and that it is very much respected. But I no longer enjoy these kinds of beers. If I want to drink something this strong in the future, I would rather have a nice red wine.

750ml bottled January 14 pours dark rich black-brown witb big 3 finger moch head. Nose is boozy dark fruits, plum, fig, licorice, damp earthy coffee bean. Taste is silky smooth earthy roast coffee, dark fruits, dry chocolate bar, licorice, malty, touch of smokiness. Finish is smooth milky coffee, ashy cocoa, roast coffee beans, fruity. Great!

UPDATED: SEP 28, 2015 Sampled @ Zeebra 2014. Drank this beer next to the barrel aged version so that might have negatively influenced my rating of this beer. It was mainly less sweet and bourbon-like, generally less rich, than the barrel aged version.

Edit: rated higher after drinking at with Thijs at Malous goodbye party 27-9-2015.

DWF; Pour almost black with a great, lasting, lacing tan head. Aroma is roasted malt, caramel, coffee, really dark fruity and dark chocolate. Taste is loads if sweet, still fruity balancing. Warming and lasting. Body is full, texture is silk, carbonation is flat to soft. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
0.75 flaske på Cardinal. Mørkt skum som varer. Syrlig lukt. Smak av malt kaffe sjokolade karamell. Bitter søt ettersmak
DWF black colour. Aroma of liquorice, coffee and dried fruits. Taste is sweet. Chocolate, caramell. Nice mouthfeel, creamy oily.. Very good :)
Sampled at Boises Imperial Stout get together, over 120 bottles to choose from. Going with the flow on this rating.

Aroma: very roasted, chokolate
Flavor: roasted coffee and chokolate with good bitterness with a creamy mouthfeel.
Color: almost black with a light brown head.

Pour from bottle is black with very thin tan head. 
Aroma - brown bread, caramel, coffee, figs, plums toffee, dark chocolate. Very well balanced. 
Taste - my god this is great. A perfect balance of booze, bitter, and sweet. The coffee is present, but doesnt over power the sweetness of the caramel and fruit or vice versa. Everything is just so harmonious. 
Palate - nice medium-full body with a little fizz and a creamy, velvety texture. The finish is a roasted bitter sweetness that lingers with a pleasant coffee aftertaste. 

I really wanted to wait til I developed my palate before trying this and Im glad I did. So many delicious elements to this beer that are so incredibly balanced. It is definitely deserving of the high ranking it has on this site.

Almost completely black, big beige foam. Big roasted aroma, higher alcohols and smooth chocolate. Heavy roasted bitter-chocolate taste. Big mouthfeel, low carbonation. To my syprise (or not) this is a very, very, very nice beer.
Dark brown color with head, great lace. Dark chocolate and coffee smells. And dar chocolate and coffee tasted.

This pours a very dark oily black. A foamy thick chocolate head that leaves a film layer once it settles. A big chocolate and coffee aroma. The chocolate comes out even more as it warms. The taste is a big chocolate and coffee mix. Really good stuff.

Almost black body, with ruby reflections. Brown, medium foam. Wonderfull, complex and lovely aroma. Roasted dark malts, dark chocolate, coffee, cherries in liqueur, grain coffee, dried fruits, dark fruits, roasted fruits, caramel, liqueur, alcohol. Just perfect! Taste is similar to aroma. Complex, multidimensional. Flavors of dark chocolate, coffee, liqueur, cocoa, alkohol, plums and cherries in liqueur, coffee liqueur. Long, warming finish. Full body with low carbonation. Oily, thick texture. Very very good Imperial Stout, perfect for aging.

750 ml bottle shared with guest and friend @ "Bru Bar Vulkan", Oslo.
April 18, 2014
Beer enjoyed from a tulip glass
Thick and a bit oily black beer with a thin brown head and almost free from carbonation.
Aroma is sweetness in my nose,coffee,soy sauce,dark chocolate,alcohol,malt and dark sugar.
Tastes a bit sweet with roasted coffee and sweet soy sauce feeling.
Tiny touch of the high ABV.
A good Imperial Stout, but i prefer stouts from Hoppin Frog,Lervig Konrad and Nøgne Ø.

Shared by a fellow beer geek in the office. Very, very dark brown color with a small beige head. Aroma is dark chocolate, booze and coffee and is quite intense. The taste is even more complex than the aroma - a bit of a sour note from the booze, dark chocolate, dark roasted coffee, malty caramel and sugar. Very yummy, and the high ABV isnt obvious. Its got a medium body with light-ish carbonation and has a pleasantly sticky, oily mouthfeel. A world class stout, without question.

Bottle, thnx to bytemesis. Pours a very dark, almost black beer with a regular sized, beige head on top. Aroma has massive coffee, big roast and loads of sugary notes. Really big and heavy aroma. Flavor is bittersweet, with touches of both coffee and sugar. Alcohol is detected but not disturbing. Mouthfeel is pleasant and soft, low carbonation going on and a long, sweet aftertaste. Nice complexity hidden inside this beer. Very nice example of the style and this beer is great for all the different treatments it has gotten over time. Cant wait to try them all!

Considered saving this for #500, but it doesnt need any more hype than it already has.  Pours a dark brown, dense and opaque, with a nice tan head that is healthy and audible, fading quickly to a cola-like fizzy ring. Aroma is chocolate, leather, coffee, sweet, vinous dark fruits. Taste is chocolate and coffee up front, into a drier, bitter, cocoa middle, then into salty soy which fades in the finish into a superb roasted caramel malt and chocolaty red wine aftertaste. Palate is velvety smooth, creamy, and chewy in the end. Where is the 12%?! This goes down very easy.  Strange nutmeg quality that keeps it earthy and grounded.  Well done.

Reviewed from notes.
The appearance had a one finger tan foamy head that dies within thirty seconds maintains a slightly thick lacing.
The smell had roasted coffee up front, raisin tries to come in fairly strong along with the coffee, but mainly stays just a tad behind, black licorice also tries to power its way through, but is just a tad more subdued then the other two aromas, for the most part Im impressed how all three are coming through as powerful as they are.
The taste was a dry roasty coffee, slightly sweet through the raisins and leaves a dry roasty yet also kinda toasty sort of coffee aftertaste, dry bitter coffee finish.
On the palate, it sat at/about a medium to heavy, actually probably closer to heavy, sessionable - not really but makes a good sipper. Carbonation seems to be good for the style and for me - dry and slightly smooth, coffee-like coating the tongue and mouth.
Overall, wow, this is a pretty good American Double / Imperial Stout, for as fresh as Im having this and not really detecting much booze and then looking at the ABV level, Im actually fairly interested in trying this one aged if I ever see it again.
Bottle. One of the best! Pours pitch black with a brown head. The nose is lots of coffee. You pick up some of the 12% in the flavor but overall it is great.

Aroma: chocolate covered cherries, coffee, cigar
Appearance: black, one inch frothy tan foam head
Taste: medium sweetness up front, and a very bitter, lightly sour aftertaste
Palate: medium body, thin oily slick feel, lively carbonation, beautifully bitter finish
Overall: Brilliant stout. Very, very good.

Pitch black with a mocha head with good retention. Fruity aromas, with some chocolate milk and lots of berrie, cigar and some tar. Full body, silky smooth dark cocoa. Long chocolate finish with some booze.Excellent stuff.

Bottle @brew night with jeevan & allmyvinyl. Pours black with a tan head. Oh wow, not going to bother distinguishing between nose and taste as they both work off of each other so well but it sure does have a wonderful smell about it. Nutty, chocolate, nutty smooth peanut butter, fruity and nutty, licorice complex nutty wonderfulness. Wowzer, this is some beer.
Bottle. Damn. Poured black with a thick brown head. Bitter dark coffee aroma. Thick, lightly sweet coffee flavor with a bitter sweet chocolate finish. Damn.

2013 bottle. Pours pitch black with a tiny brown head, aroma of dark chocolate, sweet licorice, some notes of fudge and chocolate. Mouthfeel is normal and nothing special. Tastes of dark chocolate, burned oak and roasted coffee. Unfortunately somewhat too boozy and needs to be cellared for some time.
Aroma of fresh roasted coffee. The taste is similar with hints of chocolate. Quite balanced finish with some warming alcohol. Well hidden abv

Pours a jet black motor oil color with a thick dark brown creamy head. The aroma is of coffee with notes of chocolate and vanilla. The flavor is of coffee, chocolate, and vanilla. The body is full with a nice bitter aftertaste. Overall a great beer from Alesmith.

750ml bottle at home, bought ages ago, cant remember. Pours jet black, thick, long-lasting beige head. Aromas of coffee and vanilla. Taste is coffee, but not too much, bitter, but not too much, light caramel chocolate sweetness. This beer is balance captured in a glass. Smoother than smooth. Easy, but not slutty. Lovely.

Excellent stout. Strong coffee aroma and flavor. Incredibly smooth. Really can't find any faults with this beer

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bottled 3/12/13. Pours black. Two finger mocha head, leaves nice lacing. Aromas of coffee, chocolate, some roasted malt sweetness and some hints of alcohol. Taste is big coffee upfront, just as advertised. I get some bitter chocolates, anise and then some dark fruits. I fear this may have suffered some oxidizing. Some sherry and honey flavors come through across the middle. I dont remember these flavors being so pronounced when I had this fresh. The finish carries a good amount of weight. Some alcohol is noticeable but decently hidden by more coffee/chocolate/hop bitterness. Relatively dry, yet still feeling creamy/silky across the palate. Really enjoy this beer and I will certainly re-visit in the near future.
Bottle - Dark chocolate and coffee with a touch of booze. Jet brown and a creamy brown head. Coffee and dark chocolate, very rich on the palate. Big and rich. Well deserved score.

Bottle from my dad in Ohio. 750ml. Shared with my co-workers. Small snifters. Pours a jet black oil with a solid one finger mocha head that lasted. Some lacing. The aroma is off the hook with coffee, dark chocolate, nibs, vanilla, and caramel. The taste lives up to the aroma with heavy coffee, dark chocolate, sweet milk, vanilla, and roasted malts. The mouth is creamy and slightly oily with coffee. Full body. Moderate carbonation. Finish is not too boozy, not sweet, and slightly dry. This is hands down about the best stout Ive ever had.

UPDATED: OCT 6, 2015 Draft pour. Very dark with a cream tan head. A lot of espresso in the nose. Heavy body full of coffee and chocolate. Does not have the boozy taste that you find in a lot of 12% beers. Keeps getting better.  Update: after trying a few of the variations, I thought I would give this another go.  I spend about 99% of my time at beer places ordering beers Ive never had before,  but certain beers deserve a rerate.  Actually, I think they all deserve that, but for many Ill save that for after I try all the beers.  Draft 7 oz pour at the Collective. Pours black with a fading tan head and no shortage of lacing.   A lot more vanilla character than I remember.  Rich malt, huge chocolate.   Im starting to get this beer after a few tries.  Solid stuff.

750ml bottle. Nearly black, foamy milk chocolate head. Aroma is roasted coffee and booze, milk chocolate sweetness. Huge espresso in the back of my mouth, alcohol taste without the burn, lactic sweetness, slight tang. Full body. Overall, this one was a beast, the mix of strong coffee and strong alcohol kicked my butt.

Flaska från SB drygt två år gammal drucken med ölföreningen. Kolsvart, tjock och oljig. Stor doft av rostad malt och kaffe, lätt syrlig, lite brända toner, karamell och kokos. Rund och stor smak av främst kaffe, ganska syrlig och på något sätt inte tillräcklig stor kropp och sötma för alla stora smaker, kaffekärvheten och och kaffesyrligheten. Visst spelar förväntningar roll och här blev jag trots allt lite besviken fast det är ett riktigt bra öl.
On tap at Alesmith. Pours black. A delicious coffee chocolate complex warming stout. Impressive.
Med ölföreningen 2014. Smak och doft av choklad, kaffe, vanilj. Jämn och fin, bra balans, stor syrlighet.

Trade with BOLTZ7555. Fantastic brew smell is of coffee, and the taste is more coffee but layered with chocolate and black licorice taste. has a nice bitterness to complement the beer and for how big of a beer it is sill inviting to just keep drinking
From bottle, pours pitch black with a tan head. The aroma is all coffee, with flavor of coffee and chocolate. Really smooth with a creamy texture. Great, great stout.

75cl bottle @ home shared with Balazs and Sanyi. Dark brown color, average beige head. Aroma coffee, brownie, rum, licorice, gum. Taste medium sweetness, heavy bitterness, alcohol is present. Full body, creamy texture, soft carbonation, coffeeish bitter finish. Massive dessert beer, takes time to drink but very delicious.

Really nice tasting stout. Chocolate notes really come forward in front of the more roasted flavors. Nice mouthful just slightly more full than traditional breakfast or oatmeal stouts. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Poured from a Champagne Bottle Bomber. I held this beer up to the SUN and could barely see light through it--that's how dark it was. Black, black color. Medium tan head and it laces all the way down. Smells of espresso beans and tastes like big coffee. Hints of cocoa and caramel. Very, very balanced. Not bitter like you would think. This is my new favorite of the coffee stouts. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Black as coffee, aroma and taste also filled with coffee and hints of cocoa beans. Very smooth and a low bitterness. A very nice imperial stout.

Finally rating this bottle. Vintage unknown but one of several collected over the past few years. Whats left to say about this classic impy stout? Great from start to finish. Coffee but also some smoke to me. Yummy.
Pours a coffee brown. Minimal tan head taste is coffee roasted malts and chocolate. Very smooth great beer

This is a great beer. Poured from bottle. Dark, black color with a tan head. Aroma is that of coffee and semi alcohol-y. Taste is powerful, first you get the coffee than the hints of dark chocolate begin to settle in. If youre on the fence about trying this beer...TRY IT

Bottle. Creamy lightbrown good mostly lasting head. Heavy malty and moderate hoppy powerfull aroma. Powerfull moderate bittter light sweet flavor. Long complex moderate bitter finish. Creamy palate. Very nice

75cl bottle from cervezalandia. Very very dark beautiful color. Head is thin to medium and beige. Bitterness is high and theres some sweetness also. Aroma is coffee coffee coffee, roasted, chocolate.

This stout is so delicious! Others have indicated it is heavy on coffee taste and aroma. I dont disagree, but I dont find it so in your face as that. There is also a nice, natural chocolate flavor. This is one of the few beers that I think out of the bottle is just as good as on tap. One of my go to Imperial Stouts. So good!
Pour is black like coffee with a tan head. Aroma is roasted coffee with hints of coco. Taste smooth with hints of chocolate and coffee. Has a clean finish with a little bitterness

Pours pitch black, with a brown head beautiful!
The aroma is roasted with lots of coffee.
Great mouthfeel, and surprisingly easy to drink for a 12% imp stout!

Pours black with a tan head and a wonderful aroma of coffee. Body is a perfect balance of coffee, sweetness, roast and tart. Goes down smoother than any 12% stout. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Perfect body. Medium roast coffee beans. Bitter cocoa, white chocolate, some mint, marshmallow. Some creamy lactose. Perfect balance with a hint of earthy hops. Great, great stout !! Alcohol well hidden.

Has a nice smell of coffee, dark chocolate, caramel, burnt sugar, roasted malts and a little smoky. Pours black with a thick brown head. The taste is strong of coffee, dark chocolate, cocoa beans and burnt sugar. The mouthfeel is awesome. Very thick and creamy.

One of my top 3 non bourbon stouts. Huge roasted coffe nose and dark roast coffee dominates the flavor. I pretty much know I will like an imp stout when I pour it and it is pitch black and has a creamy looking toasted brown/mocha color head. If you like coffee imp stouts this is a must try!

Black With a dark Brown head - Good roasted malt aroma, but there is olso good coffee and hint of caramel - Good malt body With a lot of malt and coffee With some caramel and a good bitterness in the end - The coffee and bitterness goes into the finish - This was real good

Le nez est plus sucré, caramel que café. Je dénote une légère odeur de jus de pomme brute. Le goût est est sucré, acidulé et enveloppant. La finale est douce, sucrée et assez persistante. A essayer, mais je suis un peu déçu...

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Smooth mouthfeel. Taste of dark roasted coffee, burnt sugar, toffee. Light tan head of foam

Loads of coffee flavor, a little licorice,a slight hint of chocolate. The high alcohol content isnt hidden at all, this is a boozy beer. Surprisingly not bitter for all the coffee flavor. Not overly sweet either. Very good.
A bottle a little over a year old. Immense flavour richness, loads of dried fruits and dark chocolate, a hint of sweetness and a good long note of coffee at the backend.

Bottle poured into sniffer. Motor oil black with a big fluffy light cocoa head. Aroma of sweet roast coffee. Sublime roast coffee flavor. Zero coffee bitterness. Incredibly light mouthfeel. This stouts reputation is quite deserved.

This is a really strong imperial stout. Wonderful mix of black coffee and chocolate. Had a strange finish that I am not fully loving. Pours almost black. Had in steamboat. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

A+ for Jasmine who brought this!!!!! What can I say a chicks dream cocoa, roast, fennel, slight sage, and a bunch of other flavors to finish off night...not i am not doing a chilada tomorrow...I am cracking another one of these to nurse hange over...nothing lie anlittlencoffe the next day....keep posted...you male drinkers have no idea what you have unleashed with these wonderful brews!!!!!

Words do not capture the essence of this sweet and complex coffee stout. The way it greets, lulls, and comforts you, then head butts you with its boozy coffee goodness is the stuff of legend. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bottle. Aroma is toffee, caramel, burnt toast, definite coffee notes, a lot of heat (needs some time in bottle), surprisingly well balanced, medium body, long finish. Oh, and did I mention, fucking delicious.

Huikean värinen, tuoksuu jopa tuoreelle espresso pavulle.erittäin täyteläinen maku jossa rekkalastillinen kahvia mutta kuitenkin tasapainossa humalan kanssa..jälkimaku viipyy niinkuin kunnon espressossakin melkein grappaa huutaisi huuhtelemaan.

Bottle from Voldby. Pitch black color with a dark brown head. Aroma is roasted malts, lots of coffee, dark chocolate. Taste of roasted malts, coffee, dark chocolate, some dark fruits. Low carbonation, Very oily texture. Very smooth palate. Nice warming alcohol in the finish. Excellent beer.
Bottle. Dark black with tan head. Aroma of chocolate. Taste of chocolate and slightly hoppy. Aftertaste of hops of chocolate and coffee.

On tap poured into a 4oz shaker sample glass. Sampled both on nitro, and CO2 taps. Coffee, chocolate and caramel comes through the on the aroma, although, on nitro, the aroma in general is more subdued - although some berry and woody notes come through. It poured an opaque black with a tan head. The tan head retains as a wispy layer for the CO2 pour, and, of course, much thicker on nitro. Both lace well, although the nitro pour leaves a sheet of lace on the glass. Its a very balanced, medium-high sweet and medium bitter taste. More of the sweetness comes out on the nitro pour. Its a full bodied beer with soft carbonation. The nitro pour is much creamier and milky. Its slick and the CO2 pour has a bit more alcohol warmth to the finish whereas the nitro pour hides it better. Both leave a coffee bitter finish, although the nitro is a bit more clean. Theres a slight wood note that comes through on the nitro pour.

Id been saving this bottle for awhile waiting for the right time to open it. Jet black pour with a small tan head. Aromas of coffee, chocolate, toffee, and brown sugar. Flavor is coffee and cocoa upfront with some nice molasses notes coming through in the finish. Crazy smooth and easy to drink. No trace of the abv whatsoever on the palate. This was delicious and it certainly deserves the reputation it has acquired!
If I could count my homebrews, this would be number 1000. Strong chocolate aroma. Roasted coffee flavor, but that is secondary to the chocolate. Full bodied and full flavored.

Shared at a bomber tasting. Appearance: deep reddish brown color, slight brown head. Aroma: raisins, chocolate, coffee. Palate: full body, oily/alcohol texture, soft carbonation. Taste: malty and fruity sweetness. Overall, I think this was my favorite beer of the night at our imperial stout blind taster. Super smooth, complex, and just a joy to drink.

Smooth for all of the alcohol content - hits you hard, then malt after malt after malt. A great beer to kick off dinner

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bottle from Great Grog, Edinburgh purchased Jul-Aug 2012 [150214]
Pitch black, dark tan head that dissipates to a lasting rim.
Aroma of deep dark roast malts, some mellow coffee roast (much less than expected), some savoury notes, dab of soy, little chocolate, complex, not much alc on the nose
Taste as aroma, rich dark malts, coffee roast is mellow and very well integrated, deep sweet dark malts, soft chocolate, very smooth, fairly complex, alcohol well hidden, rather easy to drink for the 12%
Palate - soft carb, full body, very smooth texture, soft alcohol, sweet malts with fairly bitter roast and coffee roast, some bitter dark chocolate in there. Finish as main flavour, soft warming alcohol, soft bitter roast
Overall - Less huge and complex than expected, alcohol surprisingly mellow, perhaps benefitted for ageing 1.5 - 2 years. Very good impy but not absolutely stunning - Ive had better UK impys

UPDATED: MAR 4, 2017 Bottle nose of rich smooth chocolate & coffee. Some liquorice. Thin silky rich glossy dark tan head. Flat black. Full finesse dark rich silky body which has a delicious mealy quality to it. Slight alcohol glow. Complex. Full but in no way hugely extreme.

Pours black with a dark dark brown huge thick long lasting foam.slightly sweet coffee chocolate that bursts on the roof of your mouth at swallowing. Lingering coffee on the lips . 

---Rated via Beer Buddy

Bottle.
At a beer tasting. Dark pour, light Brown head. 
Sweet Nose, very round taste.

A very great beer with a very smooth taste compared to the alcohol volume. I like it a lot!

Smagt på beer shop i Kolding....... Smooth .... Stærk.....  Wauv ........

Volat Percutit Revertitur!

Bottle arrived thanks to my friend Federico Corbelli Portal Beer. The aroma and appearance are very inviting, with two fingers of foam and persistent perlage average, the aroma of cocoa and coffee predominate, the taste is amazing this beer is a real cappuccino alcoholic who loved it even guests are not connoisseurs craft beer, also liked the mother-in-law. Definitely one of the best beers in the world. So much of the hair. Congratulations Alesmith brewery company.
750ml bottle pours a dark black with a tan kahki head. Roasted malt and coffee taste.

Black pour light brown head, low retention. 
Bitter chocolate, coffee and vanilla aroma, hoppy. Much the same for taste, semi-sweet chocolate and coffee but also salted caramel, nice touch of sourness. Creamy, rich and med-full body. Dry, longish bitter finish.
From bottle, pours black with a tan head. Aroma of coffee and dark chocolate. Taste is dark chocolate and caramel, with a nice bitterness. Sweet, but not too much. Wonderful.

750 ml bottle purchased at the City Market Onion River Co-Op in Burlington (VT) on June 22, 2013. Black, thin head. Spicy aroma of coffee and licorice, pretty malty. Taste of caramelized fruit, toast and spice aftertaste of bitter alcohol. I dont know why they call it speedway, because you just want to take your time with it!

Pours black with tan head that dissipates fairly quickly. Rich, dark, sweet, coffee and roasty goodness. This is a great stout.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Big malty nose very little coffee booze aroma. Soft mouthfeel with a dark chocolate taste I don't get a lot of coffee which I was expecting seeing as how much coffee they use during the process. Overall ok not worth the 15.99 I spent on the bottle.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bottle to glass. Pours a dark black with a medium creamy light brown head. Aroma is dark, burnt malts, coffee, cacao. Flavor is a burnt malt / coffee bitterness. Medium body with a lingering coffee bitterness long into the finish. Excellent beer.

Bottle from Mane Liquor. Pours pitch black with dark khaki head and lacing. Upfront aroma of espresso, soy, dark chocolate and cocoa. Maybe a little woody too. Flavours are pretty standard - chocolate, coffee beans, soy, maybe a slight plum-esque sweetness. Bitterness. Mega overhyped, plenty of better stouts for half the price.

Kaffe , chokolade , riste malt, vinøs, let lakrids , træ, tøv, sort, brunt skum, cremet, blød.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Pours dark black with little or no head. No carbonation. Some chocolate and coffee and very oily. Not bad but this may of been an infected bottle.

Boozy... Smooth n velvety...I get little coffee and would approximate more... Lots of fruits like dark plums or something some through ... I like... It's a nice beer to watch a movie with the wifee with... I like alesmith ...I get little roasted character too... I still like it... Brooklyn chocolate stout and north coast Rasputin are worth a try...

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Aroma - full of roast, espresso like notes, alcohol, chocolate
Apperance - the appearance is jet black and the head a tannish brown. The hangs out for a while, then it crashes down some.
Taste - the taste is how I describe other incredible good stouts. Its sort of like what I imagine the following would taste like - Picture your sitting outside in the cold autumn with a toasty fire that had the greatest stock of wood in it. Then you take a bucket of espresso and chocolate and pour it over said fire. Then you take that whole thing and strain it. Voila! Thats this beer.
Feel - its warming, its rich, nice bitters in the finish. it holds all of those aspects for a really long time.

Quite a mega brew! Tried as Beer #3 -of the Craft Beer Social Club Chap #1 (LOuverture Sociale de la Bière)

I have to admit that I was not impressed after all the hype that has followed this brew! Glad I traded for three of these!! It pours a nice dark chocolate with a tiny roasted marshmallow brown head!
