A bit of a let down bij the smell...also with the first sip but then layer after layer after layer...really nice and complex palate...fantastic. Pithblack pour. Taste is lots of roasted malts, chocolate, liquorice, coffee(not as much as i expected) and somewhere in the back a bit of dark fruit.
Gift from my brother Eric Teusink for my engagement. Pours black velvet with a tan head. Boozey aroma slight mocha raisin. Tastes of coffee with a hint of dark chocolate. top fucking notch

UPDATED: JUL 3, 2013 Wow not what I expected. Very strong dark fruit. Sweet very sweet. Light bitterness this just is not enjoyable but strong in alchol. Id say say dont save up for this. But thanks to my brother in law for importing. Thin head. ---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
UPDATED: AUG 22, 2013 Bottle. Aroma is alcohol, vanilla, chocolate, raisin, coffee and nuts. Very warming feeling. Smooth but a lot of alcohol. Heavy body with little carbonation. Very good.
UPDATED: JUN 29, 2014 Pours nice and thick. Is a dark black with a tan head. Aroma is full of roasted coffee and chocolate. Tastes of coffee and dark chocolates. This is a very good beer.
Bottle - Pours thick, dark black with a tan head. Nose is filled with roasted coffee notes. Tastes of coffee, dark chocolates, and nuts. Very smooth from start to finish.

Bought a bottle of this at beverage warehouse in LA due to the rate beer hype around it.  Was impressive in texture, color and had a wonderful dark coffee aroma.  Tasted great but the lingering aftertaste gave me that feeling of anticipatory indigestion.

Thanks jbruner! Inky black pour with a fluffy tan head. Rich roasted maltiness, bitter coffee, dry coffee with noticeable hoppy backing. Velvety, Hersey milk chocolate, earthiness, roasted malts and coffee in the flavor. Thick bodied with a hoppy bitter end. Damn nice beer.

UPDATED: OCT 7, 2013 On the nose is molasses, vanilla and vodka.  The look is like I would expect...dark with a head that melts into the glass within a few minutes leaving plenty of lacing after each sip.  Taste is a lot of booze that is in your face and the 12% ABV is prevalent enough to warm up the tongue.  On the palate the carbonation assaults the tongue on contact.  Its good but now that Ive had it once was enough.  A 12 oz pour of this one was too much for a beer that doesnt hide the ABVs.

Saved this brew for DeadCatAtlantas engagement party to share with my brothers.  Poured a beautiful black with a tan head.  Ideal mix of alcohol, coffee, and chocolate on the nose.  Fantastic sweet front end to bitter back end transition.  Palate so full it feels like a meal.  Great damn beer.  Bottle - Whole Foods Market Bowery - New York, NY

UPDATED: JUN 20, 2013 deep, black colour, moderate foamy brown head; brilliant aroma of chocolate, green apple, roasted malt, alcohol and maybe some vanilla; taste of heavy roasted coffee and malt, with some dried fruits and intensive alcoholic spiciness; really great stout...a bit too stouty for me, but anyway, its a great beer...and who am I to question the greatness of it? :)

Bottle in Vail with my dad. Pour is viscous, car-oil black with a pillowy brown head and great lacing. Big coffee, leathery, dark chocolate, graham crackers, deep roasty, sweet vanilla, brown sugar, and earthy aroma - so rich. Taste is deep dark cocoa, espresso beans, toffee, roasted caramel, toasted bread, tobacco, molasses, somewhat leathery, earthy, and sweet vanilla on the backend. Super-thick, mouth-coating body with soft carbonation. Rich, decadent, oily, sweet, yet balanced beautifully with roasted malt. Truly a classic.

Little creamy brown head. Sweet aroma of intense dark chocolate, coffee, malts. Taste of chocolate, coffee. Very balanced and straight forward stout, but the over all quality is fantastic. Mouthfeel is just perfect. Overrated? No way!

On tap. Pours almost black. Thick tan head with high retention and lacing. Smells of coffee, malt, chocolate. Tastes similar to smell, coffee, dark chocolate, slight vanilla and toffee. Mouthfeel is perfectly velvet, low carbonation. Incredible brew.
Bottle from systembolaget. Very malty smell with chocolate, coffee and dark bread. Similar taste, very complex and nice to drink. Great beer!

1 year old bottle. Really dark brown liquid, almost jet black. Small light brown head.  Big dark chocolate aroma. Also some coffee, caramel, dark fruits. Taste starts with some sweetness, milk chocolate, bitter coffee, caramel, sweet toffee, ends a little bit dry with bitter coffee again. So smooth. Medium carbination, full body. 
Too easy to drink!

Wow!!!  Great opaque pour w/ a nice mocha head that leaves lacing. Aroma is chocolate, roasted coffee, & booze. Incredibly smooth & creamy mouthfeel. This is an imperial stout to a tee!  A tremendously balanced beer that has both vanilla & chocolate flavor that stand out. Amazing beer!

big coffee vanilla aroma, very strong.  flavor is similar, lots of raisin in the flavor, i liked that a lot.  coffee very prominent, but tasty and not rough.  flavor has alc warmth in background, this is a hot one.  definitely a sipper, one of the biggest impy stouts around really.  sweetish lactose flavor in finish too, some vanilla.  maybe just a tad too sweet for me to really fall in love with it, but its very big and bold and complex.  smoothish mouthfeel.  the booziness might turn some people off, might turn some on!  very nice, but too big for its own good? its up to you
Bottle from HOTB. Poured black with light brown wispy head. Strong pleasant coffee sweet roasted aroma. Very smooth dark choc bitter. Nice

Appearance: Jet black body with a beige head. Aroma: Very boozy nose and lots and lots of coffee. Taste: strong coffee and with nuts and soy. Bitterness of the coffee balances well with the strong alcohol taste. Palette: thick and strong, harder to drink than most stouts. High carbonation as well. Very thick body and strong finish. Overall great beer. Would definitely buy again.

UPDATED: JUN 28, 2015 Old rating rerated 02.06.2013, 0,75l bottle @ home:
Big brown creamy head. Aroma is unripe banana, grass, chocolate, caramel, a hint of coffee. Taste is slightly rich and balanced, still very boring;.dark malts, licorice, unripe banana, dark sugar, grass, chocolate, caramel, wood, maybe a hint of coffee (even thoug I think its rather because of knowing there is coffee in it). This bottle is just a few months old, and thats not usually a good thing for this kind of beers. But just a little aging doesnt really change the beer at all either (previous tastings). It needs at least several years. One of the best imperial stouts there is? NO freakin way!! Wheres the masses of coffee? Not in my bottle(s) at least....
UPDATED: FEB 24, 2014 wow....this sure is something!. black as hell, and a very creamy coffee smell and some caramel hints.. taste is so smooth. cant wait to get my hands on the BA version.

Cerveza opaca con espuma beige oscura persistente y densa. Aromas a chocolate ligeramente dulce y café. Sabor complejo: inicio dulce con final amargo acafetado apuntillado con un ligero sabor a licor. Muy buena.
Bottle from Some Where in Ohio... Probably -  bottle aged at least 2 years - aroma is coffee and malt. Its good, but maybe aged too long? Its good, but I think its lost some of its vibrancy.

Bottle from the Andersons Columbus. Pours black with a thin khaki head. Lots of lacing in the glass. Slight coffee notes on the nose. Nice roasted notes on the tongue. Hides its alcohol well. Solid but not spectacular.

Pours totally black with a brown head. Aroma is roasted malt, coffee, caramel, chocolate, vanilla, licorice and some alcohol. Taste is medium sweet and roasty leading to a dry roasty and bitter finish. Beautifully smooth in the mouth. Yeah, its pretty much one of the best beers Ive ever had!

bottle.  black with quick brown head.  alcohol brings a sweet fruity note to the aroma.  also notes of dark chocolate.  the coffee comes in big time in the flavor with notes of dark chocolate and red grapes.  medium full.  not overly hopped...it lets the malts and the coffee up front.  moderate carbonatio and a light hop addition are key to a great imp stout!

Good god. How the hell is this a shelf beer? Viscous black pour, beige head that fades away. Nose is rich coffee, dark chocolate, sweet malts. Taste is huge dark chocolate, espresso, rich malts. Initially sweet finish with rich dark chocolate covered fruits followed by a rich black coffee bitterness. Sticky, nearly full mouthfeel. Enjoyed this much more than the BA version.

So very very excited for this beer! Pour: Jet black, Big creamy tanned head. Lots of coffee on the nose, with some vanilla. The more I drink this beer the better it gets, at first mostly coffee was tasted but vanilla starts coming in more and more with some dark chocolate. Hides the alcohol incredibly well. Top class stout and must let this beer warm up before you drink.
This is by far one of my favorites. I wish I could get AleSmith in Virginia!  very smooth but large mouthful. Bold flavor with no bitterness.
This is a great beer.  Amazing you can find it pretty much year round in Arizona.  About perfect levels of carbination and viscosity.  Love the barrel aged and Kopi Luwak versions too.

Almost black, frothy tan head. Sweet aroma of chocolate, black coffee, roasted malt, caramel, and hints of dark fruits. Smooth, moderately boozy, full-bodied, and much more bitter in taste. A little too much carbonation. Finish is long and bitter.

Underbar stout med smak av kaffe o choklad.....12 procent men man känner inte av det, perfekt........

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

My hopes were probably unrealistic after finally finding this top rated brew. I did enjoy it quite a bit but it wasnt quite the transcendent experience Id expected. There were some metallic elements I didnt like and the mouth feel was a little weaker than I expected. That being said, it is a very good beer.

2013 bottle. Huge thick black pour with plenty of thick tanned head. The smell is exactly what you would expect, thick black coffee, roasted malts, chocolate and so on, for sure smells BIG!. Up front there is big hit of roasted malts, aftertaste is coffee and black licorce, one mean stout...AWESOME
Opaque pitch black with a espresso like small head. Nice chocolate, liquorice, mocha aroma. Flavor is strong chocolate, port, some woodyness and slight smoke. Full palate, warming and flavorful.

Bottle 75 cl. Pours black in color with a thick and creamy beige head, which looks great and stays on as a cap for the whole time. Cacao powder, roasted notes, coffee liqour leading to a bit of vinous notes and even a bit of some marzipan sweetness in aroma. Dark and powerful. Later on there appears some notes of salty licorice as well. Oily texture and leaving a nice layer of it on the glass. Mouthfeel is incredibly smooth and creamy. Bitter cacao with notes of cherryliqour in taste. Has a gentle warming effect. A bit of coffee beans too with light notes of salty licorice in flavor. Rich and strong. Feels quite sweet at first, but turns into combination of bitter and dark chocolate and freshly roasted coffee beans in finish. This is still one of my favorite imperial stouts, as it seems to be very well balanced and great tasting from time to time with those roasted notes, bitter chocolate, slightly sweet and slightly vinous 
notes working well together.

Bottle @ S&B#2. Pours black with a fully lasting and good lacing creamy light brown huge head. Aroma is chocolate, coffee, caramel, hops, roasted malt, dark fruit and a little burnt malt. Taste is medium+ sweet and bitter. Body is full, texture is creamy, carbonation is soft+. Finish is bitter, malty with lingering coffee. Most excellent black stuff.

Source : From Pearl Street in Vermont, 750ml bottle.
Appearance : Opaque black with tick tan head.
Aroma : Rich quality coffee.
Taste : Dark chocolate with rich coffee.
Palate : Creamy with a dry finish.
Overall : Another great product from AleSmith.
UPDATED: JUL 6, 2013 Pours a near black color. Taste is quite roast and very smooth. Super tasty. Thanks GT2.

Thick black body, small tan head. Rich coffee and chocolate aroma, fine wood hoppy undertone. Starts full, malty and thick, hop bitterness to balance. Big complexity. Sharper, warming ending. Huge flavour. Light fizz. Fantastic. (ZeeBra)

UPDATED: SEP 15, 2014 Appearance perfect. Aroma is rich subtle dark malt and chocolate. Taste is the same with a smooth richness, and finish which is slightly bitter, sweet and with a vague vanilla finish. Overall a great impy stout, but would love to try a bottle that still has the fresh coffee bursting out.

22 ounce bottle shared while in line at Dark Lord Day.  Pitch black and syrupy in appearance with a dark tan head of foam. Aroma is big on coffee, malted grains, bakers chocolate, and toffee. The taste is loaded with coffee and chocolate.  Its a really satisfying beer because it delivers all the best parts of a traditional imperial stout in a big and accessible way. The high abv is underplayed and its very drinkable.  Palate is heavy bodied, mild carbonation, smooth and thick like a chocolate shake in concentrated form.  Overall, its as good of a stout you can expect to find sans gimmicks.

750ml bottle to the dome.  Opaque brown-black, nice rusty beige head.  Balanced vanilla coffee chocolate aroma, surprisingly mellow.  A really well executed big beer, quite refined and sublime.  A World Class Coffee Stout all the way.  So nice and tasty that you want to savor it sip by sip, but it is actually quite drinkable.  Classic stuff.

UPDATED: SEP 14, 2013 Pitch dark black body with a big dark brown head. Intense roasted malty aroma with vanilla, dark chocolate, wood, licorice, honey, berries and lots of coffee. Perfectly smooth body. Extraordinary bittersweet flavour with tons of coffee, chocolate, mocha and dark chocolate, as well as vanilla, honey, caramel, licorice, berries, a hint of floral hops. Perfect. (10/5/10/5/19)
Pitch black body, brown head. Intense sweet aroma with lots of coffee, chocolate licorice, caramel, spices, plum. Full, perfect palate. Incredible sweet flavour with coffee, mocha, chocolate, licorice, caramel, brown sugar, blueberries, wood, red grapes.

Noire opaque, vêtue dune mousse dense, épaisse et persistante, qui manque un peu dagrément de dentelle. Le nez est sucré, aigre, plein de grains grillés et de figues séchées. Son goût, au travers la masse liquoreuse, est de raisins secs, de chocolat, despresso, le tout accompagné dune douce et franche amertume. Lalcool sinvite efficacement. Un produit qui ne cesse de nous remettre en question. Un bel équilibre entre lamer et le sucré. Une rondeur exemplaire. Encore une fois, merci Louis! (554-120113)
Aroma of bourbon laced with chocolate overtones.  Aperence dark brown with a slight tan head. Taste of chocolate coffee and bourbon

Bottle courtesy of Kermis. Poured a deep dark mahogany with a thin off white head and broken lace. The flavour is strong bitter, with lots of alcoholic liqourice bitterness and roasted malt. A big full bodied beer that certainly makes a statement!
UPDATED: FEB 12, 2016 Black pour from bomber. Brown bubbly head. Very chocolate backbone but somewhat light. Creamy and smooth. Good shit

Black pour with tan head. Big aroma of coffee, molasses, dark chocolate. Full bodied and ridiculously smooth. Flavours of coffee, dark chocolate, molasses, and dark berries with a pronounced bitterness that lingers through the finish. Alcohol well integrated. Im really quite shocked at how smooth and well put together this is.

Finally got a bottle of this at the City Market Coop in Burlington, VT. Second AleSmith of the Easter weekend, and last beer of this trip. Pours a real dark colour, almost black, with a big mocha creamy head, great retention. Big dark fruits (plums, raisins) aromas with hints of nuts. Again, really fruity for taste. Kind of disappointed with this one, as I expected lots of coffee and more roasted malts being a stout. Feels more like a strong porter.

Pitch black with a dark tan one finger thick head. Aroma is roasted coffee, toffee, butterscotch, roasted nuts. Taste is roasted coffee, slight hops, butterscotch. Palate is bitter coffee and earthy like wood, smoked oak chips. Mouthfeel is medium body, not watery, which holds a decent flavor.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

750mL bottle from whole foods, westlake ave., seattle WA.  Pretty deep black pour with minimal foam that was the color of caramel.  Lots of thick lacing.  Smokey, woodsy malt scent thats smooth, creamy vanilla and bitter fairly acidic coffee and rich nuts too, perhaps floral hops detected.  Low carbonation (average for the style), oily mouthfeel, super clean finish for the style.  Big malt and alcohol flavor.  Creamy at the same time though...difficult to explain.  Strong bitter coffee taste.  Bitterness and acidity flavors toward the end, floral and pine hops probably.  Rich buttery chocolate flavor on finish.  Pretty unique example of the style due to what tastes like hop addition.  ABV is slightly noticeable.  Pretty delicious.

Black pour with a tall, creamy, sorta chunky mocha brown head that has awesome retention and leaves good lacing. Aroma has tons of coffee, chocolate, toast, caramel, a little toffee, sugared roast nuts, a little earthiness and dry floral notes. Flavor is loaded with coffee right away, like good coffee, lots of sweet caramel, roasted nuts and milk chocolate come in, roast malt, hints of pine and bitter dried citrus, earthy notes, some floral and lightly acidic hop notes that could easily be from the coffee instead of hops and as it warms some dark fruit, sweet bread spice and vanilla notes come out.  Palate is creamy on entry, with a light, to moderate strength, but blanketing carbonation to break it up before an off dry, but still sort of creamy, but oddly crisp and fairly clean finish. They really worked some magic here, somehow having a beer huge in flavor, complexity, body and alcohol content while having a finish as clean and smooth as most stouts half this strength. Still it has a lingering, pleasant sweetness with a little coffee and nuttiness that lasts a good, long time, it just isnt overbearingly roasty, or sweet, or bitter, just delicious, leaving me wanting more. It is definitely on the sweet side, but it carries it well, offering an awesome balance in most categories, despite being a 12% Imperial Stout. Fantastic, one of my new favorite beers.
2012 bottle that I won on a contest here.  Very good stout with the heightened amount of bitterness that other imperial stouts let get overwhelmed with malt.  Coffee and dark chocolate on the finish.

Pours black like used motor oil with a small dark chocolate head. Not much lacing. Aroma of roasted malts, alcohol, coffee, chocolate, liquorice, dark fruits. Taste is huge and complex! Pretty much everything just mentioned in the aroma but intensified. Alcohol warmth is huge and pronounced but not overwhelming. Amazing long finish of coffee, roasted malts and chocolate. Thick, chewy texture. Very lively carbonation. Overall certainly deserving of the 100% rating! Simply amazing!

Pours black as night with the viscosity of motor oil.  Mocha colored head of thick foam that dwindles to a small island of bubbles and a thin film.  Laces like a champ.  Nose is chocolate, roasted coffee, dark roasted malts and a touch of cherry.  A little alcohol on the nose but it is 12% after all. Malt goes doughy and deep as it warms and there is bread in this.   Taste is huge alright.  Greets you with  espresso and plenty of roasted coffee flavors, then smooth doughy malt mid palate with some faint floral from the hops, unsweetened cocoa and the dark fruit, then a hint of the molasses aspect of the malt and a grainy feeling on the tongue. It finishes dry and toasted with the chocolate coming in again only sweet this time and with a delectable oily hop bitter.  Mouthfeel is thick and sticky with good carbonation. Some alcohol on the palate.  Its the coffee that makes this one stand out and its done to perfection.  This is  truly an impeccable stout.

UPDATED: DEC 9, 2014 2011 vintage poured into a teku glass, pours awesome black, aroma is chocolate,coffee, sweet alcohol, taste is the same with great creamy mouthfeel, simply awesome, need a BA version!

UPDATED: APR 27, 2013 Pours black as ink with a rich mocha head. Gobs of coffee aroma. Thick rich mouthfeel. Flavor matches nose, lots of dark roast coffee. Possibly the most perfect coffee stout out there. ---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Boro Are Staying Up Party at The Penguin, 16/04/13- my ceremonial 6K. 750ml bottle from Ales Unlimited, San Francisco- brought home before BrewDog started selling it. Vinyl black with a fat tan swell of foam speckling the tulip. Aroma of Sugar Puffs, fudge, carob, red apple and Black Russian. Puts me in mind of Struise. Mellow cool heat dripping with weak black coffee, burnt toast scrapings and Sugar Puff. Some black olive and well singed pistachio in the mix. Sugary, pleasant, not especially stout-like. Got a bit bored and started making Bombay Sapphire and Lucozade cocktails. But finished my pint no problems. UP THE BORO.
From the Abbotts Cellar in San Francisco.  Black with a fair head.  Gorgeous sweet chocolate aroma.  Light roast, bitter-sweet.  Really smooth sipper.

Bottle thanks to trade with phatdog1. Pours an opaque black brown with bubbly brown head that dissipates to leave light lacing. Aroma of heavy roasted malt and coffee, hints of chocolate, toffee and booze. Taste is coffee, quickly followed by nice sweet and dark chocolate. A thick mouth and a nice burn on the way down. Damn good, Ill need to get some more.
pours thick with full frothy head.  taste great, rich malts and coffee

.75 bottle. Black. Very dark dry roasted flavours. Cocoa beans, dark roasted coffee beans. Everything is really dark and raw. Lots of flavours, too much almost. This is a really concentrated and flavourful beer. Soft body, good bitters, doesnt feel too hot or unpleasent. Overall a really raw, flavourful stout that is drinkable in responsible quantities.-- bb/h(n9)

This pours a very dark brown color with a creamy brown head. The aroma is full of robust malts and coffee making it very inviting. The flavor is rich, bold, complex and extra silky smooth. There is so much robust flavor here my taste buds are going wild. This is just as good as I could have expected and then some. You get all the alcohol warmth without any of the obvious taste. After finally having it, its easy to see why this is as highly regarded as it is.

Tasting at Cardinal. Dark black with choco coloured head. Smell s alot like chocolate and coffee, some roasted malts. Tastes sugarray sweetness, alot of cocoa, chocolate, coffee, little bit rosted malts with a very nice aftertaste that gives you very nice hoppy bitterness to balance everything out. You can feel the alcohol in the aftertaste but not more than it gives u a nice twist. A nice beer,

UPDATED: FEB 24, 2015 Bottle at Treffipub, Helsinki. Originally rated on 26052012. Colour is black with tiny brownish white head. Aromas and flavours: Coffee, chocolate and roasted malts. Re-rate. Tap at Uber Tavern, Seattle. Colour is black with brownish head. Aromas and flavours: Coffee, chocolate, dark chocolate, some sweetness and roasted malts. Massive nice roastiness. Points 3.9-> 4.1.
Pours black with thick caramel head. Mild aroma of coffee and chocolate. Flavor, however, is bold of roasted cocoa, coffee, and some caramel. Good balance between sweetness, bitterness and body.
Incredibly heavy smell of this beer. The taste is also very heavy and licorice flavor. Fairly long finish. I was not to my taste though. But worth trying.
Aroma is earthiness, malts, coffee, chocolate and fruit/berries.  The flavor is malts, mild dark fruit/vinous notes, berry sweetness and a bourbon/acidic finish.
Bottle from 2010. Pours nearly black colored with a denne cappuccino colored head. Aromas of roasted, malt coffee, alcohol, chocolate and tobacco. Roasted flavor with notes of licorice. Great brew.

750 ml bottle from Premier Gourmet.  Pours a oily-looking brown/black with creamy, lacy light brown head.  Aroma is roasty coffee, quite present but more reserved than I would have expectted from the description, as well as dark chocolate and some subtle herbal bitterness.  Flavour is big coffee and cocoa with some tobacco, wood and herbal bitterness.  Big, full body.  Silky mouthfeel.  Big, impressive beer.

Botella. Presencia impecable, negra con corona de formación continua y marrón persistente. Aroma intenso a maltas chocolate, cacao y frutos secos todo ello impregnado un agradable licor. En boca esta muy bien compensada con el alcohol perfectamente integrado con el café y el chocolate, dejando un agradable final seco licoroso y amarhl

750mL bottle from Beermongers. Split.

A: Rich, oily black with a bubbling of mocha head. Glass receives a slight discoloration upon the swirling.

N: Smooth dark chocolate, espresso and roast, some vanilla, an oak toastiness though its not barrel aged. Some coffee berry. Malted milk. Really, really nice.

T: Very roasty with plenty of coffee bitterness. Almost pure, unsugared cocoa. Has an alcoholic sharpness that can probably age out, but its distracting to me. Theres also a hoppy bite to it.

M: Solid if a bit watery at times.

O: I always want to like this a lot more than I do. Needs some more sweetness which is why I tend to like the BA version a lot more. Worthy beer and one I should age to taste the changes.
UPDATED: MAR 1, 2014 Very nice coffee stout, but not anywhere up to hype. Perhaps the barrel aged version brings the roundness of flavor that this coffee bomb lacks.

Poured into my Samuel Smith tulip glass. I figure one Smith is well-suited for another. The beer presents itself as an opaque, nearly black with a huge, frothy, long-lasting mocha head. Aromas are characterized by milk chocolate, malted milk balls, brewed coffee, brown spirits, and perhaps some raisin. Silky, viscous, warm (not from alcohol, but like a parka for the palate), creamy, pleasant mouthfeel. Initial coffee acidity, yielding sweet roasted marshmallows, tons of lactose, and finally, cherry. Finishes with mild, but lingering bitterness. Nearly no alcohol warmth or flavor.
Svart öl med stort mörkbrunt skum. Doft: Barr, choklad, hav, lakrits, torkade exotiska frukter, kola, jord. Smak: Samma som doft + kaffe och kakao.
Not bad. Not really deserving of a 100 but it is tasty. Im not getting the coffee ad much as it is promoted in the description. Sweet but not cloying. Scotts favorite beer!

Jet black, with a brown creamy head and lively carbonation for a 12% abv brew.  Viscous & rich palate with a caramel and mocha chocolate & coffee backbone. This is rich and smooth and drinks very nicely, some roasty dry fruits & alcohol warmth on the finish. Super smooth & slick.

Appearance: Black, motor oil-like appearance.  Near no head, even when poured vigorously.  Lots of alcohol legs. 

Aroma: Bittersweet chocolate, some dark/bittersweet chocolate aroma, malt roastiness, brown bread.  There is a hint of a red wine aroma in the end, definite alcohol presence.  Not much coffee apparent at all.

Taste: A slight coffee presence, but not enough to really call this a coffee stout (its not FBS, thats for sure).   A roast bitterness present throughout. 

Mouthfeel: Viscous with a definite alcohol warmth.  Medium-high drinkability.  

Overall: This is an excellent stout, but it isnt one that I could give a 10 too because it isnt what I would consider world class.  Im not sure how old the bottle I had was, but Id love to give it some aging in the cellar and revisit it again after a year or so. 

Score: 9/10

Black and opaque with a light brown head. Coffee, dark chocolate, caramel, and roasted aromas. Full-bodied and silky smooth. Rich and deep chocolate, caramel, and coffee flavors that finishes bitter-sweet. Very satisfying and inviting. Nice!

Surprised I haven't rated this one before. Nonetheless, on tap at Toronado in San Diego, served in a stem glass. Pours black with a small tan head that fades to a thin remnant and leaves a tiny amount of lace. On the nose, there are big notes of chocolate, roast malts, licorice and coffee, along with earth and subtle herbal hops. The flavour is moderately sweet throughout with an incredibly complex malty blend of molasses, dark chocolate and roasted malts, along with herbs, dark fruit, and hints of tobacco and coffee. The finish is long and malty with roasty notes and subtle coffee and herbs. On the palate it is full in body with a smooth creamy texture and soft carbonation. Overall, wow, this is an incredible imperial stout! Unbelievably complex and subtle, it is truly beautiful. The quintessential fireside sipper. 2013-03-21

On tap at Toronado, San Diego. Pours crude-oil black with an even icing of head. Aroma of chocolate, molasses, and coffee beans. Bold chocolate-covered coffee beans up front that fades to burnt sugar and surprising spicy hops on a long complex finish. I love it.

Bottle at a bottle share. This is one of the ones where I wish I would have slapped the beer out of the hands of everyone else and drank it all myself. Pours a near black color. Taste is quite roast and very smooth. Super tasty. Truly a great beer.

Pour black as night with a 1/2 finger head. Aroma of alcohol and roasted malt. Taste of roasted malt, chocolate and wood. No trace of alcohol in the taste. Nice lacing on the glass. Super thick and smooth. This is a very good and big beer. Was not as good as I was expecting based on the ratings, but that is just me. I think Expedition Stout has a better aroma and flavor, but this has a richer mouthfeel. Certainly worth try if you can find it. I would like to buy more and age it for some years.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bomber to a snifter.  Coffee? check.  Chocolate malt? check.  Roasted? check.  Smooth?  check (check, check).  This is a fantastic stout.  Subtle flavors with some real kick.  Looking forward to aging a couple bottles.

Pours dark black with nice brown head. Dark roast coffee aroma. Smooth texture. Very roasty with some coffee and Lots of chocolate malts Some dark fruit taste, and vanilla. Warm alcohol on the aftertaste, pretty strong boozy stuff. Very good.

Ive had this beer may times just getting around to rating it.  Cracked a bottle on St. Patricks Day, paired it with slow cooked corn beef cooked in a generous portion of Guinness, with a Jameson Maple glaze.  I digress... anyhow.  Aroma is roasted malts and intense coffee.  Pours a jet black with little to no head (2011 bottle). Taste is effing fantastic!  Coffee upfront then smooth sweet finish for the style.  Speedway has a boozy mouth feel an aftertaste. Be careful though this is a sipper beer! Although the taste is phenomenal, it will hit hard.   So glad tlits hit distribution in whole foods!

Thanks to MrFecesious for sharing a bottle of the 2011. Solid black with a good brown head that leaves some nice lacing. Aroma is liquorice, vanilla, chocolate, dates, raisins, figs, coffee, bourbon. Creamy mouthfeel, smooth on the palate, sweet with a slightly boozy bittersweet finish. Taste is chocolate, vanilla, liquorice, dates, wood. Tasty but a slight harshness in the aftertaste.

Shared bomber with sherm1016.  Pours black...or damn close...with dark tan head.  Nose is heavy on coffee with dark (semi sweet?) chocolate right there also.  Initial taste is the same. Very smooth.  The booze is pretty much covered up by the heavy chocolate and coffee flavors.  Will let it warm a little and then sip some more.  Very very tasty.

3rd time having this. It's superb. 

If I could birth my first child in a bathtub full of this, I wouldn't. Only so I could travel back in time to that moment when I didn't, so I could actually do it.... 41 years from now. To once again, taste the creamy coffeeness in my throat. To smell its sweet bitterness. Setting the mood for a 75yr old wet dream.

This is a good beer.

Black with creamy tan head. Nice tan lacing.  Roast, espresso, chocolate, licorice, fruity, and  mild alcohol notes.  Full bodied, silky, taste like aroma.  Decent balance, medium hop bitterness that lingers.  

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

UPDATED: JUN 16, 2013 Bottle @Linköping Beer Expo 2013. Aroma tarlike, loads of coffee. Sweet impression overall. Taste is massive, coffe and chocolate. Long bitter finish. Hides both sweetness and alcohol well.
UPDATED: MAR 31, 2013 I really love this beer! Itâs a perfect chocolatey stout. My brother (timfoolery) gave me a pour of this a few years back and itâs still one of my favorites.

750mL foil-wrapped bottle. Pours thick and reddish-brown with a 3-finger foamy brown head. Long retention, with doily lacing. Aromas of rich cocoa, fudge, and alcohol. Plum, raisin, and some hazelnut. Flavor is light espresso upfront, moving to bitter cocoa and chocolatey fudge. Bitter finish, with rich cocoa and espresso. Roasty, rich coffee as it warms. Nice bitterness. Low carbonation, full-bodied, warming, with a dry finish. So good. [1107]

Bottle from Coppers, Newcastle. An inky black beer with a bright brown-tan coloured quickly disappearing head. Rich warming chocolate and spiced red fruity flavours are followed by vanilla, oak and liquorice and coffee notes with milk chocolate on the finish. Hides its alcoholic very strength well. Superb!

Oily black pour with a very thin brown head. Aroma is coffee, roast, malty and deep. Some dark fruit and vanilla. Flavor is similar. Coffee prevails, but its not bitter. Thick creamy mouthfeel. Nice stout.
Smells like black licorice, booze, and dark-roasty malts. I think the bottle u had is a bit old since the coffee is very muted. Booze is well hidden.

Standard black, light brown, fluffy head. Smells like Coffee, chocolate dark dark fruits. a little smoked as well.
The taste is really well balanced between the same notes. licorice as well. dry notes in the after taste. Full-bodied and super smooth. Enjoyed in a shelter in our living room!
Very dark thick pour.. no light makes its way through this one.. nice mellow smell.. strong with flavor yet very smooth.. pretty much everything it was hyped up to be.

UPDATED: JUL 6, 2013 Rating #420! Pours a jet black with a HUGE tan head that takes forever to dissipate. After opening and smelling the booziness of this beer I am maybe regretting trying to finish this 750ml myself. Definitely coffee and alcohol in the nose. The taste is amazing. I was expecting your typical harsh imperial stout taste but there is none of that. Just smooth coffee and malt flavor. Oh my this is smooth and dangerous. The mouth feel isnÃ¢â¬â¢t as thick as I would have expected but it doesnÃ¢â¬â¢t matter. The beer rolls around in your mouth like butter. Wow this is great! I canÃ¢â¬â¢t wait to taste my other bottles in a few months.
Pitch pitch black. Some yeast, massive cocoa, coffee chocolat, cocos, getting alot of cocos! Very complex aroma. Slightly bitter, very long sweet finish. Massive imperial stout!
On draught at Roscoes Stout Summit 2/23/13. 2012 vintage.  Espresso is first and foremost, with a dark chocolate pairing.  Alcohol warming, but a very smooth finish.

Drought at BeerAuthority, NY. Blackish-brown color, amber colored spongy big head, coffee-caramel aroma, coffee beans taste with a hint of sour cherry, low carbonation, long bittersweet finish. Very satisfying stout.

750ml bottle from City Beers in San Francisco. Pours into my snifter with the color of used motor oil, but with a luscious, foamy, coffee-colored head that hangs in there for a while. Moderate lacing.
Nose is hefty toasted malt and caramel coffee. Traces of espresso and chocolate come through while sipping. Perhaps a hint of raisin there...something subtly fruity under thick layers of malt.
Smooth, seductive mouthfeel; full and rich.
Well-balanced brew; rich malty sweetness and a good dose of bitterness, but not too much. Ill be making love to this bottle for another hour or so!

Serving: 750 ml. bottle from Hi-Time Wine Cellars.  About time I got around to this one.  Bottle from 2009.  It pours black with a decent sized light tan head.  The nose is lighter than I was expecting with some roast and coffee notes.  The flavor highlights the coffee with a good dose of roasted malt minus any burnt or charred notes.  Rich in body with a slight sweetness and a smooth finish.  Very slight raisin notes come out as it warms. The alcohol remains well hidden.  Very well balanced and quite delicious.

Bottle. Pours black with brown head. Strong coffee and dark chocolate aroma. Coffee and roasted malts taste, a little licorice(whisky?) but not very alcoholish. The best imperial stout Ive ever tasted.

Draught at Goerge Keelys NYC. Pours pitch black with a mocha head. Taste is incredibley smooth: coffee with very little bittneress. Velvety smooth.  Some chocolate notes but coffee is the main flavor and aroma here. A really terrific beer.

Darker than the blackest of demons! Light brown head. Huge coffee notes as well as dark fruit on the nose, also very roasty. Bitter dark chocolate taste with tons of coffee on the finish. Very smooth, but the finish explodes with dark coffee. Amazing beer.

UPDATED: MAY 9, 2013 750ml bottle (ALEhouse, Riga) - sip
Walnut and rich coffee-ey roast. Simple smooth palate, not as sticky as I was expecting. Its a super soft and gentle dark roast, compared to what I was expecting. Anna does get some alcohol, but not so much to me. Its very easy to see why people love this. Should rerate a big sample.
Rerate: 3 750ml bottles (Angleterre, Helsinki) (7:5:8:4:14=3.8)
Thanks Jari, and Markku twice! Lovely rich roast aroma, Black coffee, but strangely some kidney. Massive rich roast, alco punch immedately in the mouth. Some alco+roast burn immediately on swallowing. More aggressive than beore, but still very drinkable for the strength.

Just a really good beer. Try it for yourself.  It lives up to all the ratings here!  Strong and great tasting. 

---Mr. Dizzle

After many years of travels (never in CA), I found a bottle of the Speedway Stout.  Waited a long time to try this.  Jet black with a moderately sized light brown head.  Aroma of soy sauce, black barley, dark fruit, oaky like a full bodied red wine.  Flavor is deep and rich with a profound sweet rich fruitiness of an extra (extra extra) stout.  Tastes like pushing the upper limits of 500L barley in the grain bill.  Just super deeply burnt, roasty and rich.  Alcohol presence is there too.  Mouthfeel is thick and the bite of bitter hops lingers.  What a huge beer.

#2600. On tap at Belmont Station. Pitch black with a thin brown top. Scent is chocolate, roasted malt and coffee. Taste is anise, chocolate, roasty and coffee. Will update rating when I try the bottle I now have but it is amazing.

pours black with a nice tan head.  Smells of dark chocolate, coffee, and dark fruit.  The taste is a well balanced coffee with some dark chocolate and dark fruit in the middle.  The coffee comes back nicely for a dry finish. No alcohol detected. Really good stuff.
Wonderful beer with a beautiful aroma. Full bodied with coffee notes everywhere - looks beautiful. Bitter chocolate finish. Still interesting / improving after drinking a couple glasses.

Bottled share with another five friends. Black colour with minimal off-white head that quickly diminishes. Aroma is coffee, chocolate, licorice and spicy notes. Flavor has red fruits, slightly vanilla, candy sugar, chocolate, sweet, licorice. The final is slightly bittery with coffee notes.

picked up this 750ml from HyVee in Moline, IL. Color is essentially jet black, with thin light brown head and some OK lacing. Aroma has notes of licorice, dates, coffee, chocolate, and alcohol. Mouthfeel is thick, but not syrupy. Flavor is coffee, chocolate, alcohol, and plenty of hoppy bitterness. For 12%ABV, the alcohol is surprisingly well hidden. 10 years back, I would have rated this a 4.7 or 4.8. An absolute palate wrecker!

Bottle.   Viscous black with a beige foam.  Aromas are earthy, rich dark coffee with dark chocolate and marzipan.   Vinous with blackberry and nutty, spicy notes and oak barrel.   Liquorice with medicinal notes with hints of soy.  Flavours are rich roast, bitter coffee with dark berries and red wine.  Nutty alcohol with a spicy and mouth filling palate.  Hints of cola with marzipan and woody, creamy, earthy notes.  Bittersweet dark chocolate with hints of caramel.  Reminds me of the deaseased UK world wide stout.  Excellent.

Nose is huge amounts of deep coffee, molasses, chicory, cocoa and spice with subtly dancing edges of candy and lemon rind.  Pours deep and dark with a fawn head.  Flavour is hugely chocolates and rich with warming spice, coffee and port in spades and a long, fat finish of golden syrup with tones of bacon flavoured crisps. Amazing.
Coffee, chocolate, and some fruit in the aroma.  Taste is sweet chocolate, with bittersweet coffee and alcohol in the finish.  Really good.

Bottle to tulip. Pitch black, small head. Great aroma of chocolate, toffee, coffee and booze. Tastes all balanced nicely with a smooth feel and slightly bitter and warming aftertaste. Great flavor, great balance. Great beer. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Great aroma, near perfect black pour, balanced taste and warming mouthfeel.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bottle. The pour is a very dark brown. The aroma has a lot of malt in it. The taste carries the malt with it. A little toffee comes through as well. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

UPDATED: DEC 3, 2014 12/14rerate.    Aged 2.5 years.  A little too long. Vinous aroma and crept into taste.   Didnt change rating but 2.5 yr bottle not nearly a 4.2..................purchased on summer trip to CA and stored for 7 mos.  bomber to glass.  I get much more chocolate (dark) in aroma than coffee.  maybe vanilla?  appearance is a 5 - dark pour with long lacing dark beige head.  Taste is different than aroma?  palate is med thickness.  Taste is chocolate; and some nice coffee roast and warming alcohol a player as well as hops at end.  very very good  stout...

UPDATED: JAN 22, 2015 Pours dark brown with reddish tones, browny creamy foam. Mostly chocolate on nose. Flavor - chocolate more to me than coffee, mild sweet with dark malt bitter in the end. Nice! Warming alcohol on nose, warming overall. Must re-rate with comparable sample.  
rerate 01.2015. - not huge for sure, properly brewed with dominant roasted, darkest malts flavor, I would say even that this is more stout than imp, thick but not smooth palate, pleasant taste but no wow. <br.
-1 taste, -2 overall
Pours pitch black with thin tan head.  Coffee and bitter chocolate on the nose, more coffee and chocolate along with roasted malts on the palate.  Nice and thick, perfect cold weather stout.

UPDATED: DEC 9, 2013 Deep dark ruby almost black with thin brown head.
Aroma.. intense roasted malts, coffee, bit of chocolate, caramel, hops, alcohol.
Sweet with coffee bitterness. Nicely balanced. Smooth.
Great brew.
Bottle. Pitch black color, small tan head. Sweet, roasty, malty, coffee, faint chocolate in aroma. Sweet, deep roast, malty, coffee in flavor. Perfectly balanced and very very drinkable beer.

Pours jet black with a brown creamy head. Tastes of coffee but its well balanced. Not overpowering at all. Smooth. The warmth from the alcohol comes through at the finish. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

FInally. Pours jet black with a foam tan head with good retenton. nose of roast. This races around the mouth with a solid body and plenty of roasty black coffee... Then chocolate rounds the curve. This one hits the finish line first like a Single Turbo Grand National at Englishtown Raceway. Fast and defiantly in first.

Pours dense black with a little tan ring of fizz. Sugary warming alcohol with dark roasted grain. The flavor is similar sugary with a roasted flavor with some dark fruits that match very well. The carbonation and body seems to be moderate which fits well opening up the fruits and roasted grain and coffee. Not until the carbonation and beer leaves do I taste the coffee roast with a nice drying coffee palate.  I enjoyed it a lot but the alcohol was at the limit.
UPDATED: MAY 7, 2013 Bottle at home. Pours motor oil black with minimal head. Aroma is roasty, coffee. Taste is strong chocolate and booze - not for the beginner. Really fantastic stout.

Lovely integration of the coffee.  Many a time I rate a beer for it sheer audacity and being in your face.   This beer shines in its elegance and balance and I think the haters will be few and far between.  Sadly where I am from not many people will get a chance to try this beer.
750ml bottle.  Pours pitch black with a medium head.  Aroma is coffee and tar with dry roast.  Taste has coffee and tar.  Thick tarry finish.  No sense of the strength.

KyotoLefty was kind enough to share this with me. It poured a thick pitch black with an orange tinged head of foam. The aroma gave me hints of red wine, my friend thought it smelled like steak! The flavor had coffee & chocolate notes. It is very smooth and drinkable. It lived up to the hype.
750 Bottle.  This is the apex of coffee stouts.  Thick, smooth, velvety, and perfectly hopped.  The roasted malts are perfect - this is a flawless brew.

Bottle. Black pour, tan head. Aroma is creamy milk chocolate, coffee. Not as roasty as expected. Taste: stale coffee. Some metallic notes. Medium body, light carb. Unpleasant bitter finish.  Overall: second time having this, just as unimpressed as the first time. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bottle. Black pour with a small tan head which lasts the duration. Nose is mocha driven. Loads of coffee followed by powdered chocolate and sweet vanilla. Its quite sweet. Taste shows bitter espresso drowned out by sweet vanilla and milk chocolate. Hides the 12% unbelievably well. Has some decent hoppy bitterness behind it all. Solid stuff but not sure what the hype is to be honest ---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Pours semi thick black with little head and good lacing.  Big coffee and chocolate aroma with slight spice from alcohol and some savoriness.  Big coffee and chocolate up front in taste with dried dark fruit mid palate , some umami and warmth coming in an enveloping the mouth.  Coffee comes back in pleasing aftertaste.  Big stout that hides alcohol very well.  Roast combines with coffee very well.  Good after dinner beer. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Black to dark brown with tan head.  Strong coffee taste with slight chocolate and prune undertones.  Slight alcohol warmth but not string taste.  Balanced very well.  Creamy mouthfeel. Very good.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bottle given to me by Kara when I went to San Diego to pick her up and drive back to Rochester NY.  (took 3.5 days with her 2 cats)   Pours black with a small tan head. Great aroma of coffee, chocolate, and roasted malt. Taste is coffee, chocolate, dark fruit, caramel, licorice, and a bit of smoke.  I could also taste the alcohol. Rich, creamy, and warming.
Wonderful dark pour a moderate head. As advertised, coffee and chocolate at the start then toasty after that.

750ml bottle from Cotteridge Wines shared with Shaun.Poured black,very black.Good sized tan head.Great aroma of coffee and chocolate with roast malt doing its best to get in on the act too.Lovely chocolate and coffee taste with the roast malt also there and the merest hint of liquorice.Lovely warming alcohol feel to round it all off nicely.

Poured into a snifter.

Aroma: incredible vanilla, coffee, chocolate.

Mouth feel: delightful syrupy body.

Great beer.
Seriously satisfying, a remarkable beer whose dark, roasty character holds fast to the last lap. Heavy and dark, with coffee and complex, almost berry-like aftertaste.

UPDATED: FEB 6, 2013 Pitch black, with a big thick foamy brown head that stays there and clings to the glass. Aroma of coffee and alcohol. Taste is coffee, dark chocolate and some caramel.  Alcohol in the finish. Huge beer, loving it.

Yes, coffee but also dark chocolate. Not too much of an alcohol taste but strong nonetheless. Awesome mouth feel as it doesnt way your mouth down but still heavy enough. Loved the finish with this glorious beer. Wow!

Chilled 75 cl brown bottle poured into a snifter at a JStax tasting.  Pours black with light brown head,  Some lacing, medium body, medium carbonation, and vanilla aroma.  Taste is chocolate, toasty, some coffee, and a hint of vanilla.  Good stuff.
Near perfect beer. Chocolate, coffee, booze. Best on cask but still a beauty in the bottle. Alesmith, when are you going to distribute in Texas?

750 ml bottle. Pours black with huge tan head that settles quickly. Aromas of dark chocolate, espresso, and roasted malts with a touch of vanilla. Very much the same flavors with coffee predominating followed by dark chocolate. Beautifully balanced and incredibly smooth.

Midnight black with a soft white head. This milky smooth, extremely creamy beer is a work of art. The chocolates, the malts, and the alcohol are all super well balanced and blended. If you can, aging this makes it even better.

Bottle from Systembolaget, 2012 vintage.
Pours black with a nice espresso brown head. Nice lacing on the glass.
Aroma has a lot of chocolate, molasses, some coffee, roasted malt and dark fruit as well.
Taste is not that coffee filled as Id hoped for. More chocolate than coffee actually, nicely roasted malt, some liquorice, dark fruit (dark/ripe cherries), sweetness and some warming alcohol at the end. Tastes matches aroma well, mouth feel is quite thick.
Its very well balanced but not that complex and a bit too sweet for me, I prefer my stouts rougher than this.

So very good. Pours matt black with a light tam head. Aroma is rich with coffee, heather, honey, chocolate, molassess with hints of licqourice. Taste is chock full of chocolate and coffee and amazingly balanced! Great stuff!

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
750ml to snifter.  Pours dark but not thick.  Lovely coffee flavor. Not over the top coffee or bitterness.   Smooth and delicious.

UPDATED: JAN 2, 2016 750ml bottle. Black colour with average, frothy to creamy, fairly lasting and lacing, brown head. Compact and slightly unspecific dark malty aroma. Similar in taste, compact, not overly evolving, changing nor multidimensional; a good portion of warming alcohol in the finish. Has the typical Alesmith precision and lacks therefore some roughness to match my personal preferences. Rerate 01/01/2016: No reason to change the score. Well-known cleanliness and precision is still impressive but simultaneously accounts for monotony.

Color is solid, light-defying ebony with a lasting, light brown head. Aroma is indeed promising, caramel/toffee, roasty, chocolate malt and espresso. Flavor   with the toffee becoming a bit more evident, turkish coffee, chocolate syrup and an good quantity of roasted malt.Awesome beer

Pours black w/ light brown head. Scents of roasted coffee and dark chocolate. Taste is deep, dark coffee balanced by a chocolate sweetness.  A bit of anise spice to it. One of the few brews that tastes much like it smells. Rich and complex, yet not overly thick and syrupy (is that a word?) like having your dessert and after dinner coffee in one glorious glass. One of the rare beers that lives up to the hype. Hard to say what would make this much better.

Bottle, shared with toffsbury - thanks a million!  Pours opaque black with a brown head.  Aroma of bourbon, marshmallow, chocolate, and coffee.  Taste is a bunch of coffee.  Also in there is molasses and brown sugar.  Finish is pretty perfect - smooth and roasty, and quite bitter.  Thick and smooth mouthfeel.  Fantastic stuff!

Smells lovely. Loads of coffee, with some chocolate and brandy hidden in the back there. Pours black with a thin tan head, completely opaque. Black as an unpopular high school kids heart. Flavour is full and rich... Lots of coffee, a bit of booze... Not that complex, really. A hint of molasses lingers with the coffee in the finish... Aftertaste is just really good coffee. Mmm. With a bit of air and oxygen theres a bit of brandy and bourbon that gets in there. Very nice. Huge wonderful thick and smooth body too, by the way. A gift from my future brother-in-law. Thanks!

Pours Jet Black - "looks like coffee" was one of the comments, which pretty much describes the beer. Aroma: Coffee - lots of it. Taste: Coffee at first, then caramel and dark fruit, finishing with a fruity sweet/sour aftertaste. Mouthfeel is very pleasently deep, the bourbon barrel ageing shines through, quite viscouse. This is a fantastic beer, but definitely not for the faint of heart :)
Udredning vejts v jeg cr job. Cr. Big htx uky Cut cv kun c.  Guts ylv it rbibuvx
(bottle - STLCOB end of year tasting) black with tan head. Aroma of roast malts, coffee and some chocolate. Flavor is coffee/bitter chocolate/toasted malts.

Shared with yiannos below....
Amazing color and texture for me.
Great coffee aromas.
Bittersweet taste with the sweet side being very heavy at the end.
Loved it
Black colour. Coffee and roaste malt aroma. Bittersweet, flavour of coffee and roasted malts. Very nice, but was expecting more of this beer though

Huge. Big coffee, very dark. There is a little alchohol taste in the finish, but there would be for a 12% beer. Huge is definitely the word to describe this beer.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Very wide taste spectrum, alcohol masked well, though high concentrate makes a lot in taste, very good carbonation, too thin body and taste not  smooth smooth.

Poured a pitch black color with 2-3 fingers of tan head that initially lasted for quite some time. Thick window-like lacing on the sides. Good retention all the way down with a lot of bubbles.

Smelled a great mix of dark chocolate, toffee, caramel, coffee and bitter coffee beans. Not as much coffee as I would have thought, but very pleasurable overall. 

First thought once it hit my lips was how thick it was. Got much more coffee and coffee beans than the smell. Also dark chocolate, toffee and caramel. A lot more roastier than I anticipated after not getting much on the sniff. Could taste the 12 percent more on the way down. Deep, dark and lingering on the taste buds all the way down. 

Full body. Thick texture. Average carbonation. Long, smooth finish. Warming all the way down. 

Just a great beer. I think it was just a tad overhyped, but Im glad to finally give it a try. Great beer.

Pours black with a nice khaki head that dissipates. Aroma is coffee with light caramel notes. Taste opens with coffee and roasted malts, fading to caramel sweetness with a tight alcohol bite to balance. Full luxurious mouthfeel. One of the best. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Thanks to my thoughtful Mother-in-law!
Pours a completely opaque black/brown with a tan head that says as a thick blanket. 
Smell is chocolate, dark fruit, heavy roast smell, molasses,
Taste is similar to nose with the coffee flavors coming out in the taste. I also get licorice in the taste. It ends dry and roasty.
Mouthfeel is very nice. Smooth finely structured carbonation. Full body.
A very nice Imperial Stout - I think it would age beautifully.

Poured into a pint glass. Bottled 3/28/2012 according to the case. 

A - Dark Brown/Black beer with a creamy light brown head, pours motor oil thick. The head consists of many small tightly packed bubbles, with great lacing.

S - Coffee upfront with a chocolatey nutty background.

T - where to start...very well balanced, the transition from flavor to flavor is so smooth. Beginning with some sweet chocolate notes, then to slightly bitter roasted coffee notes ending with a slight alcohol burn. Excellent.

M - Silky, thick, medium/full body.

O - Lives up to its hype, soooo good I cant wait to have another!

Bottle shared at Crowbar with ed & daje
Pours almost black, massive brown head. Aromas of roasted malts, coffee, chocolate, other nice dark flavors. Heavy sweet, quite toasty and roasty, coffee. Nice oily texture and absolutely full bodied. A fantastic beer; its just perfectly balanced with nice aromas and flavors
Pours ink black with a bit of tan head. The aroma is strong coffee and cocoa nibs with a splash of vanilla. The taste is true to the nose with a nice bite of bitterness. Really nice stout.
Pint on tap.  The description says it all, actually.  I dont have much to add.  Its amazing.

Bottled:Pours black with a lacing head. Coffee, chocolate, licorice, smoked meat and some hops on the nose. Flavour is cold coffee, char coal, hops and chocolate leading to a bitter and warming finish. Big, bold and tasty!

Fra flaske på Cardinaltreff des-12: endellig fikk jeg smake Ole Anders sin favorittstout. Skjønner godt hvorfor han blir lyrisk om denne, det må være den beste imperial stout jeg har smakt. Må kjøpe en flaske neste gang jeg er i København.
The benchmark for coffee stouts. Fantastic. The coffee is really the centerpiece here but theres plenty of American stout sweetness to round it out. A very clean and balanced beer.
Pours black with dark brown head, this beer is freakin amazing! Monstrous notes of chocolate and coffee, super complex and real thick, kind of a sipper, but real good!

Bottle is at least two years old. Pours jet black with a dark brown head. Aroma is malty, roasty with a hint of coffee. Taste is chocolate, malty with coffee on the finish. Very thick and amazing. I love this stout!

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Imperial stouts are one of my favorite styles and this one does not disappoint. Pours black with a rich brown fluffy head. Aromas of roasted chocolate, coffee, and tobacco.  Drinks sweet and rich with dark chocolate, coffee, and vanilla all prominent, but with a strong hop character that balances it nicely.  Amazing beer on all fronts.
Pours ink black with a bit of tan head. The aroma is strong coffee and cocoa nibs with a splash of vanilla. The taste is true to the nose with a nice bite of bitterness. Really nice stout.

Bottle 75 cl from erzbierschof.ch. Nice black colour, brown head rather tenacious. Aromas of mocha, conentated coffee and roast, cocoa ans raisin. The taste is very chocolated, cocoa, coffee, burnt, raisin-date, immediate sensation of alcohol. Fat and velvety texture. The whole is powerful, intense and complex, full bodied. Finish alcoholic, thick and harmonious, dry aftertaste. Very nice but very expensive.

(Bottle) Pours a chocolate brown with tan head and persistent lacing. Aroma includes predominant alcohol and toasted malt. Flavor is an intense combination of alcohol, dark chocolate, roasted malt and coffee. Thanks to QuezXLV for importing this one into New Jersey. ---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Aroma of chocolate, mocha and slight licorice.  Pours black with no real head.  Taste is licorice up front with lasting chocolate and coffee notes.  Very nice stout.

Super rich. Coffee is strong, but the taste of chocolate is huge. It's thick and sweet but a nice touch of bitter. 

Foamy head fades to a clingy ring around the top with some lingering bubbles. Smells great, tastes amazing. Not just the best stout I've ever had (and had a lot!), but this is easily my favorite beer ever. Ever!
Pours black with a mocha colored head. Nose is coffee and nuty.  Taste is also coffee up front. Delious. Maybe a tad too boozey?

pours very dark, brown foam. this is how a stout should look like ! 
not that intesne smell, but i got oat. waaw... carbo is just perfect, sweetness of chocolat, oaty a bit, hint of coffee, chocolaty, very chocolaty aftertase ! ( did i just eat a KG of chocolat??? ) and this after 1 sip... amazing. not an overrated top-beer, finaly ! if onley i could get it cheaper, this would be something id always have in multiples. had no problems finishing this big one by myself !

Pour out dark black with a generous pillowy head.  Rich aromas of coffee, chocolate, toast with a cooling alcoholic finish with slight vanilla notes.  Complex flavors of toast, earth, chocolate and coffee with a slightly floral finish.

Solid west coast stout, more bitter than sweet  Very boozy -- perhaps too much so? Strong stout flavor with a slight bitter overlayment. Coffee flavor is slightly shy.

Petroleo con una corona de espuma bastante irregular pero que dibuja bien el vaso. Huele a café hasta aburrir con trazas de moka y azucar moreno. En boca va cambiando hacia el cacao y conforme pasa el tiempo en el vaso los aromas de café también se van relajando y pasando a chocolate. Muy larga en boca, realmente buena.

Aroma is burnt malts: mocha, charcoal, tobacco, hazelnut. Aspiration helps the booze come through. A whiff could give you a buzz.

Gorgeous bowling ball black. Fluffy meringue of brown head. Beautiful sheet of lace.

The flavor is burnt cookies; boozy as hell. Raisins and dates. Heavy dark chocolate and mocha. LIke an overcooked brownie (in a good way).

Smooth, chunky, chewy feel. A little oily but more chalky. Strong and outstanding. Ill join the chorus of aficianados.

Wow 750ml bottle all to myself. Best stout ever. Strong coffee aroma as soon as bottle is opened. Not to bitter but perfectly balanced. what an amazing beer. Maybe the coffe could have been a bit less, but still amazing.

Bottle- Pour is a dark black with a dark tan head..Nose is sweet chocolate, dark chocolate, coffee, caramel, roasty, plum, dark cherry..Taste is bitter chocolate, spice, caramel, coffee, velvet mouthfeel
750ml. bottle. Pours jet black with a nice tan head. Aroma is coffe and chocolate. The taste is heavy on the coffee and chocolate with a great malt backbone. I love this beer! Great job Alesmith!

22 ounce bottle.  Pours black with a small tan head.  Great aroma of coffee, chocolate, and roasted malt.  Taste is coffee, chocolate, dark fruit, caramel, licorice, and a bit of smoke.  Rich, creamy, and warming.  Excellent!!

UPDATED: OCT 27, 2014 Awesome coffee and chocolate aroma.  Rich, smooth chocolate, coffee,malt taste.  Best beer I have had. (Nov 2012)
Having had Speedway numerous times since, in bottle and on tap, as well as having had numerous other "big" stouts in the interim, I am compelled to slightly downgrade my rating.  Still regard as a world class beer.
One of the chewiest stouts out there. Best coffee stout by far!!!!!!!! via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Thanks to Quez, bomber poured into Chimay glass, jet black with fluffy head,  aroma is understated but taste is immense chocolate some smoke caramel black cherry, very solid but not quite elite

Dark as hell, small amount of off white head. Smells of chocolate, coffee, syrupy coats. Roasted coffee in the back, sweet milk chocolate up front. A little boozy but a nice sipper.

Hey, I finally put this in the fridge. An inky black with a tan ring of head that disappears right away. Aroma is heavy of a really nice espresso and chocolate. Excellent coffee taste, some vanilla, caramel and molasses. Incredible velvety mouthfeel. Amazing beer.

Pours a dark brown with minimal light brown head that leaves some lacing.Smells like coffee and dark chocolate. Mmh.Has a nice bite in the middle of the tongue. The dark malts taste so much like a high cocoa content dark chocolate bar. Very nice coffee aftertaste balances it all. The more I drink out of the glass the more flavor opens up. Alcohol is warming and semi hidden.Great coffee stout!

Pours an opaque black with nice coffee colored head. Big coffee and burnt caramel aromas with subtle alcohol and dank hoppiness. Taste is much of the same. Coffee, caramel, dark chocolate with a creamy and rich piney/alcohol after taste. Mouth feel is warm and slightly carbonated. Very well executed beer and pairs well with sweets.

Bomber poured into a tulip.  Thick pour with sizeable beige head that lasts.  Coffee, malt and chocolate nose.  Taste is coffee, chocolate, malt, caramel.  Great creamy mouthfeel.  One of my favorites.
This stout is amazing. Chocolate notes, heavy intense body, but with a strange lightness in the palate. Definitely the best imperial stout I ever had, and Ive tried a few...

Drank from a 22 oz bottle poured into a glass. Dark black oily appearance when poured with a small, thick and creamy looking head. Strong aroma of coffee beans. Tastes strongly of coffee as well, almost like an iced coffee with some alcohol thrown in!  Mouthfeel is surprisingly thin with slight carbonation. As a coffee and beer lover, this is a treat! 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Drank on international stout day out of glass from 22 oz bottle. Aroma- bourbon smell. Little notes of coffee. Appearance- light frothy head. Pours and looks like oil. Taste- glorious. Taste the coffee beans and chocolate notes. Some hoppiness too. Palate- best part. Mouthfeel like you just ate a hoppy coffee bean. Overall- fantastic stout
This is a bit of a letdown.  There isnt a great deal of aroma, at all.  Color is deep black.  Flavor is slightly above average for imperial stout.

Tap at OBriens for Night of a Million Zillion Speedways. Pours ink with minimal red foam. Nose is green bell pepper, lemon peel. Taste is spicy green coffee, earth, acidic lemon sharpening the already lacticly sour Speedway. Not a fan. Similar to the Kopi Luwak- both too green and more coffee is not what Speedway needs. Earlier Rating: 5/12/2009 Total Score: 4750 mL 2008 ed. into snifter. Pours an opaque black with a small, dark tan head that disappears after awhile. Spotty lacing. Aroma of sour black cherries, chocolate covered strawberries, and fresh granny smith apples. Taste is sour with black cherries, strawberry tart, semisweet chocolate. Very oily, velvety mouthfeel that is coating on the palate. Reminds me of an imperial Bells Cherry Stout. Could actually be an RIS and Sour Ale combined. 12% is barely noticeable. As this drink warms, I start to get some espresso and vanilla ice cream as well as heavy whipping cream. Maybe this needs to be aged more but the overall impression I had was that this was very sour. 7/4/8/5/15=3.9Tap at Hamiltons SD. Pours near jet black with a fluffy, super rocky grayish head that has excellent retention and big, sheety lace. Aroma and taste are 100% coffee. Not much complexity. Thin to creamy mouthfeel. Pretty yummy but overall like iced coffee.750mL 2009 ed. Pours near jet black with a towering deep brown to almost red mocha red with excellent retention and very good sheety lace. Excellent fresh, green coffee, tropical notes, bitter dark chocolate in the aroma. Taste is extremely bitter cacao and dark chocolate. Very hoppy but not distracting from the coffee. No residual sugars, no cloying sweetness. The 12% is perfectly hidden. Very good. 8/5/8/4/15=4.0

Thorough coffee and roast. Deepest black with solid brown pillowy head.  A bit boozy with great coffee and roasted qualities. Thick and sticky. Big coffee throughout.  Top notch world class and something I would hold for a year or two if I had got another. At least. No question it could be improved with age.

Really thick strong aroma is sweet with dark chocolate, coffee, bitterness underneath, licorice and bit cough syrup. Eben black, 1 finger expresso head medium long, bit lacing, inviting. Full body, soft velvety feel, lots of chocolate, great palate, long taste with nice nuances and lots of flavor, dark fruits and bit berries, lots of bitterness, warming alcohol with no burning sting. Wow, great !

Mmm, det är svårt att inte ha höga förväntningar inför en öl av den här magnituden. Smaken upplevde jag som lite stickig och spretig med inslag av choklad, kaffe och syra men framförallt som väldigt komplex. Jag har en flaska kvar och den ska jag låta vila ett år eller två i källaren så får vi se hur den smakar då.

Enjoyed on draft at the Public House in Temecula,California. Pours a dark brown black with a frothy tan head. Smells strongly of coffee and tastes of coffee, chocolate and a touch of caramel. The finish is also of coffee and has a bitter, toasty finish.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
This beer combines flavors as vanilla, chocolate and coffe in a hamonic way. Good bet for an imperial Stout.
The perfect soundtrack for this beer would be Rufus wainwright: cigarettes and chocolate milk. Decent imperial stout. No fancy pancy - just well made stout.

Duft af kaffe og chokolade. Sort med kun meget lidt skum som er mørkgul.
Den er stærk og smager af bitter chokolade og har en sød afslutning. En rigtig god imp stout.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Good average imperial stout. Smells like teen spirit. Recommendable and a good closure beer.
Classic imp stout. Beautiful dark brown/black with small brown head with curtains. Maybe a bit too much with the licorice sweetness.

Aroma: Smelling of nuts, dried fruits, coffee and smoke, sweet peas.Appearance: A hazy black colored beer. An brown head with good lacing and good curtains.Taste: Tasting of sweet brown bread, dates, coffee liqueur and bitter chocolate with vanilla.Palate: Low carbonation, an oily and sticky texture. A big body with a little dry finish.Overall: Very much action, ABV cunningly hid.Note: Bottle 750 ml at De Klomp. Reviewed 2012-10-27.

In bottle at The Caley. A black beer with a thick tan head. An amazing aroma of chocolate milk, cacao nibs, alcohol, caramel and roasty malt. Similar flavours. Nicely bitter with a long roasty linger. Moderate carbonation and a chewy mouth-feel. Fantastic!

Bottle athome from brewdog online
Rich and boozy chocolate, smooth, warming, thick bodied, low carbonation, coffee bitterness and fruitiness on the swallow. Nice but a little too boozy to be top class

UPDATED: JUN 30, 2015 Bottle in snifter.  Very thick viscous pour.  Jet black in color with a pretty big brown head that fades quickly.  Big lacing on the glass.  Huge fresh coffee aroma to go with toasted malt and dark chocolate.  Taste is rich coffee and chocolate up front, mildly sweet.  Slight bitterness hits in the middle along with big toasty malts.  Finish adds thick caramel to the flavors.  Somewhat dry finish.  Coffee and caramel linger on the tongue for a very long time.  Big thick and chewy mouthfeel.  Very slight alcohol warming.  This is a great Imperial Stout.  Glad I finally got to try.  One of my new favorites.  Re-rate 3/21/13 - Love this stuff and want to bump it up a little.  I still feel like the nose could be just a tad better but the taste and mouthfeel are top notch.  As it warms, some tobacco and soy sauce tastes come out but theyre always balance out by fresh coffee and caramel.  Definitely one of my favorite Imperial Stouts.

Thanks to mrmiles!
A: Pours a viscous looking pitch black color. The head is massive and chocolate color, retention is excellent.

S: Coffee, chocolate, raisin, fig, slight lactose, roasted and toasted malts. Hops are also apparent. Awesome.

T: Tastes better than it smells...big bittersweet chocolate, caramel, toffee, coffee, raisin, fig, and just awesomeness. Really one of the best stouts Ive tried. Alcohol is completely masked, and only adds body and a little warming feeling.

MF/D: Very viscous, but I have seen thicker. Smooth and creamy mouthfeel from the lactose. Carbonation is right on the money. Amazingly drinkable for 12%

Notes: This is absolutely deserving of the rating. I got too excited to try this, so Ill be ISO for another one to cellar. Thanks Miles, this made my interest in stouts come alive again!

Big Beer!   Nom nom coffee over big strong full on, but smooth roast.    Love the caramel carry.  

Draft in Neighbourhood SD.

Bottle sample at a tasting at kerenmks place. Thanks kerenmk. Pours black with a brown head and lacing, aroma of roastiness, chocolate, coffee and some whiskey, flavor of coffee, chocolate, brandy, scotch, fruits, cherry and malt acidity, full bodied, great

Aroma of coffee and chocolate. Pours black with a thin light brown head. The first sip exploded with coffee and chocolate with a dark caramel and coffee aftertaste. You can detect the alcohol, but not near the 12 percent level. Best stout that I have had by far. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Nose: coffee, 
taste: plum, swee coffee, vanilla
aftertaste: alcohol,  sweet, roast, dale
 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

A black beer with a beautiful, medium and brown head. Aroma is great and enjoyable, lots of chocolate, roastiness, liquirice, salt liquirice and some coffee. Chocolate is more dominating when the beer is colder. Taste is also balanced just like aroma, lots of roastiness, salt liquirice and black coffee, body is quite sweet but slightly herbal hoppyness balancing that nicely, roastiness is more dominating in the aftertaste and together with hops taste dries, but still its not totally dry. Overally, the taste is very intensive and powerfull. Full bodied, not sticky, smooth and enjoyable to drink. The great beer with lot of everything, roastines is dominating, but still nicely balanced.
Pitch black, almost no head. Aroma chocolate, coffee. Taste dark chocolate, coffee, roasted malts. Lasting bitter aftertaste.
Had this at the 2012 Great American Beer Fest in Denver, Colorado. Has some nice chocolate/coffee notes. Similar flavor as the taste with a light sweetness.

Pours black like old motor oil with a creamy murky brown head. Smells like mocha and taste starts with strong coffee and mocha. nice velvet mouthfeel with some alcoholic perception and balanced aftertaste.

bottle shared with friends. thanks tom10101! dark murky brown, almost black, with a nice dark beige head, good retention. roastiness, some caramel, fruity roastiness, some coffee (huge? nah, at all). soft carbonation, full body, very nice bitter coffee finish. nice but disappointed.

Lives up to the hype, of course.

From notes - Snifter pour of pitch blackness with a full finger of deep khaki head.  Nose is super rich, from dark chocolate and coffee to roasted malt, espresso, mild hop, caramel and sweet toffee.  You can smell how heavy this stuff is.  Flavor is chocolate, rich, toasted oats, super heavy malt, bitter chocolate, heavy espresso, caramel, super chewy.  This stuff is motor oil, and I pretty much had to throw the glass out in the end.  Jesus...

Bottle with Carla from Beermongers. Pours thick opaque black with super dark foam. Smells earthy and of coffee with hints of sweet vanilla and chocolate. Tastes slightly herbal with lots of dark chocolate, creamy roasty malts and a touch of cofffee.

I will say incredible. Thick as maple syrup and just as tasty. Extremely balanced stout, slight alcohol burn at the end but smooths out and melds with the coffee. Really freakin' good stout!

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Sampled at SBWF11(?)
Pitch black. No head.
Loads of milky chocolate in both aroma and bitterness. Light bitterness.
Re-rates coming up soon...

UPDATED: APR 11, 2015 Bottle shared by tom10101, thanks Tommy! I thought it would be super heavy but it didnt feel like so. ABV is somewhat hidden too, which is a plus. I didnt take much notes so Ill just sum it up by saying that it is a very good stout (even for those that dont appreciate stouts as much as everyone else like me) and that you should drink this.

Updated, 2015-04-11 (bottle from 2013): Pours a really dark brown with a small beige head that leaves spotty lacing. Nose is of coffee without green peppers or ash, extremely pleasing. Taste is moderately sweet and not too boozy, full of coffee and dark chocolate. Body is full, carbonation moderate. Sticky. Bumping my score from 3.9 to 4.3, damn it is really good tonight!

Aged for 2 years. Wonderful inky color. Slightly too cold right now. But still showing a clean dark peanut shell nose with hints of Mexican chocolate. Palate is unbelievably smooth, creamy and thick. Huge dark malt hit with espresso punch mid palate. The finish is rich and chocolatey. Would be a bit more complex with warmth. I have to let this one warm up. Worth it's rating. 

---That dog will hunt!

The aroma brings cocoa, coffee beans, raisins and a touch of vanilla. Midnight black in appearance with a small tan foam at the rim. Intensely powerful overtones of earthy roasted coffee. When they said pounds of coffee, they werent kidding! Aside from the overpowering coffee flavors I can taste some molasses, cocoa, caramel, and oats. Overall, Id say the coffee flavor is almost overbearing. Putting that aside, it is still a spectacular, full-bodied beer. Very smokey and earthy with a strong alcohol presence. This is definitely one to treasure. Id give this an A+ rating.

Bottle thanks to Brett: The COMMERCIAL DESCRIPTION
is spot on. Id add the alcohol is very well masked and its very easy to drink for such a Big beer. Fantastic!

Bottle sample at a tasting at our place. Thanks to my awesome sister-in-law and brother for delivering this bottle! Pours black with a big, frothy tan head. Great roasty aroma, dry with hints of raisins and coffee beans. Dry bitter and coffee taste, full and heavy body, but still very drinkable. Roast and ash finish.
Pours dark dark black, nice tan frothy head. Coffee and wood aromas abound. Bitter, smooth. Toasty. So good. GABF 2012

Bottle: Thanx to Mr.Rask! Black colour, big brown creamy head. Aroma is dominated of dark choclate, coffee,spicy,caramelly, and a nice vanilla/brown sugar ending. Flavor had a smouth mouth feeling of caramellynes, dark choclate, vanilla, big body and a loong smokey,Liqury, burbon finish.

Draft. Blind Tiger NYC. Jet black in color. Delicious boozy coffee aroma. Super coating and rich but with a sharp balance I'm guessing from buttering hops. So much roastiness and coffee. Very nice. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bottle from the Brewdog online store. Black as Thatchers heart pour with a tan head. Heavy coffee attack in the aroma with lots of smoke, wood and chocolate. Dark chocolate, dark roast coffee and licorice flavour. Smooth as hell. Long, long coffee linger. Throat warming ecstasy. Lovely stuff!!

Rate number 1000! Bottle with friends. Black with a nice tan head. Well retained. This is a well crafted but un-dramatic Imperial stout. Its inoffensive in every respect and maybe thats why it gets such a high placing. Theres coffee and roasted malt but its just not going to match up to its status on Ratebeer. I would compare this to the experience of drinking their IPA which also rates ridiculously highly and underwhelms. Very nice but dont believe the hype.

Draught-Pours black w/ khaki head.  Great retention & lacing.  Aroma is bakers chocolate, dark roast coffee, molasses, & toffee. Taste follows suit w/ some additional sweetness & a touch of saltiness. Liqiud flourless chocolate esspresso cake. Body is full. Carbonation is light. Finish is roasty, sweet, w/ light bitterness. Very good straight forward impy stout.
Bottle, pours black with small tan head. Aroma is coffee, roasted malts, chocolate. Taste is very much coffee, chocolate, some dark fruits. Full body, very nice balance. Super tasty!

750ml bottle shared with friends at Friday night Poker night. Maybe not the most sensible time to sample this behemoth, seeing as we'd already had a skinful, but hey ho!
Wow, looks, smells, tastes amazing. Smooth as silk with massive coffee overtones hides its abv well but it's not kidding anyone. A monster of a beer. At $10.99 locally, this is a steal :)

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
