Wow, finally get a chance to try this one. Have missed out on it on every previous occasion, but this time, I picked up four bottles from SB. Three for aging and one for a completely ordinary Tuesday. Pours pitch black with a thick, large tan (yet with a reddish hue) head that leaves quite a bit of lacing. Aroma is intense. Lots of coffee, heavily roasted malt, chocolate, a bit of licorice, oak wood. Taste is wonderfully complex and rich. Opens a bit sweet, almost with a hint of vanilla, before turning into a long very gently cocoa bitter middle part, before turning towards the sweet side with port tones in the massive finish. And what a finish, it just refuses to let go of your palate - the taste stays with you forever. Very alcohol warming. Low carbonation, full bodied and sort of creamy-oily. One of the best Ive had.

700th RATING!!!  2011 750 bottle split with a friend from Portland.  Poured black with a smaller than head. Smelled of dark roasted malt, caramel sweetness, bitter chocolate, coffee, vanilla and a light hop presence. Taste was much of the same, but also resembles some dark fruit characteristics, tiny bit of a char.  This was almost a year old bottle so the coffee had started to fad a good bit.  Known alcohol but very well hidden for 12%.  Rich, silky mouthfeel.  Very nice brew.

UPDATED: MAR 28, 2013 Draft at Eulogy. Opaque black with a slim thick brown head. Big espresso flavors with alcohol billowing from the top though still with a reasonably smooth finish. A deep black hole of coffee implosion. A bit worrisome in strength but the brew is so perfected that it just keeps you from jumping into oblivion. Burned campfire marshmallows. A big dark monster, but well worth it. Update: Draft at Khyber a few weeks later. Poured with no head. Still a big boozy monster. Feels a bit juicier this time though still pitch black. Ridiculously easily drinking for 12%.

First time having this. Poured a viscous jet black. Huge coffee and mocha notes. Nice dark fruit scent as well. Taste is a very well balanced coffee bomb. Tons of chocolate espresso brand. Nice molasses taste with some sugary sweet creaminess.

So Ive tried a lot of Imperial Stouts, and frankly had gotten a little sick of them for a while, they all seem to get 100s.  There isnt one more deserving than the Speedway Stout.  Intense coffee aroma, appearance isnt anything special, taste is off the charts, with coffee, cherry, tobacco, earthy notes, oak and chocolate all coming together beautifully.  I havent tried some of the top ones like the abyss, surly darkness etc, but this is the best Ive ever had.
Great beer. Ive had it in bottle, but even better on tap. Nice dark roasted flavor. The only negative is that the alcohol flavor can sometimes come through, but overall a top beer.

Bottle. 2011 vintage drank Sep 2012.  Pours thick viscous black with some tan head and thick legs. Aroma is very rich dark malt, caramel, perfect tangy espresso, dark chocolate, a little raisin and dark fruit.  Flavor is richl full sweet with vanilla a dark roasted grains.  The mouthfeel is insanely thick and chewy.  But it isnt an overbearing beer at all.  Other than the mouthful of residual sugars its pretty clean with a spicy hop, warm, and drying end.  I love this beer and am beyond psyched it is so much more readily available now and not $30 anymore.
Very coffee like aroma.  Coffee up front.  Compex sweet flavor and finish.  Very heavy and full beer.  An amazing stout.

Bottle at Cams leaving bash. Black with a thin tan head. The aroma wasnt what I expected - mostly alcohol and chocolate and not much roast. Flavour is deep and complex with lots of chocolate, slight coffee and some dark fruit. Thick and creamy mouthfeel. A very well crafted beer.

Finally tried this beer poured from a large bottle purchased in San Diego into a small beer-tasting glass.  The beer had a thick, syrupy, viscous black body with an average-sized, creamy, dark tan had with tons of cling, great lacing and good retention.  The beer had a strong coffee hops aroma with roasty chocolate and caramel malt notes, along with a lighter earthy and grainy hops blend with touches of molasses.  Its taste had a rich malty coffee effect with a light sweetness, and a mostly-bitter after-effect with a presence of alcohol and touches of roasted chocolate and caramel.  The body had a syrupy texture and was very thick with a filling mouthfeel, low carbonation, and was quite intense and dense with a heavy body.  Great beer, shared over Colonia Nights.
Oil black. Tan head. Light tan lace. Aroma of cacao and coffee. Very hoppy, somewhat bitter. Great balance

Bottle 6 Beer tasting club - Wow what a big beer, pours almost pitch black with a brown head loads of lacing on the glass. It has a strong smoky roast malt aroma. The taste is glorious great mouth really silky, coffee, chocolate really complex. The flavour hides the 12% ABV well. Superb!

UPDATED: JUL 2, 2013 On draft. Light but pleasant aroma. Great look to this beer. Its got a great mouthfeel. Great taste: Lots of chocolate and coffee with a little smoke. No unpleasant flavors or aftertaste. This is a very crisp beer with a

Bottle at Gothenburg Beerfestival 2012 - cons 2012-09-07 Göteborg
AP: pitch black, frothy cream beige foam
AR: chocolate, come brewed coffee, vanilla, 
F: alcoholic, heavy chocolate, coffe beans, vanilla, scotlis butter fudge
From a bottle at GBF 2012. Black with beige head. Intense yet balanced coffee and chocolate aroma with a caramelly touch. Full bodied, medium carbonation. Semi dry, medium bitterness.
What a nice beer. One of the best Imperial Stouts out there. Try it with a big bowl of cheddar mac &cheese -you will not be disappointed.

750 ml bottle to oversized snifter. Looks good; pitch black with mocha head. Smells nice; malt and coffee that open up as it warms. Tastes like it smells with great balance and appropriate sweetness. Good on the palate too. Damn good beer!

UPDATED: JUN 21, 2013 On draught at City Beer. Massive semi-sweet chocolate and coffee aroma.  Opaque black with tan head that is fleeting from the alcohol. Floral hop aroma arrives late. Over the top chocolate and big bitter finish. Some burnt roast at end.

Bottle. Pours opaque black with thin, fizzy tan head; decent retention and some lacing. Aroma is roasted and caramel malts, coffee, chocolate, earthy hops, dark fruit, and light vanilla. Flavor is lots of roast malt and coffee with good dark fruit esters and light hops; chocolate/coffee bitterness for the finish. Full body and low carbonation with some warmth.

From notes: Concentrated aromatics. Aromas and flavors of soy, inky VANILLA, concentrated coffee, and turned earth. Dark concentrated fruit. Smooth, with super fine carbonation. Concentrated without being heavy or thick. 12% abv is well hidden. A quality brew. 

--- tasted while on a long journey to understand the world around me...

This was my third attempt to rate. Two previous bottles had rusted caps under the aluminum with odd tastes (olives and soy sauce)

A - pours deep opaque coffee brown with a high fluffy espresso head. Some lacing. S - coffee and deep dark chalky chocolate, toasted malts, oaky and alcohol notes. Vegetal and creamy. M - full bodied full palate. Light alcohol warming. Very strong yet bitter stout. T -  coffee and initial dark chalky oaky chocolate. Goes quickly to a bitter lightly astringent smokey chalky middle. Lingering bitter vegetal toasted malts. O - a very good strong yet bitter stout. 8-
UPDATED: NOV 23, 2012 Re-rated: HTH with Nail Clout Stout (WA). Definitely enjoyed this more. I love the balance and complexity; takes your palate on a journey.  Such an amazing stout - love it!

pours a opaque with a large foamy brown head and good lacing.

smell is of sour malt, cocoa, and fresh ground coffee.

taste is thick and creamy, abundant alcohol, bakers chocolate, espresso, and roasted malt.  ends creamy and a little bitter.  the alcohol is a little too strong and gets in the way of the flavors.

This is the best stout out there imo. The color is a beautiful as dark brown as you can git, the smell is coffee, the taste is perfect coffee, chocolate, but that after-taste is incredible! The abv is 12% which will scary the average light drinker off, but its the perfect kick for more. This isnt something you drink every weekend, this is a special occasion stout!
Poured from a 750 ml bottle into a dogfish head goblet. Wonderful aroma of licorice and roasted malt. Very dark, almost black with a tan head. Taste of coffee and chocolate. A wonderful beer.

UPDATED: JAN 24, 2013 Rerate 11/28/2012: Draft at VSK night at Blint Tiger back on 11/28/2013 with James, Streets, some others. Black pour with a "liney" brown head. Notes of dark  chocolate and coffee. Some sweetness to it. Wasnt as impressed as the first try. 3.8.

Tap @ Pony w James. Not sure how I havent rated this yet. Pours black with big dark brown head which gets lighter in color over time (or maybe its just me). Aroma is nice rich syrup, coffee, brown sugar. Similar palate with some cocoa/coffee and a bit of a slick, oily mouthfeel... very sweet brown sugary finish that doesnt linger very long. Very good, very rich. 4.3.
Stockholm Beer & Whisky Festival 2011. Black beer with no head. Coffee, vanilla, dried dark fruits, licorice, chocolate aroma. Licorice, tar, chocolate, coffeeflavour with vanilla notes.

Bottle at home, shared with Dad. Deep viscous black, thick tan head sticks around for a while. Nice super-rich nose, dark chocolate, big black espresso cafe, marmite? Roasty vanilla, totally inviting & moreish. Lovely thick chocolate and coffee up front, amazing rich vanilla, toasty bitter cocoa, caramel, lovely sweetness but not too much. Just a tiny hint of booze on a huge, rich coffee bitter finish. Yep, lives up to the hype. I will be buying more of this...

UPDATED: AUG 17, 2012 Draft at craft ale house. Pours black with an inch of tan head. Amazing head retention. Aroma is mostly mocha with some coffee and vanilla. Taste is nice and chocolaty with a good bit of coffee. The separator here is the incredible palate. This is incredible.

75cl bottle. Pours opaque black with a nice crema head. The nose has dark bitter chocolate and coffee with cream in the background. The taste has ground coffee, cream, then the coffee bitterness comes back at the end and is persistently bitter and coffee-like. The palate is big and bitter, long and bitter and Im expecting to be well over my caffeine. As it persists the coffee bitterness becomes too rich and bitter and overwhelming. As it goes on, you discover it lacks drinkability.

Bottle shared by Tom and Ben in PSBH, thank you, 9th August 2012.  Amazing thick full aroma, looks great, palate is thick and silky as you would expect, the taste is intense, liquorice, loads of coffee, leather, no sign of the 12% ABV, I had no idea.  Wacks in at my strongest beer yet

On tap at Mohawk Bend. Great goodbye beer to Cali on our last night here. You know it: it's delicious.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Aroma is molasses cake with deep, heavy roast coffee.  Coffee dominates the flavor to its detriment.  Theres an over the top, unbridled bitterness that leaves the malt to far in the background to be considered balanced.  Hefty hefty mouthfeel, get it and love it.  Love the brewery, dislike the effort.  Would be intrigued to sample the barrel aged version.  Thank you Alesmith.  2012 large format.

750ml bottle at home - 22/06/12 - all to myslef , cheers to Sam for an IP trade in Denver.
Pours black with a good dirty tan head finger.
Bitter espresso coffee on the nose with a little chocolate and a little puff of smoke.
Roasted malts hit straight away followed quickly by a wonderful coffee hit. Background notes of chocolate and perhaps vanilla.
A fairly viscous mouthfeel but good smooth fayre and carbonation spot on.
This beer delivered !!!
user_location: Hazlemere, the lower Xhitlerns, Buckinghamshire, ENGLAND

text: UPDATED: SEP 1, 2014 I can see why this is a Top 50 beer! Pours oily black with a thick brown foam. Aroma of coffee and chocolate. Coffee adds a sharp contrast to the smooth chocolate flavor. Full bodied and properly carbonated. Finish is dry with just a touch of the coffee bitterness.

UPDATED: AUG 5, 2012 Bottle pours opaque black with a tan head so foamy it looks like a marshmallow. Roast, chocolate, coffee, caramel. Very bitter with moderate sweetness. A bit acidic on the tail end. Alcohol is well hidden. Medium, creamy body, not oily like a lot of other imperial stouts. An impressive stout.

Tasted at the ale smith tasting room.  Again, just like the standard one, very good!Earlier Rating: 9/14/2005 Total Score: 4.2pitch black w/ almost no head.  big aroma of chocolate and coffee w/ notes of caramel and grapefruit.  em... rich like bill gates, very complex body. some coffee, some vanilla, chocolate and of course, alcohol.  nice.

Taken from old notes. Jet black pour with a thin brown head. Nose of coffee, chocolate and dark fruits. Taste is same followed by an exceptional finish. Well balanced and the alcohol is hidden nicely.
Had this after trying the double coffee version on cask. This one uses coffee more as a flavor enhancer. It doesnt steal the show. The carbonation helps it not be so cloying.

Pours a dark oil black with a nice mocha colored head. Aroma of chocolate, coffee, and a slight hint of vanilla. Taste is, wow, so complex and delicious. Chocolate, coffee, and a nice cleaning bitter finish.

UPDATED: JUL 22, 2016 Bottle thanks to cbkschubert. Deep black with a small but resilient brown head. Aroma of roast, licorice, wood, coffee, dark fruit, and dark chocolate. The taste is extremely rich; sweet and full of dark fruits and licorice, woody, plenty of coffee/chocolate bitterness, and a fair amount of booze. Really smooth mouthfeel, a little boozy with a slight burn, almost no carbonation, and a very full body. Nice. Though it’s not my favorite stout, I can see why many others might consider it so.

One of my favorite speedway variants.  The use of the Papua New Guinea coffee is just about perfect.  The Kopi Luawak is probably the only coffee addition Ive liked better.Earlier Rating: 10/20/2003 Total Score: 4.8The black as night body of this brew was topped by a medium thick head with a good amount of lacing left on the glass.  Slightly bitter malty aroma with notes of coffee and anise with a slight sweetness.  Slightly bitter coffee and malt flavor with a touch of anise, slight notes of alcohol and a subtle sweetness.  The finish is bitter and slightly roasty.  This is a thick full bodied brew with a creamy smoothness.

In short, this is a really, really good imperial stout. Not crazy or weird or experimental or otherwise especially fancy, nothing unexpected but just executed really damn well. It paired brilliantly with some Belgian chocolates as well.

Draught at Alesmith.  Pours black with a thin espresso head.  Aroma is dark roasted coffee.  Taste is semi-sweet with plenty of roast.  Medium bodied.  Very good, but roastier and more bitter than the original. Earlier Rating: 6/2/2010 Total Score: 4.4(750ml bottle).  Pours black with a 1" brown head.  Aroma of coffee, dark chocolate, ripe fig?, licorice, other fruit?  Taste is sour/sweet with a dry mouth feel.  Not overly dry, however; there is a good balance between dry and sweet in the finish.  Almost tastes like dried strawberries (both sweet and sour).  Very interesting.  Alcohol is hidden beautifully-absolutely cant tell its 12%.

Black color and light brown head, smells like tripple espresso and tastes like quadruple espresso. High expectations were a little disappointing because of that espresso taste but thats very personal.

Pours a pitch black with medium head. Smells like milk chocolate. Very sweet with a slight bitter aftertaste. Taste like cocoa and coffee with a nice alcohol burn. Have been waiting to have this beer and not disappointed.
Tap at the Stagshead.  After all these summer styles nice to bring it deep and dark.  Nose of coffee and chocolate.  Tastes of very intense coffee, chocolate, vanilla, light floral, and roasty.

Bottle courtesy of the father-in-law... well done Ron, well done.  Dark black pour with a nice creamy brown head. Coffee, dark roasted malt, dark chocolate on the nose . Complex chocolate, coffee, and anise flavors. Hops are nice and evenly balanced.  The finish is a roasty bitterness with some dark chocolate.  Medium carb.  So glad to finally try this.  Excellent beer, will drink again.

UPDATED: JUL 4, 2016 Bottle, november 20th 2015. Black body with a thick tanned head. Aroma of dark chocolate, herbs and coffee. Mild fruit notes. Taste of coffee, roast, vanilla and licorice, with a herbal and earthy hoppiness. Bitter finish, roasty cocoa aftertaste. A very nice beer!

Bottle @ Home. Huge thanks to Deeblo for the bottle! Pours deep brown with a thick, creamy medium tan head. Attractive. The nose is soft milk chocolate, light notes of coffee, dense roasted hazelnut chocolate and chocolate syrup. The taste is incredibly smooth milk chocolate and light coffee. The rich chocolate malt flavors are balanced out nicely by the bitterness in the coffee. Hugely oily, thick and rich. Velvety mouthfeel. I really dont think Ive had a 12% beer that drinks this smoothly. I could easily kill a 750 of this by myself. Overall, a fantastic beer. People on the west coast are charmed.

Draught at the brewery. Opaque, black liquid with small tan head. Aroma of fruity coffee, dark chocolate, biscuit, ash, licorice and raisins. Taste is light sweet and medium bitter with notes of really fresh coffee, ash. Really nice. Medium to full bodied with medium carbonation. Quite awesome.Earlier Rating: 10/14/2011 Total Score: 4.6Sample at SBWF 2011. Bottle. Black liquid with brown edges and medium tan head. Aroma of dark chocolate, coffee, piny hops, dark fruit, caramel. Lots of fresh ground, really expensive coffee. Very good balance, doesnt become too harsh from the coffee notes. Taste is light to medium sweet, light to medium bitter with lots of dark chocolate and nice coffee. Wow, what a taste. Medium to full bodied with OK carbonation and sticky mouthfeel. Extremely balanced beer with loooots of coffee, which I love.

UPDATED: MAR 4, 2013 A: Gorgeous, delicious perfection. For the style and in general one of the best looking beers Ive seen. Pours dark dark brown and sits midnight black. Huge, tight bubble, pillowy, creamy mocha head. Incredible retention and lacing. 

S: FRESH coffee jumps out and does not assault, but courts the nose - taking it on a journey through rich milk chocolate, bitter dark chocolate, roasted fresh oily espresso beans, gooey toasted caramel and very slight dark fruits. The balance is incredible.

T: Incredibly rich and perfectly balanced. 12abv!? only in granger. MIlk chocolate, incredibly fresh coffee, caramel, dark chocolate, espresso, roasted malts. 

P: Full bodied and outlandishly smooth. Frightfully drinkable. Velvet carbonation. 

O: The best coffee stout and top 3 non-BA imperial stout Ive had. A true desert beer with the coffee and chocolate intensity. It is not extraordinarily complex, missing some of the dark fruit qualities, but hey, cant have everything. Just an incredible beer, need to have one around at all times.

I am in love.  Black in color, creamy brown/cocoa creamy head.  Boozy nose that also has coffee and chocolate in it.  Toasted malts come through, but so do some caramel notes.  Heavy on the tongue.  Texture is like your favorite childhood blanket.  One of the best beers Ive ever had.
Pours a rich, coffee colored black, with zero head. Hints of smoked coffee roll down the center of the tongue, lingering for a while after the swallow. Aftertaste of hints of sour raisins and coffee.

Pours black with a creamy tan head. Smells of coffee and roasted malts. Taste is mostly coffee and bittersweet chocolate. MF is medium and super smooth. Finishes with a slight alcohol warmth and an espresso tinge. Very good beer.
Pours black with a good-sized brown head and good lacing. Aroma of coffee, chocolate and molasses. Great flavor, sweet and chocolaty, with no alcohol taste despite its 12% ABV. Excellent stout.

75cl bottle at Schouskjelleren. Pours black with a small beige head. Aroma of chocolate, roasted malt, coffee, dark fruits and a hint of licorice. Full bodied. Sweet and full bodied with lots of flavour. Very well balanced and the alcohol is pretty well hidden. Delicious beer that lasts for a long time. Excellent imperial stout.

On bottle at Schouskjellerem.
Black color, good foam.
Aromas of liqurice, coffee & vanilla
Very enjoyable

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

UPDATED: AUG 30, 2013 Draft at the alesmith tasting room with Linh. Sampled this back to back against the standard speedway stout. Pours a deep black body with thick, tan creamy head and lacing that lasts throughout. Aroma is rich coffee and dark chocolate. Mouthfeel is much smoother in this guy than the regular speedway. The flavors of coffee are so rich and creamy; also notes of chocolate, light bitter malts, and faint wood.  One of the best coffee-infused imperial stouts I can remember having in a long time. Earlier Rating: 5/18/2010 Total Score: 4.5Bottle split with pat and Tony to Tonys theme song by the pixies. Pours a pitch black body with nice small, creamy tan head. Aroma is awesome chocolate, sweet roast. Taste is delicious chocolate, malty roast, molasses, and toffee.

Finally getting around to raring this one. Pours black. Nose is heavy dark dried fruits and chocolate mixed with chocolate. Flavor is again fruit and quite roasty malts, chocolate and bitter coffee. Body is much than one would expect. Rich texture at first then quickly becomes much thinner. A little unimpressed since the mouthfeel killed it for me. Flavor was ok though.

Imperial Stout realmente espectacular. Petrolaco mortal, espuma marron oscurita, en nariz.... Aroma a cacao y café, sobre todo, con nota de fruta madura, caramelo, ah, he dicho café?. En boca es muy muy densa. realmente sedosa. Se pasa de todo en realidad y vuelve mil veces. Muy buena. Más que eso. Alesmith es increible

Pours a deep black with a little bit of brown at the neck with a thick dark tan head. Aroma has rich malt dark fruit with a little alcohol. Full body mouth feel and flavor is very robust with deep malt complexity with coffee and a strong alcohol burn. Overall this is a great imperial stout with awesome coffee and rich malt flavor... Wish I would have aged this for at least 6 months to a year to let the alcohol subside and the dark fruitiness come out.

Pours oil black with a medium brown head. Aromas of coffee, raisins, licorice, cocoa, and alcohol. Toffee and chocolate in the taste with a good amount of licorice and dark fruits coming through as well. Big time alcohol burn all the way down. Really complex and really smooth. Each sip is different from the last. Great offering.

Bottle 750ml.
Pours black with low beige head. Nice lacing. Aroma is of coffee, roasted malt, sweetness, chocolate. Taste is of coffee, cream, sweetness, roasted malt, chocolate, alchohol is incredibly well-hidden. Overall: Very intense, creamy mouthfeel. Full bodied. That beer is awesome.

UPDATED: FEB 11, 2014 Poured from bottle (750 ml): dark black with thick tan head, good lacing. Immediate smell of coffee; also chocolate. great smell. The taste is unbelievable. Smooth and creamy. Chocolate sweet, but slightly bitter. Coffee flavor. I canÃ¢â¬â¢t believe this is 12% alcohol. Overall this is a fabulous beer. Now one of my favorites. ---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Pitch black with creamy brown head and some lacing. Aroma: caramel, toffee, torrefied malts, coffee. Taste: caramel, torrefied malts, coffee, chocolate, slight vanilla, alcohol. Nice sweetness, well balanced. Alcohol is very well hidden. Creamy texture. Overall, a very impressive beer!

Bottle 750 ml. Pitch black with a medium creamy brown head and fair lacing. Aroma is quite complex with tons of chocolate, coffee, caramel, toffee, vanilla, molasses and slight roasted bitterness. Taste is the same as aroma but even more complex. Moderate to heavy sweet and medium to full body. Mouthfeel is wonderful. Smooth and creamy. Alcohol is almost completely hidden. Incredible complexity and balance make this one amazingly drinkable. This may be the best non barrel aged imperial stout Ive ever taste.

Alesmith Speedway Stout is opaque black, except for a tiny hint of brown at the top of the liquid when held up to the light. A thick beige head sits atop the blackness and leaves ample lacing in its wake. Aromas consist of bitter chocolate, coffee, and roasted malt. Upon the first sip, I notice everything in the aroma is present and accounted for, but there is also a slightly lactic, bitter note, perhaps from the coffee beans. The feel is very smooth and creamy, with an ever so slight warming burn in the finish. Great beer. The 750ml bottle is perfect for splitting a few ways.

a-Black with tan head frothy think and just as it should be, decent lacing

s-coffee, roasted malt, cocoa, vanilla and chocolate

t-dark chocolate, nice bitterness balanced with sweet roasted malt, coffee, and a hint of vanilla

M-thick lucious, velvety smooth, dense, full bodied and fantastic

O-A wonderful beer which goes down smooth and does not leave any bitter or annoying aftertaste. Have always been a fan.

Rating #1000. As of this time, this is considered the 9th greatest beer in the world by this here website. Im hoping its as good as its reputation suggests. It says its best with a little age on it, but I see no vintage or brewed on date. Pours impenetrable black with a thick dark tan head that recedes slowly, leaving some really decorative lace. The first thing to hit the nose is the roasted malts, followed by the coffee and lots of vanilla. Smells a bit like Whoppers malted milk balls. I also get a hint of leather that Im sure will come out more strongly as it sits; a little dark fruit is hiding in there, too. The taste starts out sweet before becoming quite bitter and lingering that way with a bit of tartness in the finish. The alcohol is noticeable, but it doesnt taste 12%. Licorice comes out as it warms. Velvety mouthfeel. This is realy good, but Ive had better. I wish I had a second bottle to age and I wish I knew when it was brewed. Theres no doubt this will improve with age in a big way.

Poured from 750ml bottle to tulip glass. Bottled sometime last year. Managed to break the edge off the top of the bottle and drop it into the beer. This will make for a fun scavenger hunt.

Pours about as black as it gets. That said, there is still an edge of slow beading that frames the beer. Big, swelling medium brown head that leaves a boat load of lacing. A beer couldnt look much bigger than this.

Massive nose. Rich dark chocolate notes barely suffocate a toxic bitter coffee. Divine. A dessert beer to end all dessert beers. Tons of rich roasty bits... evolving coffee, dense chocolate, raisin, brown sugar, a bit of booze is buried way beneath all the dessert notes. Yum.

The coffee has definitely taken a bitter turn. What was once fresh and aromatic has turned bitter to compliment a ton of dark chocolate. Nice. Drinking at cellar temp, there is hardly a suggestion of alcohol. Whats there is perfectly incorporated with the coffee and chocolate.

Hardly drinkable but what did you expect? Its about as easy drinking as a 12% imperial coffee stout could be (which, admittedly, isnt saying much).

A fantastic beer. What else can I say?

2011 vintage cellared for a year. Jet black with a tan head that lasts. Poured into a tulip glass, aroma is of dark roasted coffee, and the darkest chocolate you can find. So easy to drink, the bottle was finished in record time. Delicious.

Pours black, with a thick, lacy, brown head. Aroma is dark chocolate, bread, roasted malt, malt, alcohol and yeast. Very intense and big on the palate, from the start, through the middle and long into the finish. Flavor is dark chocolate, notes of burnt malt, and bitterness, which work well together. Burnt and roasted notes are not overbearing, but balanced. Flavor lingers in the finish, with a strong bitter element, but yet not harsh. Mouthfeel is smooth, velvety. Its very good, but it does push the envelope with the intensity. Very true to the style. A great sipping beer.  Definitely one to cellar for at least 3 years.

Pours dark black with a tan head. Aroma of roasty malts, coffee, chocolate and a little booziness.  Taste of roasted malts, coffee, chocolate, and just a touch of hoppiness.  A great Imperial Stout.  One of my faves.  I need to visit this brewery and have some on tap and many others.  Love Alesmith!
UPDATED: DEC 4, 2012 Very dark beer with brown head. Aroma is coffee,/ chocolate, roasted (almost burned) malts and licorice. Flavour of roasted malts, chocolate and coffee. Dry and bitter.

Pour pitch black, with a small off-white head. 
Aroma of licorice, coffee, chocolate, soy sauce, slight vanilla, slight milky- chocolatly. Bitter roasted malt. A little heat in the throat. 
Taste is sweet, with some bitter notes, and slightly salty notes as Well. Medium - full body, with a semi- flat carb.
Pours pitch black with a thick tan head. Aroma is roasted malts, coffee, chocolate and alcohol. Soft and thick flavor is roasted malts, plenty of coffee, chocolate, alcohol and some hops. Sublime.

Color is black with light brown creamy medium head. Aroma is alcohol, espresso, chocolate cake, burned sugar and roasted malts. Lovely aroma, nice! Flavor is alcohol, chocolate, fresh coffee, mud cake and syrup. Swell!
Pours black as tar with a light brown to tan head.  Aroma of coffee and bittersweet chocolate.  Tastes like it smells!.  Wonderful bittersweet chocolate notes as well as coffee.  Bitter finish.
Bottle. Excellent! Smells of coffee and then some more coffee. Pours black with thin tan head and nice lacing. Flavor is full of coffee & chocolate milkiness. Long lasting finish.

Botella de 750ml. Copa de Vino. Saboreada en jun´12. Color negro intenso y tintes negros a contraluz. Corona cremosa, beige amarronada, y persistente. Aromas de maltas torrefactas chocolate y black patent-, cacao, fruta madura, corteza de pan y toffees. Cremoso malteado torrefacto con matices de chocolate al primer sorbo seguido por un amargor ascendente que permanece hasta el final junto a una cálida sensación. Paladar pleno de sabor, cremoso y voluptuoso. Cuerpo intenso y carbonatación baja. El sabor del ABV perfectamente camuflado. Todo danza en una perfecta y equilibrada actuación. Suave y sin estridencias. ¿Asimilación?, veamos, estaba yo sólo, saboreándola,  cuando me di cuenta que apenas restaban tres dedos en la botella y, ¿que hice?...pues acabármela.
1pt 94fl.oz.bottle.  Oversized glass. Enjoyed on jun´12. Pure black & black to the light. Creamy, brownish beige in color, lasting crown. Aromas of roasted malts chocolate & black patent- cocoa, ripe fruit, bread crust & toffees. Creamy roasted malt with chocolate hues at first sip then an increasing bitterness arises & lingers into the finish with a kind warming sensation. Flavorful , creamy & voluptuous palate. Full body, soft carbonation. Black coffee on the aftertaste. ABV flavor perfectly hidden. Everything dances in a perfect balanced performance. Smooth & quiet. Drinkability? Well, I ,was by myself, enjoying it when I realized only three fingers were left on the bottle soI just finished it.

UPDATED: OCT 17, 2015 Black beer with brown medium head. chocolate and coffee in the taste and aroma. somehow still quite easy to drink with 12% alcohol.

Rerate a few years after

Coffee. Light bitterness light sweetness, chocolate and sweetness long finish. Excellent stuff but after brunch weasel feels a bit weak.

750 ml bottle. Kuopio, Finland.
Black colour with red hue and small tan head. 
Roasted malt, caramel sweetness, chocolate, coffee, vanilla and mild hops.
Roasted malt, ash, berries, some bitterness, hops, chocolatey sweetness and coffee (strong but not dominating).
Rich, full and tasty.
Alcohol very well hidden.


---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Amazingly creamy and smooth, with a great mix of caramel, coffee, chocolate and malt.

Bottle poured a dark cola with a magnificent frothy tan head that lingers long after the pour.  Huge, complex aroma includes cocoa, coffee beans, Nestle Quik, roasted nuts, and burnt caramel with new notes introduced with each sniff.  Taste is big on coffee and roasted malts followed by cookies and cream and cocoa during an extremely smooth finish.  Tremendous imperial stout with complex aroma and flavors, yet silky smooth.

Pours a jet black with lots of coffee, chocolate, and toasted malt. The flavor is strong coffee up front, with some chocolate and malt on the back end, followed by a surprising spiciness and a silky smooth body.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Bottle at bar. Black color, brown head. Strong taste with chocolate, coffee, liquorice. Burnt finish with lots of alcohol. Excellent stout!

Pours very thick and velvetty. Jet black in color. There is no foamy head though and looks flat.
Smells of rich and roasted malts with coffe and vanilla some chocolate.
Taste is rich and complex with lots of roasted malts and black coffee. Hints of bittersweet chocolate works in perfect harmony.
Thick and heavy on the palette with a velvetty smooth flow.
Quite decadent and rich. A sipper.
At 12% ABV its almost an after thought. You wont notice it until well into the aftertaste.

750ml pours dark brown/black with a medium tan head. Aroma reminds me of malted milk balls with some soy. Taste is sweet chocolate, molasses, with a slightly bitter coffee and hops hitting just right after the sweetness subsides into bitterness with a dry roasted finish. Very nice approachable Imperial Stout!

UPDATED: JUL 5, 2012 Pours black with a medium tan four finger head. Smell is light coffee, roasty, chocolate, right amount of sweetness. Taste is chocolate, coffee, roasty, grainy, creamy. A lot like Founders Breakfast Stout, but more balanced. Very well carbonated, bit of a chalky mouthfeel, but easy enough to drink. Cool that I got to try it.

I dont know what a 20 would be, but this is about a close as I have tasted. Chocolate and a little coffee on the noise. Pitch black color, not much head. Deep dark cocoa forecourt worth a hint of coffee. absolutely fantastic.
750 ml bottle purchased April 2011. Nice coffee taste, smooth but not complex. Great beer; following Dark Lord impossible.

Aroma of coffee, chocolate, slight alcohol, pours dark with thick head that is persistent through out and tons of lace taste strong coffee, espresso, sweet alcoholic, chocolate some bitterness, lots going on with this one this is big in every way. full body, thick somewhat sticky dry with dry coffee finish at 12% this one grabs you and hangs on, great stout! find it and try it.

Shared by someone at the Montes Krown tasting yesterday.  Pours a very deep black, solid, just a hint of red around the edges of the glass when held directly up against a lightbulb.  2 finger tan head.  Notes off coffee, roast, chocolate milkshake in the nose.  Taste is hoppy, coffee, chocolate.  Very good.

Pours a dark black with a thinning brown head and aroma of coffee and espresso. Taste is sweet and strong, of roasted malt, coffee, liquorice, alcohol, and chocolate with a heavy mouthful throughout and a slight bitter finish. Strong, flavorful brew from AleSmith.

Pours black as night with a small mocha head. Appearance is stunning! 
Nose wafts of coffee and some chocolate malt. Taste is nothing but flavor, with strong coffee, espresso and slight licorice. Taste is also sweet with some bitterness that gives away. Finish is dry and sweet , a wonderful stout. 
Dont leave home without one in your frig. Amazing Imperial Stout, Quaff Score 9 / 10

UPDATED: JUN 16, 2012 Shared 750 ml bottle @ Cosmic Comic Cafe. Pours black, no tinges, with a huge, thick, mocha-colored head. Gorgeous. Aroma is heavy with coffee and roasted malts. Some dark fruits and hints of salty liquorice. Taste is quite sweet with a lot of roasted malt, quite a bit of bitter, dark chocolate, lots of coffee. Aftertaste has dark fruits as well. Palate is surprisingly just medium, not much carbonation.

Poors dark nice brown head.  Taste is of coffee, chocolate, caramel.  The taste is not overbearing like some other coffee stouts.  This is very drinkable and not bitter.  It is smooth and does not have much of an after taste.  The alchohol is present but not harsh at all.  This is an amazing stout.  Wish I could get this more readily in the midwest.
Pours black with nice amount of  brownish head. Aroma is roasty, lots of coffee. full body, creamy, average carbonation. Really great beer.
Pours dark brown with a medium head. Aroma roasted malts, coffee, nuts. Strong full body with an oily texture. Not Bad.

750 ml bottle @ OConnells, Tampere.
Pours a pitch black colour with a beige head. High viscosity. Looks beautiful. Strong aroma of roasted malts, strong dark chocolate, licorice and some tar with syrupy sweetness. Flavour is strong as well with notes of roasted coffee, roasted malts, dark chocolate, tar, raisins and plums. Full bodied, thick and smooth mouthfeel. Finishes warming, roasty, dry, vinous and mellow fruity finish. Some bitterness after a while. Truly a treat as this is so complex and packed with flavour. Top 10. Im glad to have a bottle in my cellar.

75 cl bottle @ OConnels, Tampere.
Originally rated on 20100721.
Pours pitch black color with medium-sized beige head. Aroma of dark roasted malts, dry dark chocolate notes, some dried fruit notes and mild peat and hints of vanilla. Flavour of tasted malts, very dry ashy chocolate and cocoa, mild dark dried fruit notes, mild coffee and some caramel and vanilla hints. Some mild liquorice notes present themselves as the nectar warms up a bit. Very dry chocolaty and mild creamy palate with a long, dry fruity and chocolaty finish. Excellent.
4428
Bottle. Color black with large white head. Aroma malt, malt, caramel, chocolate, alcohol, coffee. Taste sweet, coffee, bitter, chocolate, vanilla, alcohol, hop.

Draught.
Pitch black, brown head.
Solid aroma, malt, coffee, leather, dark chocolate, licorice, hops, ashes.
Sweet, full bodied, high bitterness, creamy CO2.
Rich, complex taste, roasted malt, chocolate, coffee beans, tobacco, tar, smoke, mint, leather. Yummy! (2012-05-05)

Bottle via the local bottle shop. Pours jet black. Aroma, coffee, coffee, coffee. Taste, more coffee and some sweet malt and toffee. Odd. Overall, a coffee stout Im sure would be my thing if I liked coffee or stout.
user_location: Morro Bay via Orange County, California, USA

text: Heavy duty, relentless stout.  Rich dense head.  Shouts coffee with sweet caramel notes.  The finish feels a bit hoppy but in truth it could be high alcohol thats giving off that bite.  For such a powerful punch though, it doesnt linger.  Thats a good thing.  Overall a great example in imperial stout.  Cheers!

Bottle.  Motor oil black (at least my oil) with lot of head.  I believe this is a fresh bottle.  Taste punch you in the face with coffee, chocolate, coffee, malt, coffee, and some bitterness. Oh and coffee.  Very nice and Im glad I can get this off the shelf

Pours jet black with a brown head. Smells like dark roasted coffee, toasty malts, and a bit of tawny. Taste is big and dark, with notes of raw dark chocolate, coffee, caramel and alcohol. The alcohol is pretty hidden among the other big flavors. Full bodied with a very smooth texture. Soft carbonation. After taste is dark, warm, bitter, toasty and has some hops. Great stuff.

Very dark with a nice, foamy light brown head. So smooth and thick with a roasty malt, hint of dark chocolate, and coffee. Toasty and ever so slightly sweet. Full and thick, but not too heavy. Still, not one that could be imbibed quickly.

Heavy, thick, robust coffee flavor, smooth, pours dark brown, really hard to say anything beyond this being a model imperial. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Roasty, marshmalloyw aroma with a bit of light brown head on a dark brown beer. Taste is coffee and alcohol is well hidden. Very drinkable, even as it warms. $6/10oz

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Very strong coffee flavor. Did not taste like 12%. Would rather it was more beery and less coffeey. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bottle received in a trade with fatboyjim1 in a trade awhile ago. Thanks, Jim! 

Have had this one cellared for about a half a year. Poured into a snifter. Not sure the vintage of this as there is no stamp on the bottle. 

Pours a jet black; allows no light to penetrate. Starts off with a huge creamy mocha head on top. Good retention; left some nice lace on the glass. Scents of roasted malts and chocolate. A bit of drying scent in there, not sure what that is specifically. 

Decent body on this beer. A tad crisp, but it still retains some creamy smoothness that I like in this style. Alcohol is pretty well hidden in this beer. Its not noticeable in the flavor at all. Doesnt taste "hot." This is a really bland Imp. Stout. Flavors of some mild cocoa, and finishes really charred and burnt. There is no sweet balance in this beer at all. Theres some hops there, but this is too roasted and grating. Unbalanced and unpleasant. Sorry, Jim, but this beer fell short for me.
Pours pitch black with a small dark tan head. Aroma of coffee, roast and chocolate. Taste of roasted coffee, and dark chocolate. Nice alcohol burn as it goes down. Full body.

Got to share this with a friend who traded for it.... Pours rich thick and black.  Smells of coffee, chocolate and a sweet boozy undertone.  Same with the flavors, BIG, BOLD & DARK.  I really liked it but it didnt register off the charts for myself...

I mean- good lord. This is black with a fluffy tan head. Amazing nose with plenty of coffee bean, but some sesame oil and umami aromatics as well. Full bodied with a lucscious mouthfeel. More roasted coffee and Asian spice on the palate. Dry finish. Out of this world beer.

UPDATED: JUL 8, 2012 Tried this a handful of times but today is the day I shall actually sit my ass down and rate this behemoth, Ha!  Poured an extreme ruby-tinted darkish brown, and yes: Im not absolutely convinced this baby is full-on black; but what the color or hue of this beer, it certainly should be classified as "dark". Exploded into my snifter: viscous, lacy, and massively thick. Looks great, if not phenomenal! On the nose I get... wow: bourbon whiskey alcohols, burnt coffee beans and a little vanilla. As it warms in the glass I got more booze then coffee; when first poured it was a straight-up, undeniable COFFEE BOMB on the olfactory of mine. Tastes are of... damn, this fucking good: caramelized raisins (when just poured and after leaving it to warm up a bit), tannins (strange, but this is what I got), roasted malts, Californian hop bitterness (not so much after I let it warm), Candi sugar, and of course coffee, a shit ton, and of really good quality and maintenance. Overall: fuck yeah, a great beer. Hell, I probably underrated this; I may have to re-rate this in the future, but, damn, AleSmith, keep it up! I forgot how good this particular Impy Stout was from you guys!
Bottled. Poured dark and viscous, tannish head.  Coffee and roasted malts aroma, similar taste and nice bitter chocolate finish. Outstanding in all aspects.

Black color with a light brown small head. Aroma is roasted malt, chocolate, coffee, vanilla, alcohol. Flavor is bitterswwet,coffee & chocolate. Full body, texture is oily, carbonation soft, finish is bitter with long duration. Great beer..
Bottle. Beautiful opaque black, tan head. Huge roasted malts, dark chocolate, coffee, all swelling up fiercely. No carbonation, thick, oily, like velvet. Unbelievable balance. A standard setter.

Pitch black with a massive light brown head that disappears fairly quickly. A beer with huge flavors of coffee, chocolate, peat, leather, soil, raisins and a light acidity. A velvet mouthfeel with almost no carbonation. Altogether a very nice beer that got all the features Im after in an imperial stout.

Bottle.  Pours a deep black, with a medium brown head.  Fairly mild aroma of coffee and vanilla.  The flavor is much more complex - coffee dominates the palate, but gives way to flavors of chocolate and vanilla, followed by alcohol and dark fruits.  At first, it seems a bit overpowering with coffee, but becomes more well-balanced as it warms up.  An excellent imperial stout if you like coffee.

Finally got to this one...aged about a year.  Pours dark, almost no carbonation, no head.  Very dark, opaque.  Nose is roasty malt and coffee.  Palate is huge coffee, chocolate, very thick and very smooth.  Finish lingers and is slightly bitter, but most of the hops were gone in this one.  Very rich and satisfying.

750ml bottle. WOW! Pours black with a bubbly tan head. Taste off strong coffee, dark chocolate, and malt. Tremendous velvety mouth feel combined with a lasting finish. Incredibly crafted imperial stout!!

Black beer with a short tan/brown head less than a quarter inch. Aroma strongly of coffee, and dark chocolate .Sweet start with coffee spice. Chocolate notes on the finish. A nice big stout with some bold flavor.

Pour is pitch black with no light getting through at all, topped off by a nice khaki head. Huge amounts of coffee and milk chocolate in the aroma with just a hint of alcohol. The taste has a nice bitterness from the coffee beans, balanced really well with the sweetness of the chocolate. You pick up absolutely none of the alcohol until youre done and attempt to stand up. This is so luxurious, silky and smooth.

Bottle.  Pours a thick black with a chocolatey head that lingers for quite awhile.  The flavor is malty sweet with chocolate favors and a mild alcohol flavor.  An excellent stout and pretty good beer.

Pours a dark black with a few fingers worth of head. Smells like fresh pressed coffee and malty. Taste is of coffee and malt along with a clean rich chocolate. It is also really sweet. Very nice RIS but the Barrel aged version just knocked this out of the park

750mL bottle and on tap, one of my 3 or so favorite stouts that Ive had. Rich coffee flavor on the front end with a nice mellow chocolatey and molasses finish that leaves you wanting more! A must have.
UPDATED: MAR 15, 2013 Cerveza negra de baja de carbonatación. Aroma de chocolate café y caramelo. Sabor a cafe tostado y chocolate negro.

Bottle. Pours a Dark brown almost black with a small tan head. The aroma is a light roast and vanilla. Medium mouthfeel with a sweet roast and chocolate with good dry finish. Wow really enjoyed this Imperial stout from Alesmith.
Draft, by far the best non-barrel aged stout Ive tried.  Black thick syrupy pour.  Coffee, chocolate and roast aroma.  perfectly balance coffee, sweetness, and a bit of vanilla.  Well hidden ABV.
Pours a deep dark brown with almost no head. Aroma of coffee and chocolate. Taste is Toffee creamy. Hints of coffee. Commercial description is accurate. Very nice stout!

Pours a dark brown/opaque black with a tiny thin tan head that doesnt last long.  The aroma is coffee, milk chocolate, and roasted malts.  The taste is rich dark malts, coffee, chocolate, semi-sweet.  Nice smooth velvety mouthfeel.  Great imperial stout.

Pours transparent black. small dark tan head, decent retention with good lacing.  Aroma \is light overall, some roast and chocolate, some sweetness.  Flavour is licorice notes, roast, strong cofee flavour with molasses in the finish.  Finishes fairly balanced between roast and sweetness, alcohol well hidden.  Light carbonation with thick coating mouth feel.

Rich dark brown/black color; Heavy creamy body; Aroma of toasted malt, rich coffee, & chocolate; Flavor of roasted sweet malt, caramel, rich espresso, dark bittersweet chocolate, mocha, hops, vanilla, and some licorice; Finish is slightly bitter; Very nicely balanced & complex; The alcohol is fairly well hidden; Overall, one of the gold standards - excellent stout!
Bottle pours a black with small head. Tastes smells of chocolate, coffee, roasty, alcohol, light sweetness, very bitter, full body, slick feel, Nice beer lots of chocolate coffee taste pretty good.

Wow.  Great beer.  Pours jet black with very little head.  Aroma is very nice...chocolate, coffee, and licorice.  Taste of cocao, coffee, alcohol, and a very slight tang.  Palate is perfect and dances moderately on the tongue.  One of my favorate beers!

Tasted from magnum bottle into tulip glass, thanks ibrew2or3! In every way, a true-to-style and perfectly harmonious Imperial Coffee Stout, which is revered as perhaps the greatest style of all beers. In that sense, Speedway Stout is a near-perfect brew, deserving of its impossibly high ratings. But in another sense, there are a hundred ways to improve upon it by simply accentuating one or more aspects. While drinking it, Joe said, "drinkable and well-balanced, its like the Bud Light of Imperial Stouts." I hate to admit it (and I know many raters will hear that as sacrilege) but I see his point. I cant point out a single flaw, but that could be said about the Sam Adams Imperial Stout, too, which is available at every grocery store (I realize of course, that one doesnt contain coffee.) This was nonetheless delicious, I was thrilled to finally try it, and I look forward to the next chance.

Nose is all coffee and a little alcohol.  Taste is coffee and chocolate.  Bold, what I look for in an Imperial Stout. An excellent representation of the style.  Been wanting to try this for a while and glad I did.

UPDATED: DEC 25, 2015 10/25/2015..Tasted again at monster of beer at elijahs ps...such an awesone beer!......prior rating 3/3/2012:  Lots of coffee and chocolate aroma.  Great tan frothy head.   Definitely has alcohol in it.  Thanks Seymour.

750 ml bottle with silver foil into snifter; no bottle date, but I picked this up last fall.  Pours viscous pitch black color with a nice thick and creamy 1 finger tan head with great retention that reduces to a nice cap that lasts.  Some spotty soapy lacing on the glass.  Aromas of big dark chocolate, coffee, roasted malt, toast, caramel, molasses, biscuit, herbal spiciness, smoke, and earthiness.  Amazing aromas with great balance and strength.  Taste of huge dark roasted chocolate, coffee, black roasted malt, caramel, toast, molasses, biscuit, smoke, earthiness, vanilla, and herbal spice.  Very light amount of spicy bitterness on the finish; with lingering notes of big dark chocolate, coffee, dark roasted malt, caramel, vanilla, molasses, and biscuit on the finish for a while.  Medium carbonation and very full bodied; with a very creamy, slick, and thick mouthfeel.  Alcohol is pretty much invisible considering the 12%, with only a faint warming well after the finish present.  Overall this is an absolutely mind blowing imperial stout brewed with coffee.  Big and lush flavors; with great balance and no booziness at all considering the alcohol level.

750ml bottle. Pours a jet black color with a big tan head. Aroma is roasty, coffee, lots of coffee. A little heavy on the palate with light, soft carbonation. Flavor is bitter, coffee, chocolate, a little smokey, with a nice bitter coffee finish. Excellent.

From notes.  First reviewed 2/14/2011.  Poured from a 750 mL bottle into a pint glass. 2010 vintage.

In the glass this has a nearly black color with dark walnut edges. A nice creamy brown head rests on top. A big, frothy monster, the head lingers around but does not deliver any lace.

Tons of coffee, dark roasted malt, a little lactose, and pure dark chocolate all coexist in the aroma.

Roasted malt turns to a coffee flavor. Very quickly my mouth becomes overwhelmed with the quality and depth of the flavors. Roasted coffee becomes smooth creamy dark chocolate and espresso. These flavors leave just enough room for a bit of spicy hops to sneak through at the end. The finish is a roasty bitterness with some dark chocolate.

There is no doubt this is a full-bodied imperial stout. Extraordinarily creamy, with medium carbonation. 

This is a smooth, dark chocolate and roast coffee treat.

I have had this beer fresh and aged and it is great both ways.  Coffee in in front when young and takes a back seat when aged. In my book is this one of the best imperial stouts. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Rating 1000!! 750 ml bottle from Julios liquors for $14.99. Vintage is 2011, so it is young and taken into account. Slow poor shows nice full, thick beige head that dissipated slowly, leaving a generous amount of lace. Nice nose of Bakers chocolate, coffee and dark fruit. Mouthfeel / texture is very smooth like velvet and creamy. The body is full and thick, damn! Complex blend of every flavor you look for in a stout. Coffee notes show up during the entire sip. Excellent long-lasting roasted chocolate malt aftertaste. The 12 % only makes is presence known after I was into my second snifter. This would age magnificently, Id love to re-visit this with a few years of age behind it. World class stout.

Bottle. From November 2011 notes. Dark roasted malt, molasses, coffee, dark fruit. Black brown with a moderate tan head, some lacing. Sweet malty, dark fruit, coffee flavor, ash, anise flavor. Medium body.

Bottle thanks to my friend Andy in San Diego.  I waited a year to try this one, kept it in the back of a cool closet.  Wow, was it ever worth it.  Pours jet black with a mocha colored head that lingered.  Aroma - wow, lots of coffee, chocolate.  Not too much alcohol.  Taste was like a party in my mouth.  So smooth, great lasting flavor.  Tons of coffee, roasted malts.  Very, very smooth.  I loved this, glad I got to share it with some friends.  Wish I had another bottle.

Oozes out of the bottle with an oily blackness impenetrable to light. Finely beaded brown head. Dark roast coffee wafts from the glass. Thick and rich on the palate with smooth but obvious alcohol. Theres quite a bit of fruity malt before the long dry finish. Plums in the middle, prunes in the end. Overall, awesome.

Pours the usual jet black w a very small tan almost reddich looking head. A chocolate and coffee aroma, slight rasberry itseems. The taste of this is amazing, smooth, very filling. A very roasty coffee taste with hints of chocolate. An amazing beer.

8 oz draft. Pitch black with a nice brown head almost like crema on espresso. Aroma is strong coffee with an alcoholic heat. Taste is coffee and roasted malts with a warming boozy note. Aggressive stout.

Bottle @ RBBWG thanks to Klaas. Black coloured beer with a rather small brown head. Heavy alcoholic roasted malty and coffee hinted aroma. Full palate. Finish is roasted malty again rather alcoholic wharming with some creamy coffee roasted hints. Very nice one.

UPDATED: DEC 30, 2013 Cellared 9 months.  Gorgeous black pour, a thumbs worth of khaki head that laced in large gobs all the way down.  Aroma of coffee, dark chocolate, roasted malt, dark caramel toffee, Very slight hint of cream.  Liquid heaven - High-quality imported coffee and milk with dark chocolate, molasses, roasted malt, slight hint of vanilla.  Lovely lingering espresso aftertaste and not a hint of alcohol to be detected.  Thick creamy mouthfeel, slight sourness.  Worth every penny of the 16 bucks i paid for it in the fall.

UPDATED: FEB 10, 2013 750 ml bottle sampled @ RBWG 2012  thx to Klaas  dark, dark, dark black with a mocha head, smell is lots of chocolate & coffee, slight roasted malts & booze, taste continuous in line, slight molasses sweetness, lots of cocoa, chocolate, coffee, touch roasted malts, hint espresso, aftertaste is bitter part hops with a touch of roasted malts & coffee bitterness, alcoholic in the aftertaste but not harshly, full, nicely creamy with low carb, slick //// good but quite overrated it seams, I like the Brewdog "clone" Coffee & Chocolate way more honnestly
Such a rich flavor of coffee.  Smooth flavor.  Another grrrrrrrrrrreat San Diego beer.
bottle thanks mom! pours jetttttt black with tear jerking tan head. aroma of coffee tons dark chocolate. tastes is like angel tears!

Do not try to drink one of these 750s by yourself.  Bad idea.  This beer is beyond massive.  It pours pitch freaking black with a thick brown head, textbook.  Aroma is COFFEE!!!!! and some bitter chocolate.  Taste is COFFEE!!!  But its really good, complex, acidic coffee.  Then the smooth chocolatey notes come in and the massive body of the beer is revealed.  Then it finishes with more light roasted coffee notes.  Excellent imperial stout.  But I prefer them barrel aged when theyre this strong.

This was awesome!  Thanks Secret Santa!  The smoothest imp stout Ive had to date, and Ive had tons.  Taste is in line with the usual IS suspects.  coffee, chocolate.  Very abrupt for such a big beer, this one is hyped for a reason.

RBAG 2012. Pours totally black with a brown head. Very strong coffee and malt aroma. The flavor is very chocolatey and coffeesque with a little malt but not too much. Leaves a smooth taste in your mouth that has you longing for another sip. As it warms the alcohol becomes more pronounced and the malt stands out.

thick black viscous pour, with minimal caramel head. Extremely smooth to drink, tons of great balanced coffee and chocolate. As the beer warms, the finishing notes of strong coffee and dark chocolate become more pronounced

Pour is jet black with little to no head of a khaki color. Nose is of some faint coffee and cocoa smell, rather hard to pick apart the individual tones of it. The taste is very coffee centric, however not too bitter. Very nice mouthfeel, Other than that its just hard tp dexcribe as other than a very good beer.

Very very dark brown, with some medium brown foam. Aroma of coffee, roasted malts, and some fig-like fruits. Taste is coffee, roasted malts, bittersweet chocolate, and caramel. Feels thick like cream in the mouth. You can notice an alcohol burn, but the coffee finish smooths over it nicely. Great stuff.

RBAG. From 750ml brown bottle.  Black pour. Oily thick appearance. Beige head, creamy. Coffee nose, some notes of chocolate and roast. Taste is coffeeish and choclatey, roasty bitterness. Really smooth, does not Drink its strength.

Large bottle. Pours dark brown with a tan head and decent lacing. Perhaps the best coffee stout I have had. It is like drinking iced expresso. Also notes dark chocolate and licorice. High alcohol content is hidden but its there, trust me.

On tap.  Pitch black pour with basically no head.  Nose is a big slap of coffee, with roasted malts, and chocolate.  Taste was also big on coffee but some the malty sweetness came through and really balanced this out.  I was expecting an overdose of coffee and got something much more balanced.  Great brew.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Bottle from pangea. Color is pitch black. Chocalate milk head. Smells an taste like exspresso.

750 bottle.  Pours black with a minimal rust colored head. Huge bubbles. Aroma is coffee overload with dark chocolate. Taste is bitter sweet dark chocolate with more coffee grounds. This is one of the best coffee stouts Ive had and it really does hide the 12% abv . The palate is just a little lacking. Expected more silky velvety and thicker body. Its a little watery on the palate. Finish recovers with a nice dry coffee grounds explosion. Good stuff but I feel a little let down.

14/I/2012 1Pt. 9.4Fl. Oz. bottle @ RBBWG 2012 - BB: n/a (2012-46) Thanks to Klaas for bringing the bottle!
Very dark brown to black beer, no head whatsoever. Aroma: coffee, mocha, dark chocolate, burnt caramel. MF: no carbon, full body. Taste: mocha, coffee, bourbon, vanilla, some cocoa powder, potent alcohol. Aftertaste: mocha, some hop bitterness, dark chocolate.

Tulip pour. Nose is loaded with notes of sweet coffee and chocolate with some vanilla and caramel in the background. Nice and complex aroma that had a lot much more to offer than just coffee. Pour was motor oil pour with a dark brown head. Taste was sweet! Literally and figuratively. Balanced with many different flavors, notably lots of coffee, dark chocolate, cocoa, caramel, vanilla and some sweet candy notes. Very balanced and drinkable with no real evident alcohol. Exceptionally well made beer. Now to find the BA version...

UPDATED: APR 19, 2013 Bottle share with OmegaX - thanks! This particular stout had a black body and a pretty dark head as well. Aromas were mellow and thick, lots of cocoa and coffee with some caramel and hops. The taste wasnt in-your-face bitter, but rather complex. Layers of sweet malts and roasted undertones create the perfect balance of a high ABV stout. Truly a fantastic beer!

Finally. Bought this 75 cl bottle at the end of 2009 in Pasadena, kept it for a little over 2 years in my "cellar". Pitch black color. light brown rocky head that slowly recedes. Lots of roast boasts out of the glass, coffee, chocolate, molasses, berries. Flavor is lightly sweet with again lots of roast, coffee-ish. Alcohol is pretty well hidden, although the throat warms. Not cloying either. Finishes with more roast, ash and some bitterness. Delicious.

Velvety smooth, perfect lace, espresso aroma...Ahhhhhhh this is truly one of the greatest stouts I have ever poured down my gullet. 12% ABV, this pitch black stout is an absolute triumph.  It states on the label that the Speedway should be stored at room temp, and only refrigerated at the time of consumption - we had ours sitting in the garage at wintertime (Bend, Oregon) so it was slightly chilled and it was perfect. Prost!

Received in trade with P1meatloaf
What a treat! I have been wanting the beer for quite some time.
Pours very dark black with a nice dark brown head that lingers.
Smells strongly of coffee, dark chocolate, and roasted malts,
Taste is very similar to the smell, strong coffee with just more than a touch of chocolate with amazing layers of depth and complexity.
The mouthfeel is really amazing. It is thick, yet also maintains a creaminess and velvetiness that it unreal.
This beer is dangerously drinkable for being 12%
Overall an absolutely fantastic beer.
Incredible! Coffee and chocolate are amazing in the aroma. Balanced, strong and beautiful. Best widely distributed beer in my opinion.

As advertised.  Very smooth for 12%, and pronounced coffee, but not syrupy.  Personnally, I can only do one of these... But a very solid beer and worth a try.  Makes me want to try it side by side with bells expedition stout... Similar in some regards, but I think bells was a bit more earthy and creamy and smoky, this was more coffee and caramel.
It is in the top 3 of the best beer Ive ever taste. Please if u have the occasion taste it

I eagerly anticipated the arrival of this gem. Not available in Ireland, to the best of my knowledge. Speedway pours be black as night with a beautiful biscuit brown head and great lacing. Chocolate, coffee, fruit, roasted malts and caramel fill the nostrils. Wow!!! All come through on the palate. Beautifully silky mouthfeel. I cant get over how amazing this is.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

750 ml bottle, shared. Super-black color, looked like straight oil coming out of the bottle. Very little head, but the little that appears with a more vigorous pour is a nice brown color, leaving a decent amount of lace, relatively. Huge thick body, very big, awesome texture. Nice bitter taste, with a hint of alcohol. Less than youd expect from a 12% brew, though. Nice, chocolate-y syrupy aroma, with some bitter roasty coffee aroma. Very good... Im sure aging this would be very interesting.

24-12-11 Bouteille 750ml: Coueleur noire, légère effervescence et petit collet de mousse. Je crois que je mattendais, avec raison, à beaucoup trop de cette bière, car elle ma déçu de beaucoup. Imperial stout avec une très bonne drinkability, mais qui napporte rien de spécial. Très bien balancé avec des notes de café et de chocolat. Corps léger et volatile en bouche.

Tasting in Athens, Nov.09. Bottle from a trade with Edo. Thanks man ! Pitch black with dark brown head. Very roasted aromas. Malt, chocolate, coffee, caramel, vanilla, licorice. Thick mouthfeel. Great flavors, chocolate, lots of coffee, slightly vinous, raisins , dried fruit. Lovely.

Huge black oil pour, finely bubbled brown head, fades to a ring but a quick swirl will reactivate head.  Aroma is molasses, charred coffee beans, mocha, smoke, leather.  Taste is boozy coffee, some salt, brownies, soy sauce, hint of vanilla, leather.  Body is full yet bouyant, silky, very low carbonation, long bitter roasty finish.  Overall, pretty crazy and certainly lives up to its reputation.

750ml bottle thanks to I dont remember who. Bottle was about 1 year and a half old.
Appearance : Pitch black with small head.

Aroma :  Roasted malt with great hops and coffee. Light chocolate and light fruits.

Taste : Great coffee with roasted malt. Light alcohol. Nice fruits with great dark chocolate. Nice hops. Finish is very rich and amazingly complex, nice hops, nice malt not very sweet but quite rich. Long finish. Alcohol well hidden. Soft carbonation, great palate.

Overall : Wow this is truly an amazing beer. Very complex and big but still elegant and well balanced. Great coffee notes with great hops. Not that much hops though (less than Darkness for example). I really loved the persistent finish.

Shared 750ml bottle. No offense, but as much as I liked this one, I found that I was shockingly underwhelmed compared to what the hype surrounding this particular brew - better, cheaper, easier to find Impys around where I live. Solid mocha, coffee notes, chocolate, hops. Creamy notes, roasted malts, hops.

Pitch black colour, tan head. Aroma of roasted malts, coffee, loads of coffee, light chocolate. Flavour malty sweet, coffee bitter, roasted malts, bitter chocolate, coffee. Finish roasted malts and coffee, slight sweetness, quite a bit of alcohol. Quite a beast. Very nice, though somewhat unbalanced, a bit of a one trick pony.
(From 750mL bottle, shared with friends)

75cl bottle. Pours black with a tan head. Smells of coffee and chocolate. Tastes if creamy semibitter chocolate and roasted coffee. As it warms up, the alcohol becomes more present with a mild tartness. Texture is creamy. Full bodied. Finishes dry. A superb offering.
Sharks have a week dedicated to this beer...This could be the blueprint for all RISs...
Dark, roasty, chocolate, coffee, some dark berries. Wonderful brown head on top of a pitch black brew. Absolutely wonderful imperial stout.

2011 vintage.  750ml into a bottle.  Pours a deep black with a touch of brown head that never quite disappears.  Little to no lacing.  Rip roaring aroma of hops, booze and coffee.  Mouthfeel is sublime.  Thick and carbonated but not fizzy at all.  Got a nice bite to it, probably due to the big ass alcohol content.  Taste is pure roasty coffee.   Also has a good amount of hops.  Molasses, booze (but not an overly large amount), some yeasty character, mint and lets just throw in a little more coffee to round things out.  Damn, I was told this was an awesome beer, but it really lived up to the hype.  Im super glad I bought an extra bottle.  I may have a hard time cellaring it for too long though!

Bottle, pours a thick  impenetrable blackness with medium sized brown head.  Aroma is sweet malts, coffee, chocolate, and alcohol. Taste medium sweetness, medium bitterness, medium sourness. A very nice balanced big  Imperial stout, which still manages to be both bold but smooth.

UPDATED: OCT 6, 2012 Very fresh bottle.  Black with a thin to medium brown head.  Aroma of coffee, roasted/burnt malts, alcohol, and wood.  Flavor is sweet, loads of coffee, malt, and some chocolate as well.  A really nice coffee bitterness on the finish.  Full bodied, very smooth.

UPDATED: DEC 12, 2011 12/17/2008 Getting notebook online. Draft at Stone. Pours a midnight black with a brown head. Delicious roasted coffee flavor and aromas. Dark chocolate and caramel flavors add to the flavor beautifully. Mouth is smooth and clean. Very easy drink! I can not wait to try again!

Resampled some 2003 (11/7/09) at the SDBGF on tap. It was awesome having this slightly after having the 2003 BA version. This beer aged beautifully. The flavors popped with wonderful dark chocolate, rich roasted coffee, smooth roasted malts. The mouth is rich and creamy and wonderfully smooth. Outstanding beer!!!

My Ratebeer score reflects the regular speedway edition. Below are my ratings for aliased versions.

AleSmith Finca San Gabriel Bourbon Coffee Speedway
Earlier Rating: 11/6/2010 Total Score: 4.5
Served on tap at OBriens Night of a Million Zillion Speedways 2010. Was able to get two samples. The appearance is the usual Speedway deep black hue with a medium roasty brown head. The aromas are strong with a medium roast medium bodied Central American coffee, very fresh aromas with an oily character to it. Some vanilla and nutty aromas too. The flavors are strong with that medium bodied fresh roasted coffee, essential oils, some light wood flavors a rich fabulous pure coffee flavor. Some nutty flavors and a touch of chocolate too. Very smooth and easy to drink brew, more laid back in intensity and incredibly well balanced.  Again another fantastic brew I hope they continue to make.

AleSmith Dry Hopped Speedway Stout
Appearance 4 Aroma 8 Mouthfeel 4 Flavor 7 Overall 17
Served on tap at OBriens Night of a Million Zillion Speedways 2011. The appearance is the usual Speedway deep black hue with a medium roasty brown head. The aromas are rich roasted malts, bold roast coffee, and wonderful herbal and earthy hops. The flavors start out with the malty, coffee, and dark chocolate that is Speedway with a very nice addition of earthy hops. As the hops grow they taste more herbal and reminiscent of herbal tea. A coffee tea combo is pretty cool. The beer does become a bit astringent. I really liked this one but not sure if the astringent flavors would overpower if you drank even more.

One hell of a beer. Pours a viscous black with a lasting tan foam. Aroma is dominated by dark roasted coffees and luxury chocolates, but there is also a hefty hop presence in the background. Flavor is dominated by the coffee and chocolate flavors. Sounds trivial for a stout description, but this stout actually delivers those flavors 100%. Thick creamy body. One of the best imperial stouts out there and probably the best you can get year-round. Amazing beer.

This is a great coffee like stout. The head pours a nice rich dark down that trickles down the snifter. Very sexy oil like pour which smells of a deep, dark, molasses and coffee. Unlike a stout such as the Black Tuesday, this guy has more of a strong coffee sugary body vs the chocolate body. Either way a great beer. 2011 vintage.

Poured black like motor oil with a very thin tan head.   Very interesting aroma with chocolate and coffee.  Alcohol is slightly noticeable. Some vanilla and scotch too.   Aroma is very nice and unique.  Taste is like drinking coffee beans.  Very roasted with lots of malty goodness.  It is very rich and the balance is perfect.  Alcohol is very well hidden.  Aftertaste of sweet coffee and roasted malts. I think a lot of imperial stouts are over rated, but this lives up to the hype!

Pours a dark black color similar to motor oil.  Very little carbonation in the pour.  Very thin head that was brown in color.  Lasted 7 seconds.  Smells like chocolate and coffee.  Little bit of caramel  in the aroma.  Lots of coffee in the taste.  Quite delicious.  Some sweet caramel and chocolate. Mostly large blasts of coffee.  Weee.

Bottle from July 2011 poured into a snifter is dense black with a dark brown head.  Aromas are chocolate and coffee with a little bit of booze.  Taste is chocolate, coffee, and roasted malt, as the finish lingers, the chocolate becomes more pronounced.  Beer is sticky and thick with nice lacing on the glass.  High ABV is well hidden with some warmth noted.  Overall, this is what an Imperial Stout should be.
Great nutty aroma. This is intense on the palate. Lots of coffee flavor. The color is black and ok lacing.

(75 cl bottle from Toft Vin; Enjoyed on the occasion of the special date of November 11th 2011) Pours a tar black with little, toffee head that laces the glass. Aroma is dark, boozy and roasted. Creamy on the palate, soft carbonation, fat-bodied with a smooth, coffee finish. Taste is dark, filling, not too bitter, nor too sweet and dominated by coffee notes with some boozy smoothness and a slight hint of oxidation. Yes its rich but as I see it the Speedway Stout sacrifices a bit of complexity in favour of harmony, which is a fair enough tradeoff. Girlfriend says: "It has a pleasant taste. Maybe a bit too sour towards the end."
Its incredible, so complex and wanting for nothing, this is a perfect beer!

750ml bottle that poured a dark black/brown color with aromas of coffee, and chocolate.  Flavors include roasted malt, chocolate, coffee, and more coffee.  Absolutely amazing beer that didnt taste like a 12% sipper.
Zwart bier met een mooie beige schuimkraag. Geur van koffie, mout, veel gebrande geuren. Smaak van gebrande mout, koffie bitterheidje en een klein zoetje. Heel lekker.

Poured black, with a beige, lacing head. Coffee, ash, licorice, dark chocolate, oats in the delicious aroma. Sweet taste, which is matched with just the right amount of bitterness. Dry finish with licorice, ash, coffee in the aftertaste. This one is a monster.

Bottle @ home, courtesy of daknole. Thanks man! Deep black appearance with a creamy, dark brown head. Very roasty, dark chocolate malty, black espresso, mild vanilla, creamy, light caramel aroma. Very roasty, slightly burnt, dark chocolate, dark espresso, toasty, mild vanilla flavor. Roasty, deep chocolate aftertaste. Very smooth for 12%.

This beer is obnoxiously good. It is one of those beers which successfully pushes the boundaries past good beer, and into great beer. It goes over-the-top and succeeds, and creates one of those beers that is just utterly awesome. HUGE coffee flavors, sweet, buttery espresso, with bitter coffee notes, and some massive malty syrupy-ness. Perfect in so many ways. Caramel, vanilla, and coffee dominate this beer. Just so well-done.

Bouteille de 750ml. Merci Patrick et JB84. Ce classique est noir avec une mousse brune, disons quelle na pas fait sa réputation par sa robe ! Le nez est de café, de café et encore de café. Il y a aussi des fruits noirs qui viennent se frotter aux poils nasaux. Le grain rôti offre aussi des arômes de mélasse et de torréfaction. En bouche ce superbe stout déploie toute sa grandeur avec des saveurs des plus déconcertantes de café, de mélasse et ce coté fruité bien agréable. La texture est soyeuse. En fin de bouche il y cette amertume dalcool qui accroche. Un classique.

(Courtesy of JB84.  Thanks a lot John for this world class beer!)  Une superbe tête brune flotte sur un liquide à la robe profondément noire.  Le nez affirme sa spectaculaire verve après un certain temps : les parfums maltés se choquent à des effluves de café tandis que des vapeurs de réglisse surgissent des entrailles chocolatées et caramélisées du liquide.  Tout à fait superbe.  Au goût, lattaque est une ode à la beauté : les saveurs rôties, les flaveurs de café et le chocolat amer redéfinissent le style.  Lalcool saffirme avec une certaine timidité, les papilles commencent à être engourdies.  Des fruits foncés finissent par apparaître : les saveurs sont puissantes.  En bouche, le liquide possède une très belle densité : le corps est fort, bien structuré et soumis à un pétillement très doux.  La texture me semble liquoreuse et bien portante, quoique légèrement collante.  La finale est douce et chaude de notes torréfiées, justement longues et savoureuses.  Un très bon impérial stout brassé avec du café.
Pours an inky black with a huge tan head nice aroma of chocolate tobacco and booze. Nice flavor of chocolate, coffee and something else,nice chewy palate and warm finish nice.

Courtesy of Balázs, thanks!
Black beer, small but fine creamy head. Intensive aroma with coffee, chocolate, cocoa and peat, oat, vanilla, espresso, dark chocolate, tobacco. Complex body, full flavor, coffee, roasted grains, licorice, toffee, leather, dark chocolate. Stout orgasm.

UPDATED: OCT 11, 2012 Bottle, sample.
Black with a tan ring.
Aroma: chocolate, liqueur, licorice, some alcohol, but in a balanced way.
Taste: chocolate mousse, coffee, liqueur, cream, some sourish candy, a hint of ashes and wood.
Full-bodied, liqueur-ish, maybe sticky.
Huge and extremely well-balanced. Necessary to get a whole bottle of this.
Bottle.
Pitch black with a creamy chocolate  mousse head.
Aroma: coffee, fudge, chocolate.
Taste: mocha, coffee and chocolate, licorice, brown sugar, cocoa powder, liqueur like Irish cream or similar.
Very nice now, but will probably improve in the cellar.

Aroma- big coffee beans, mocha, chocolate, licorice, hops Appearance- black as black can be, big creamy off-white head, fantastic lacing Taste- espresso, gourmet coffee beans, chocolate, hop bitterness at last Palate- medium full, creamy, nearly perfect for this particular beer Overall- Huge coffee features, nice texture, fantastic hop profile and an incredibly well-balanced formula completes this historical imperial stout
UPDATED: NOV 4, 2011 Aroma is deep roasty liquorice, mocca, other coffee and more. Flavour is deep coffee mocca roasty liquorice, very bitter, lasting for ever. Beautifull!

Courtesy of Balázs, thanks!
Nagyon mély, fekete színe van, hiába tartjuk erős fény elé, akkor sem látunk át rajta. Habja igen krémes, termetes, világos barna és igen hosszú életű. Fantasztikus illata van, nemes, csokoládé likőrös, frissen darált kávébabos, aszalt gyümölcsös és zabkekszes. Az első kortynál olyan érzése van az embernek, mintha egy minőségi Sacher tortába harapna az ember, amihez egy korty, nagyon finom, frissen főzött kávét is inna, amibe pár cseppnyi különleges likőrt is csempésztek volna. Aztán lassan elúsznak az édeskés ízek és csak a pörkölt kávé és a szinte 100 százalékos fekete csokoládé marad meg. Sűrű, olajos teste van, közepesen buborékos. Utóíze csokisan, alkoholosan kezd, aztán a legvége kávés, kesernyés és igen száraz lesz. Ez a sör térdre kényszeríti és elsöpri az embert, ami először elandalít aztán kegyetlenül lemészárol. Isteni!

UPDATED: NOV 9, 2014 woo hoo! This beer is dedicated to my 500th review and the successes of a good friend!  Whew, anticipation!  Espresso black with a reddish medium-brown head.  Rich, thick head, fine bubbles.  Aroma is of huge chocolate (light milk)  with a touch of bark, molasses, bbq, raisin even!  Body is thick with a nice creamy carbonation.  Flavor brings out more of that cold-pressed coffee and an alcohol burn.  woody, much less chocolate than the aroma.  Lovely pine and forest hops with a perfect, big bitterness that only lingers lightly with an equal amount of coffee.  Really well brewed, doesnt taste like it has oats in it, but other than that, near perfect.  Great.

2011 vintage, foil wrapped 750ml into a DFH signature glass.

A - Pitch black body with a huge dark mocha head. Tons of lacing and retention. Looks pretty damn good.
